loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a married business lady with two children. She makes and sells sandals commonly referred to as ‘Maasai’ sandals. The  business has been running for the last ten years. She was employed and started the business in small scale.

Regina was introduced to Milango by her friends. She is currently applying for a loan of Ksh 30,000 to buy shoe soles, cream and leather. Her future ambition is to open a large shop, despite the challenge of price fluctuations and some customers not paying on time. Regina will use the extra income to expand the operations of her business.

loans.use: buy shoes materials

loans.name: Houéfa Mondoukpè Prisca

texts.fr: Houéfa Mondoukpè Prisca est âgée de 26 ans et est mariée à un certain Karim. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Houéfa Mondoukpè Prisca et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Houéfa Mondoukpè Prisca vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Houéfa Mondoukpè Prisca a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a une dizaine d'année, Houéfa Mondoukpè Prisca mène comme activité la vente de produits vivriers à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux charges du ménage. Houéfa Mondoukpè Prisca s'approvisionne au Bénin. Ce quatrième crédit permettra certainement à Houéfa Mondoukpè Prisca de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Les trois crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Houéfa Mondoukpè Prisca is 26 ans and is married to a man named Karim. They care for their 2 children, who both go to school. Houéfa Mondoukpè Prisca and her husband both take care of the family financially. Houéfa Mondoukpè Prisca lives with her husband and her children. She quit school at the secondary level. Houéfa Mondoukpè Prisca has been selling food products at home for about 10 years, which has enabled her to contibute to household expenses. She buys these items in Benin. This fourth loan will most certainly help Houéfa Mondoukpè Prisca enhance her business so she can better meet the needs of her customers. Her first 3 loans have been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan has two children. She runs a taxi transport business to earn a living. Besides that, she is employed. She has been in the business for nine years and has one employee. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to grow her business. She has also expanded her business because she has been trained on business management skills. She hopes to operate another company in a different location in the future. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to repair her vehicles.

loans.use: to repair her vehicles.

loans.name: A'ahed

texts.en:
A'ahed is 26 years old. He is a married man and has two daughters. He is a wedding and other occasion planner. His job is to provide chairs, sound speakers, and any other equipment that the customers need. This activity results in his only income. He earns $500 monthly. 

A'ahed asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy other equipment like video equipment and a dance stand. This will help him a lot to improve his business and move forward in this field. A'ahed is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy equipment like video equipment and a dance stand.

loans.name: Emma

texts.fr: Âgée de 37 ans, Emma est mariée à un couturier du nom de Guy. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Emma vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Emma vend des condiments à son domicile et des façon ambulante depuis cinq ans et des cuillères et des boules d'akassa (pâte de maïs fermenté) de façon secondaire; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Emma s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. La clientèle de Emma devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Emma sollicite une troisième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de maïs et des condiments.

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en:
Radhika is 53-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in a small village in Koraput district, Odisha. She has two sons and both are working in a private company. She owns a general store where she sells ladies' fashion items, cosmetics for ladies and dressmaking supplies. She also does tailoring and gives training to others. She wants to start a ladies cloth store where she will sell cloth only for females. 

Radhika has requested a loan of 35,000 INR to buy female cloth in bulk to resell. She hopes to do well in her business, and she would like to thank Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy cloth for ladies to resell

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.en:
Herlinda sells cosmetics and perfume throughout her community. She usually travels door to door offering her products but also sells some from her home. She allows her clients to pay her for their purchases in weekly installments in order to maker her products much more accessible.

She is seeking this loan in order to invest in new merchandise. She hopes that with increased capital she will be able to buy wholesale and sell for much more profit. Herlinda has four kids, three of which are still in school. She hopes that by generating more income she can continue to pay for their educations and make improvements to their home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy new merchandise at wholesale prices

loans.name: Hamna

texts.en:
Hanna started her kiosk before she joined MBK as a member. Most of her loan $50 loan from MBK will be used to stock up her inventory for her kiosk, while the remainder from the loan will be used to buy fertilizers for agriculture. If she successfully upgrades her kiosk, her daily income will increase from $5 to $7.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard , Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To help her buy goods for her kiosk

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.en: On May 5,2007, Ismatullo’s wife bore a daughter. It is a big happiness for his family because while they had one son already, they could not have more children for 20 years. The doctors had to deliver the baby by cesarean section to keep her alive. To have enough milk for the little girl, Ismatullo purchased a dairy cow. Now Ismatullo has a plan to reconstruct his house and extend the space for his household. His request for a loan is to purchase hogs and sheep. Ismatullo has been working for 23 years at a music school. He teaches children to play the national instrument, the “doyra”. He likes his job but says that livestock is the business of his family. It is passed from one generation to another.

loans.use: Puchase hogs and a sheep

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. hails from western Uganda and a mother of four children. She is a humble lady and very honest. She is a Life in Africa member and is one of the most dedicated members of the community. She works as a cleaner and also does some handicraft work. She has been a Life in Africa member for the last two years. She previously requested a loan of $480 for the purpose of buying and selling produce, a business which she has been operating very profitably.

Rose is among Life in Africa's best borrowers. She has never had any complications in paying back her loan despite her many responsibilities as a single parent raising and paying school fees for her children. Her business has dipped slightly because of paying school fees for one of her children who is in senior four and about to sit for the national examinations.

However, Rose still feels that she should continue with her business. She is therefore seeking a $150 loan to restock her business. She will be able to repay this loan once given in four months

Below is her budget:

(The individual items are listed in Ugandan shillings and the total has been converted to US$)

3 sacks of beans @ 80,000…………………….240,000/=

Transport from the truck to the store …………6000/=

3 bags @ 1000…………………………………3000 / =

Others…………………………………………..1000/=

Total …..................250,000 ($150)

loans.use: Buying more produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Fofonè Emmanuel

texts.fr: Mr. K. Fofone Emmanuel was born on December 31st, 1976 in Agou; he lives in Lome in the Nakafu district.  He is single but is responsible for the three children of his sister and brother.  He is a re-salesman of cloth (tissues), which is a business that is proving successful.  With the end of year celebrations approaching, he wants to enhance his stock and buy new materials for women, but requires a loan of $600 in order to do this.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of clothing for women

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: "If not for LAPO what would I have done’’ says Mrs. Kehinde A. who is very proud of her financial backing from LAPO. She lives in Mushin in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and clothes.  She has been in business since 2002. She needs the loan to buy more provision, foodstuffs and clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs and clothes to sell

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee is a hard-working, dedicated woman who puts a lot of effort into what she does because she wants to create a promising future. She is currently single but in the future she wants to establish a stable family. Right now her biggest desire is to enjoy every day alongside her loved ones. She lives in a small home with her sister and is always lovingly taking care of and spoiling her nieces and nephews. To follow her dreams, a year ago she decided to sell sugar cane juice which she sells by displaying glasses of the juice to people. Haydee is very happy because she is seeing the fruits of her labor reflected in the income she brings in. Sometimes she doesn't sell very much but she compensates for this on other days. She is very thankful to her father who encouraged her to buy the necessary items to begin this small business. She is applying for a loan so that she can increase sells by buying more sugar cane to make her delicious juice.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Haydee, es una dama muy trabajadora y se desempeña con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo porque quiere forjarse un futuro prominente. Aún es soltera y desea en un futuro establecer una familia sólida.Ahora su gran anhelo es disfrutar de cada uno de los días en compañía de sus seres queridos actualmente comparte las instalaciones de una pequeña morada con su hermana y siempre está al cuidado de sus pequeños sobrinos a los que cuida con amor y siempre les engríe.Para continuar con sus anhelos ha decidido hace un año ha vender jugo de caña, que ofrece mostrando sus vasitos a las personas, está muy contenta porque ahora observa el fruto de su trabajo reflejado en las ganancias que recibe, aunque existan ocasiones en los que la venta es mínima éste hecho se compensa con otros días en los que no se da basto ella sola.Está muy agradecida con su papá, porque fue él quién la animó a comprar lo necesario para la implementación de este pequeño negocio. Solicita un préstamo para incrementar sus ventas con la compra de mayor caña para la oferta de su delicioso jugo.

loans.use: A boost of capital will increase sells.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
Specialized in the wholesaling and retailing of anarcade nuts (as cashew nuts are known in Benin,) processed and ready to eat, Mrs. Antoinette H. has already been granted four loans. She has always reimbursed her loans without difficulty. Born in 1966 in Cotonou, she is married and the mother of 3 children for whom she is still responsible. Only her children are photographed here because Mrs. H. was off making a delivery at the market when we called to see her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Spécialisée dans la vente en gros et au détail de noix d’anarcade (désignées sous le nom d'Acajou au Bénin) transformées et consommables, elle vient a été octroyé quatre fois. Les remboursements de crédit ne souffrent d’aucun problème à son niveau. Née en 1966 à Cotonou, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont elle a la charge. Seules ses enfants se retrouvent sur la photo parce qu'elle était à une livraison au marché lors de la visite sur le lieu d'activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of 600 kilos of unprocessed anarcade (cashew) nuts

Achat de 600 kg de noix d’anarcade à l’étape brute.

loans.name: Munevera

texts.en: Munevera lives together  with her husband  in Križ, a small village near  Visoko. They have a stand at the market  and they sell clothes. Their monthly income is  not enough for  both of them  and  their  2 children  who are  9 and  10 years old. Munevera wants to invest  this loan  in the amount  of  US$ 925 in clothing  in order to  expand  the business  and secure  money for her family.

loans.use: Invest in clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla R. P. sells chickens and roosters in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She wakes up at 4 a.m. to go buy live chickens and roosters and take them to sell at the Micaela Bastidas Market Number 4. There she rents a stand where she prepares the poultry to sell.

Merla is 55 years old and is a widow with six children. She works very hard and is happy she has been able to help her family. Her hard work helped send her children to school and rewarded her with greater independence and decision making in her family.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Merla is requesting a loan of $725 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to invest in her business. She also owns some land and would some day like to raise her own poultry.

loans.use: To invest in her poultry-selling business

loans.name: Hekima

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Hekima M.. She is not married and has 1 blessed child aged 12. She has 1 dependent who lives with her because she is a street child. In 2003, Hekima established her tailoring business. She is assisted by her. Hekima has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock of boutique. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilitation as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock for the boutique.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en: H. Dilafruz is 28-years old. She is a widow with three children. Her oldest son is in school. Dilafruz is a market vendor. She is the only bread-winner in the family, and she works hard selling kids' clothing in the market. She has been in this business for 5 years. Dilafruz is requesting a loan of $800 so she can diversify her stock and have her wares satisfy the needs of people at various income levels. This will increase her customer base. Dilafruz's business is stable and allows her to keep her children and work for their future. She thanks all supporting her and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner as she has done with her previous loans.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing for upgrading stock

loans.name: Afolabi

texts.en:
F. Afolabi makes interior decorations such as curtains and bed sheets. She studied this craft for a year and has been in business since 2006. F. lives in Egun, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 41 years old and married with 5 children.

F. requests a loan of US$875 to buy more curtains, curtain poles, and bed sheets. She sends a big thank you to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more interior decorations and bed sheets for sales.

loans.name: Thi Ninh's Group

texts.vi:
Ms Tô thị Ninh is 49 years old. She likes participating in SEDA program. She raises livestock. She is requesting a loan of 2.950.000 VND. She also provides opportunities for others T. profit from her family business as well. Her family income is 150.000 VND a day. Her group is composed of:

  • Ms Dương thị Văn who's requesting 2.950.000 VND T. invest in her plastic recycling business.
  • Mr Lưu văn Thạch who's requesting 2.950.000 VND. He sells fruits & flowers
  • Ms Kiều thị Châm MS who's requesting 2.950.000 VND. She sells fruits & flowers
  • Ms Đinh thị Xuân MS who's requesting 2.950.000 VND. She collects & sells waqste material.
  • Mr Nguyễn văn Hùng who's requeswting 2.950.000 VND. He raises livestock

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer.

    Cô Tô thị Ninh năm nay 49 tuổi,MS 030021 Cô rất thích tham gia vay vốn của chương trình.Ngoài việc chăn nuôi,Cô còn vay vốn với mức 2.950.000 VND để hỗ trợ cho việc mua ngô về để nổ bỏng,cô còn tạo ra nhiều việc làm cho các chị em khác trong thôn có thêm thu nhập từ công việc sản xuất của gia đình cô.Mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình từ 150.000 VND / ngày.Trong nhóm cô còn có

  • chị Dương thị Văn MS 030022 vay mức 2.950.000 VND để kinh doanh đồ nhựa
  • anh Lưu văn Thạch MS 030024 vay mức 2.950.000 VND về làm bỏng miến và đi chợ buôn hoa quả
  • chị Kiều thị Châm MS 030025 vay mức 2.950.000 VND để buôn hoa quả
  • chị Đinh thị Xuân MS 030026 vay mức 2.950.000 VND để kinh doanh sắt vụn
  • anh Nguyễn văn Hùng MS 030027 vay mức 2.950.000 VND để chăn nuôi

loans.use: raise livestock

loans.name: Mtumwa's Sitaki Shari Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa is 34 years old. She is divorced. She has been a clothes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 8:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $145 from her sales.

Mtumwa is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Khadia and Jaalia.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracia a la Señora: Lucia Báez de Oviedo, quien se enteró acerca del programa y de la fundación gracias a las integrantes del comité “Mujeres en Acción”, del mismo Barrio Pto. Pabla de la ciudad de Lambaré.

Podemos hablar de alguna de las integrantes en este caso de: La Sra. Basilia L. de M., quien es viuda desde hace 5 años, tiene 4 hijos, todos ya mayores de edad, casados con hijos.

Basilia es una señora muy colaboradora con la comunidad, pertenece al grupo de oración legión de María de la Capilla Niño Salvador del Mundo del Barrio Puerto Pabla de la ciudad de Lambaré. Además visita a los enfermos del Barrio llevándoles una palabra de aliento, y la comunión.

Ella aprendió en un curso a realizar bordados con Hilos, tipo Crochet, como: ropas para Bebés, medias, guantes, zapatitos, gorras, para recién nacidos, además de prendas para damas como Blusas, polleras, vestidos, camisillas, etc.

Las actividades de las otras integrantes se detallan a continuación:

Lucia Báez de Oviedo ( Confección y Vta de Banderas).

Sonia Liz M. Díaz (Conf y Vta de Ropas)

Basilia L. de M. (Bordados de Crochet y Ao Po´i )

Idalina C. (Bordados de Chochet )

Luisa M. de Cardozo (Vta de Comidas)

Gregoria S. de Cañiza (Vta de Cosméticos)

Clotilde E. de Ibarra (Despensa)

Bertilda B. V. (Vta de Empanadas)

Aurelia V. Díaz ( Vta de Frutas y Verduras)

Fortunata González (Despensa)

Maura C. Coronel (Conf y Vta de Ropas)

Cirila V. de B. (Vta de Prod de Limpieza

) Vilma C. de Báez (Conf y Vta de Ao Poi)

Rosa E. Barrientos (Chrochet)

Gabriela C. (Vta de conf y Vta de Ropas)

Teodora R. de Ferreira (Vta de Frutas y Verduras)

María Damiana M. ( Vta Comidas)

Myrian Felipa P. de Delgado (Vtas de Helados)
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Mrs. Lucia B. de Oviedo, who learned about the program and the foundation thanks to the members of the "Mujeres en Accion" (Women in Action) group, from the same neighborhood, Puerto Pabla, in the city of Lambare.

We can talk about some of the members, in this case of: Mrs. Basilia L. de M., who was widowed 5 years ago and has 4 children, all of whom are already grown and married with children.

Basilia is a woman very involved in the community. She belongs to the prayer legion group María de la Capilla Niño Salvador del Mundo of the Puerto Pabla neighborhood in the city of Lambare. Additionally, she visits the ill in the neighborhood, bringing them words of hope and communion.

She learned in a course how to embroider with thread, crochet style, things such as: baby clothing, stockings, gloves, little shoes, hats for newborns, in addition to women's clothing such as blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, etc.

The activities of the other members are listed below:

Lucia Báez de Oviedo (Production and Sale of Flags)

Sonia Liz M. Díaz (Production and Sale of Clothing)

Basilia L. de M. (Crochet and Ao Poi (traditional Paraguayan weaving))

Idalina C. (Crochet )

Luisa M. de Cardozo (Food Sales)

Gregoria S. de Cañiza (Cosmetics Sales)

Clotilde E. de Ibarra (General Store)

Bertilda B. V. (Sale of Empanadas)

Aurelia V. Díaz (Fruit and Vegetable Sales)

Fortunata González (General Store)

Maura C. Coronel (Production and Sale of Clothing)

Cirila V. de B. (Sale of Cleaning Products)

Vilma C. de Báez (Production and Sale of Ao Poi (traditional Paraguayan weaving))

Rosa E. Barrientos (Crochet)

Gabriela C. (Production and Sale of Clothing)

Teodora R. de Ferreira (Fruit and Vegetable Sales)

María Damiana M. (Food Sales)

Myrian Felipa P. de Delgado (Ice Cream Sales)


Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, cotton thread, food products such as sugar, oil, salt, meat, dairy products, canned goods, sodas, candy; to also buy cosmetics, clothing, and footware

loans.name: Mabousso

texts.fr: MABOUSSO G. VEND DIVERS MATERIEL DE CONSTRUCTION AU MARCHE DE THIES DEPUIS 5 ANS. IL EST MARIE ET PERE DE 2 ENFANTS.
texts.en:
MABOUSSO G. has been selling various construction materials at the THIES marketplace for five years. He is married and the father of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell construction material

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en: Shoira N. is a hard-working and energetic mother who has been selling clothes of various colors, styles, and sizes at in her local market for over five years.  Her high quality workmanship and good taste have attracted many new customers to her business, and now Shoira is hoping that her business may continue to grow.  In order to achieve this goal, she is requesting a loan of $800, which will be used to purchase a wider variety of clothes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Las Tres Hermanas Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el grupo las Tres Hermanas, somos mujeres muy luchadoras y que nos conocemos hace mucho tiempo y nos llevamos muy bien casi como hermanas por eso es el nombre de nuestro grupo, somos muy felices con nuestras actividades diaras las cuales nos ayudan para cubrir con los gastos de nuestras familias, nuestro grupo se integra asi:
Maria V.: soy la cordinadora del grupo tengo varios años de fabricar tortillassoy madre soltera y de mi dependen mis dos hijos.
Isidra R.: ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas, tambien vende mercaderia, ella sale a vender su producto de forma ambulante en zonas vecinas y de esta manera se gana la vida, ella es viuda entonces la carga del sustento del hogar es para ella sola.
Reina F.: ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de piñatas, tambien ella labora dos dias a la semana en una casa como empleada domestica, ella le ayuda a su esposo para el mantenimiento del hogar. todas nosotras necesitamos este credito para sacar adelante nuestros pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
Hello we are the group Tres Hermanas. We are fighting women and have known each other for a long time. We get along very well, almost as sisters, and for this reason it is the name of our group. We are very happy with our daily activities, which help us to cover our family expenses. Our group also includes: Maria V.: I am the Coordinator of the group have several years experience making tortillas. I am a single mother, and my two children depend on me. Isidra R.: She manufactures and sells sweets and also merchandise. She sells her product on the street in neighboring areas and thus earns a living. She is a widow and the burden of maintaining the household falls on her alone. Reina F.: She manufactures and sells piñatas. She also works two days a week at a home as a housekeeper. She helps her husband with the maintenance of the home. We all need this credit to move forward with our small businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Barbara's Group

texts.en:
Barbara S., 43, is the leader of Kisimba Group in Lugazi. She is a single mother of 5 and she cares for 3 orphans wholeheartedly. Barbara has three businesses; she sells green bananas, both in bunches and in heaps, and she sells fuel from a pump (mostly paraffin and petrol) as well as having a restaurant where she prepares local dishes for her customers in Kisimba.

Recently, she also opened up an outlet where she sells hairpieces and hair products which is so far doing well. From her savings, Barbara has been able to buy a plot of land. She owns three cows and freely pays her children’s school fees. She is very grateful for the loans from Pearl Microfinance.

loans.use: Mostly buying foodstuffs for her restaurant, but also fuel and green bananas for her businesses

loans.name: Glenda Elyzabeth

texts.es: La sra. Glenda es una mujer que con mucha dedicación ha logrado establecer su negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos, el cual inicio con ayuda de su esposo y su mama que ha sido para ella una madre emprendedora. Doña Glenda tiene 32 años de edad,  reside en villa reconciliación, con dos hermosos hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad, ellos están cursando la primaria en el colegio del barrio, su esposo trabaja en un taxi que tiene. Con este crédito es su quinta solicitud en Afodenic que ha sido de mucho beneficio para mantener su negocio, con esta solicitud del préstamo va a invertir en ropa variada de adulto y niños para surtir el inventario y poder atraer mas clientes. Sus planes a corto plazo es poder mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Glenda is an extremely dedicated woman who has established a clothing and cosmetic sales business. She started this business with the help of her husband and her mother, who has been very hard-working. Glenda is 32 years old and lives in villa reconciliación with her two beautiful children. They are 7 and 10 years old, and both children attend the local primary school. Glenda's husband works as a taxi driver and owns his car. This loan is Glenda's fifth with Afodenic, and all of her loans have been very beneficial for her business. With his loan Glenda will invest in a variety of clothing for adults and children, in order to increase her inventory and attract more customers. Her short-term plans are to improve the infrastructure of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Ambignakola Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe AMBIGNAKOLA sont en majorité des femmes mariées qui,  avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et  5 enfants  vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies  dans le village de ZANFINA, sous préfecture de KONOBOUGOU, dans la préfecture de BAROUELI, région de SEGOU république du Mali.
 Elles se sont connues à travers des activités traditionnelles qu’elles organisent chaque mois dans le village. Ce groupe fait essentiellement l’achat vente des amandes de Karité préalablement traitées. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont intégré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter 4 tonnes  d’amande de karité  auprès de leurs camarades femmes de ZANFINA et des villages environnants. Ces amandes sont revendues sur le marché de FANA aux grossistes et au comptant à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent obtenir avec ce prêt un bénéfice de  30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour acheter des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The members of the group AMBIGNAKOLA are for the most part married women who average 37 years of age and 5 children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families in the village of ZANFINA (in KONOBOUGOU sub-prefecture, of BAROUELI prefecture) in the SEGOU region, Republic of Mali. They know one another through traditional activities that they organize each month in the village. This gourp essentially buys and sells already-processed karité kernels (shea nuts).

Concerned about satisfying the needs of their customers, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their sixth group loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

These women intend to buy four tonnes of karité kernels from their women friends in ZANFINA and in surrounding villages. These kernels are resold at the FANA marketplace to wholesalers and in cash to customers composed of men and woman.

With this loan, they intend to make a profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to buy some small ruminants.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy karité kernels

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama G. is a 30-year-old divorced mother of a single boy who is in school. Ama lives with her son in a rented apartment in a community called Anyinem. It is located in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite an appreciable number is also involved in trading and other business activities.

Ama is a hairdresser by profession. She does both plaiting and perming. She says she graduated from apprenticeship training eight years ago and has since trained five young ladies in hairdressing who have started their own businesses. Apart from hairdressing, Ama also sells assorted soaps through hawking house-to-house in the early morning before she resumes work at her salon.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy hairdressing equipment, fashion accessories, artificial human hair, pomades and other materials she will need to serve her clients satisfactorily. She hopes to increase her income to enable her save more to support her son’s education. She is a member of the Patience Trust Bank group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing materials and fashion accessories

loans.name: Melva

texts.es:
La señora Melva, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Laureles II”, vive en el Jr. José Carlos Mariategui Nº 152, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 47 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que todavía depende de ella.

Inicio su negocio con  un primer préstamo de S/. 200.00, por iniciativa propia  y con el apoyo de su esposo emprendió su  propio negocio de venta de abarrotes en pequeñas cantidades.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, situada en su misma casa.

Con este préstamo de S/1,000.00 que pagara a un  plazo de 04  meses, lo invertirá comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Es ella quien  toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más independiente, segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Melva, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Melva belongs to "Los Laureles II” Communal Bank and she lives at Jr. José Carlos Mariategui Nº 152, in the District of la Banda de Shilcayo, in the San Martín area. She lives with her partner, is 47 years old and is the mother of 3 children, 1 of whom still depends on her. She began her business with her first loan of S/ 200.00, by her own initiative, and with the support of her husband, she launched her own business selling groceries in small quanitites. Currently, she continues with the same business, which is run out of her own home. With this loan of S/ 1,000.00 that she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of more products to diversify her business, such as rice and sugar in sacks, toilet paper packs, milk, boxes of canned fish, personal hygiene and home cleaning supplies, soda packs and various products to keep her customers happy. She is the one who makes decisions regarding the earnings of her business. Personally, she feels more independent, self-assured and responsible by making her payments. Melva expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a business owner and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items: rice, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc. All wholesale.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 54 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos; Geral de 16 años y Dayana de 9 años, ya que sus hijas Mitzi de 30 y Lisset de 25 conformaron sus propias familias. Él se viene dedicando al manejo de un minibús brindado transporte de pasajeros con diferentes rutas en la ciudad de Lima, trabajo que le significa una mejora en la calidad de vida de su familia. Aún así, su esposa lo ayuda en los gastos con el pequeño negocio que tiene en su casa, que es una bodega - restaurante, donde atiende a los pensionistas que anticipan la paga para que ella les prepare sus deliciosos platillos, siendo un buen negocio, ya que sabe cuántas porciones preparar sin desperdiciar o sobrar, además que la cocina le encanta y ella no lo ve como un trabajo sino como un pasatiempo que le gusta realizar. Es así que trabajando unidos sacaron adelante a sus cuatro hijos, los cuales ahora los apoyan en sus momentos libres. Lorenzo y su esposa esperan en el futuro hacer crecer su bodega e implementar mejor su restaurante para así cubrir los gastos de sus hijos con los que viven actualmente. Este es su primer préstamo individual con MFP, y sus antecedentes son de un cliente muy responsable y puntual. Con el dinero solicitado hará refaccionar algunas fallas del minibus que maneja y apoyará a su esposa para que compre más cantidad de ingredientes para la preparación de los platillos que ofrece en su restaurante.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 54. He lives with his wife and children. Geral is 16, Dayana is 9. Mitzi, 30 and Lisset, 25 have started their own families. Lorenzo drives a minibus for people throughout the city of Lima for a living. His job gives his family a better quality of life. Even so, his wife helps with expenses with the small warehouse-restaurant business she operates from home. Because it is a good business, retirees go to her restaurant where she waits on them and prepares delicious meals. Lorenzo's wife knows the just right portions to serve. She loves to work in the kitchen and doesn't consider it a chore. By working together Lorenzo and his wife were able to get their four children ahead. Now, their four children help them out whenever they can. In the future, Lorenzo and his wife want to expand the warehouse and improve their restaurant in order to cover the costs of their children, who live them. This is his first individual loan with MFP, and his record is that of a responsible and punctual client. With the loan, Lorenzo will make small repairs to the minibus and will support his wife in buying more ingredients for the dishes she serves in her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Minibus repair and purchase of ingredients for wife's restaurant

loans.name: Abida Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Abida baji operates a sewing business. She sews clothes to pay off the school fees of her kids. She is a 42-year-old married lady and has been a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan, for the past 18 years. She got her education up to the 5th standard, but couldn’t continue her studies further due to the limited financial resources of her parents. Her husband's name is N. A.. He works at a factory on a monthly salary. She is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. Her older son is a janitor. The others are enrolled in school and are getting an education.

Abida baji has successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries because her son wants to run a grocery shop when he comes home from work.

Abida baji is the leader of this group of three women from her locality. Zubaida baji and Irshad baji both want a loan to buy bed sheets to sell. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries to start a grocery shop

loans.name: Nueva Alternativa Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Angelina P. P., D. 31 años D. edad, vive en la zona D. Caja D. Agua en San Juan D. Lurigancho. Ella y su pareja están en la espera D. su primer bebé que es la ilusión D. sus vidas, el motivo D. sus esfuerzos y el aliciente para el logro D. sus metas.

Ella es socia activa D. la Alcancía Comunal “Nueva Alternativa” y actualmente es la Presidenta D. su grupo (en la fotografía la observamos D. pié), elegida democráticamente, en reconocimiento a sus virtudes como mujer emprendedora.

Tiene un año y medio trabajando con EDAPROSPO, inició su negocio D. venta D. útiles con muy poca mercadería, en su casa. Poco a poco y con la ayuda D. los préstamos solicitados a EDAPROSPO ella pudo comprar más mercadería, mejorar las instalaciones D. su casa para convertirla en una Librería, luego adquirió una computadora con la empezó a brindar servicios D. Internet; en un año, con esfuerzo, sacrificio y mucho ahorro, ella pudo aumentar D. una a cinco  computadoras para el servicio D. Internet.

El préstamo actual lo destinará a la compra D. 2 nuevas computadoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Angelina P. P. is 31 years old and lives in the zone of Caja D. Agua in San Juan D. Lurigancho. She and her partner are awaiting their first baby that is the illusion of their lives, the reason for their efforts and the encouragement to achieve their goals.

She is an active member of the Alcancia Communal "New Alternative" and is currently the President of the group (is the one standing up in the picture). She was democratically elected in recognition of her capacity as an entrepreneur woman.

She has been working for the last one and a half year with EDAPROSPO. She started her business at home selling few school supplies. Little by little and with the help of EDAPROSPO loans, she was able to buy more supplies, remodel her house into a book store, and then she bought a computer and began to proviD. internet services. Within a year with effort and saving a lot, she was able to increase from one to five computers with internet services.

She is asking for a loan to buy two new computers.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 new computers, school supplies and improvement of the business

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is married with three children.  She is 43 years old and sells notebooks and textbooks in her shop.  Abigail hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more note books and text books to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: Purchase more books to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 50 años y 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Desde hace muchos años, Charito se dedica a la venta de leña, en sus inicios nos cuenta que le fue un poco bajo en sus ventas, pero con el tiempo ya sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, conocían su negocio y sus ventas aumentaron. Se inicio con S/. 300.00 y poco a poco fue ahorrando, en la actualidad complementó   su negocio con la venta de  juanes, ubicada en su misma casa.

Uno de sus sueños y metas por lograr, es implementar una bodega grande de abarrotes, para generar más ingresos y aportar económicamente dentro de su hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará 2,780 unidades de leña. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en insumos para preparar sus juanes como: arroz   y pollo en kilos, colorantes  y hojas de bijao. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Isabel belongs to the Community Bank of Entrepreneurial Women in the District of Moyobamba, San Martin Province, in the Department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 50 years old, and has one child that is still dependent on her. For many years Charito has worked selling firewood. When she began, she tells us, her sales were a little low but with time once her friends, neighbors, and family learned of her business her sales grew. She began with 300 Soles and little by little continued to save. Now she has added to her business with the sale of juanes [leafy packets stuffed with rice, chicken, and olives] from her own house. One of her dreams and goals to achieve is to start a large grocery store in order to generate more income and contribute economically in her home. With this loan of 1,200 Soles she will buy 2,780 units of firewood. Part of the money will also be invested in supplies to prepare the juanes, like rice, chicken by the kilo, food colors, and bijao [an Amazonian plant] leaves. These days she feels like a very fulfilled woman with more hopes of reaching her dreams and making them real. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her begin her business and also for helping many other women who want to succeed in business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 2780 units of firewood and supplies to prepare her juanes

loans.name: Magda De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Magda tiene la edad de 39 años, reside en el barrio  Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua, casada y con cuatro hijos mayores. Junto con su esposo ha logrado poner un negocio de destace de cerdo el cual lleva nueve años en el negocio en el destace. Inicio comprando poca cantidad pero luego ha venido invirtiendo. Con este crédito quiere  comprar cerdo y poder incrementar sus ventas, el cual le generara buenas ganancias. Sus planes es pode seguir creciendo en ventas, a si como ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Doña Magda is 39 years of age and lives in the Sabana Grande (Great Savannah) neighborhood of the capital of Manuagua. She is married and has four older children. Together with her husband she has been able to start a business butchering pigs which they have been doing for nine years. She started buying small quantities but later began investing. With this loan she wants to buy pigs so she can increase her sales which would generate good profits. Her plans are to be able to continue increasing her sales so she can help her children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Bartolinas Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal “Juan Pablo” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Bartolinas” que recientemente se conformo con 10 integrantes, por la necesidad de incrementar su capital de trabajo, todas las integrantes del grupo cuentan con diversos negocios, algunas se dedican al tejido de mantas, otras tienen tiendas de barrio, y otras venden café, juguetes, material de escritorio. Ellas necesitan el préstamo para fortalecer sus negocios comprando materia prima (lana, cordel) y mercadería (dulces, carritos, hojas).
A ellas les agrada mucho que a parte del crédito puedan traer a sus hijos al consultorio y recibir orientación en el manejo de sus negocios.
texts.en:
The “Bartolinas” Communal Association is located at the “Juan Pablo” Focal Center. The group started up recently with 10 members because of the necessity to increase their working capital. All of the members of the group have different businesses. Some make shawls, others have neighborhood stores, and others sell coffee, toys, and stationary supplies. They need the loan to strengthen their businesses by buying materials (wool, yarn) and merchandise (sweets, toy cars, paper). They all really like the fact that, apart from obtaining credit, they can bring their children to group meetings and receive training about how to manage their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and merchandise

loans.name: Adjouavi

texts.fr: H. Adjouavi est née vers les années 1952 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Adjouavi est mariée à EGBETOHOKPO Mathias, un commerçant. Adjouavi et Mathias ont 5 enfants, tous scolarisés. Cette famille réside à Gbèdjromédé un quartier populaire de la ville Cotonou. Adjouavi vend la pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce tomate et de poissons frits. Adjouavi vend aussi de piments secs qu’elle achète au Ghana, pays frontalier au Bénin et de l’huile d’arachide. Grâce à ses activités, Adjouavi arrive à soutenir son mari dans les dépenses du ménage. Adjouavi s’approvisionne en maïs, poissons, condiments de sauce et huile d'arachide à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Adjouavi avait des problèmes de santé qui ont épuisé son fonds de commerce. C'est pourquoi Adjouavi s'est adressé à ALIDé en 2008 pour renforcer son capital et relancer ses activités. Dans la même optique, Adjouavi sollicite aujourd'hui encore l'appui financier de ALIDé pour ses activités.
texts.en:
H. Adjouavi was born around 1952 in Cotonou,  the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is married to EGBETOHOKPO Mathias, a shopkeeper.  Adjouavi and Mathias have five children who are all in school.  This family resides in Gbèdjromédé, a working-class district of the city of Cotonou.  She sells cornmeal mash served with tomato sauce and fried fish.  She also sells peanut oil and dried chili peppers, which she buys in Ghana, a country near Benin.  Thanks to her business, Adjouavi manages to support her husband in covering household expenses.  She stocks up on corn, fish, sauce condiments, and peanut oil at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin.  In 2008, Adjouavi inquired with ALIDé to bolster her capital and to reinvigorate her business.  With the same thing in mind now, she's again requesting ALIDé financial support for her business. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut oil, corn, fresh fish, sauce condiments, charcoal, packaging for cornmeal mash, and canned beverages

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania es una mujer muy activa  y emprendedora, tiene 32 años de edad, esta casada y tiene  2 hijos menores de edad, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él es albañil. Tania es una socia alegre que le gusta siempre colaborar en todo, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces”, desde hace 7 años,  su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en golosinas. Con este préstamo de 1400 soles, ella invertirá en la compra de madera, listones y calaminas para arreglar su negocio y de esta manera dar buena imagen a su negocio. Su meta es comprarse una exhibidora para poner pasteles y algunos otros postre, también quisiera vender helados.
texts.en:
Tania is a very active and enterprising woman. She is 32 years old, is married and has 2 underage children. She has a small grocery store and has the support of her husband who is a mason. Tania is a very cheerful and active member of Communal Bank “Mujeres Audaces” which she has been a part of for 7 years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, that she used to buy candy. With the new loan of 1400 soles, she will use it to buy lumber, planks and bars to fix her business as it would give it a better appearance. Her goal is to buy a new display case to put cakes and other desserts, as well as to sell ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lumber, planks and bars to fix her business to give it a better appearance.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa Chávez M. es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo por los que siempre ha luchado. La señora Maria tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de pan, los cuales distribuye luego a los negocios cercanos. Debido a la experiencia que tiene y a los años que ya lleva funcionando el negocio, la señora posee una amplia cobertura de clientes, que van desde clientes que le compran al por mayor y también al por menor. cuando la Maria inicio este negocio fue con capital propio y fue debido a la escasez de trabajo que asedia a nuestro país, además ella nunca se imagino que algún día llegaría a tener una panadería como la que posee en nuestros días. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra principalmente de harina, ya que mantiene almacenada para que cuando suban los precios no le afecten en la elaboración de sus manjares, además de esto ella desea también invertir en la compra de una batidora que le permita elaborar sus mercancías de una forma más rápida. Ella tiene el sueño de algún día exportar sus productos.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Joana

texts.pt:
Joana nasceu na Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia tem 43 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é mãe de 6 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 11 aos 30 anos. 5 é que vão a Escola e o mais velho já esta empregado. Para além dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelos seus 5 netos que vivem com ela em sua casa.

Joana quando frequentava a 7ª classe fica grávida do seu primeiro filho e é expulsa de casa pelos seus progenitores, deste modo teve que ir ao lar e interrompe com os estudos devido à falta de tempo, pois seu marido é um grande camponês e passavam a maior parte do tempo cuidando das machambas. Devido ao seu marido que é polígamo com (5 mulheres tendo ficado com apenas duas e com 74 filhos) ela resolve apostar na agricultura para sua sobrevivência e a dos filhos, é agricultora a mais de 25 anos proprietária de 25hectares não tem empregados conta com ajuda dos seus filhos e enteados, tem plantado (milho, feijão manteiga, feijão nimbo, amendoim, melancia e abóboras) uma parte para revenda outra para o consumo familiar e para pagar os trabalhadores no tempo da sacha(comida pelo trabalho)tem como melhor produto o milho vendido na época da sementeira a lata e saco (120mtx30latas e a 360mtx50sacos)consecutivamente tendo um lucro no valor de 21.600MT.mas devido a doença do seu marido que encontra se internado ela fica sem fundo suficiente devido as despesas hospitalares e aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00MT, para sustentar a sua actividade.


Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Joana na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. Será usado para lavrar a terra e comprar insumos agrícolas para o lançamento da semente, esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto, pois conta com ajuda da sua rival e pedir outro empréstimo para o plantio de hortícolas em breve.
texts.en:
Joana was born in the Namaacha village in the border with Suazilandia, in Mozambique. She is 43 years old and lives with her husband and six children with ages between 11 and 30. Five of them go to school, and the older one is employed. Besides her children, she also suports her five grandchildren. They all live in her house. Joana got pregnant when she was in 7th grade, and her parents threw her out of the house. She couldn't continue her studies because she had to start working with her husband in the farms. Her husband has had other 4 wives and a total of 74 children, so Joana has to work hard to support herself and her children. She's been in this business for the past 25 years, and she has no employees, but counts with the help of children and sons-in-law. Her best selling product is corn. Her husband is now in the hospital and she has several medical bills to pay. She's asking for a 25.000,00MT (U$875) loan in order to invest in her business and make more money in the near future. She'll use the loan to work the land and buy seeds and fertilizers. She's positive she'll be able to pay the loan back on time.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of agricultural products and seeds

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Jacinto R. O. tiene 54 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, el siempre ha sido un hombre muy responsable y además siempre se ha hecho cargo de sus 2 hijos, por lo que tenía que buscar un medio de ingreso para su familia, y fue así que comenzó este negocio pero su dificultad es encontrar a un buen cerdo y que últimamente ha sido muy difícil mantener el alimento de estos animales, a pesar de estas dificultades  ha logrado salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo. el sueña con proporcionarle a sus hijos una mejora calidad de vida y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jacinto R. O. is 54 years old and has been buying and selling pigs for more than 8 years. He is a very responsible man who has always taken care of his 2 children. Jacinto started this business as a means of generating income for his family. His main difficulties have been acquiring good animals and keeping them well-fed. Despite these challenges, he has been able to stay ahead. The loan he is requesting will be used has operating capital. Jacinto dreams of providing his children with a better quality of life and generating better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for breeding pigs

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni W. is currently in the business of selling sugar, milk powder,salt, etc. in a shop, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar and salt for sale. Poni is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is a wildlife officer. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of sugar and salt for sale.

loans.name: Nitzi Mariella

texts.es:
La señora Nitzi Mariella, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 22 años y no tiene hijos.

Su espíritu luchador, que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de artesanías, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en esta actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, ubicado en la feria Central, donde vende todo el día.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará materiales como: tinajitas, adornos de diferentes culturas; y otros de semillas y productos propio de la región como: aretes, pulseras, collares. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando ropas, y juguetes tanto para niños y niñas.   

Nitzi Mariella, es muy joven y se siente tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Nitzi Mariella is a member of the Communal Bank “La Marginal II”, and lives in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 22 years old, single, and does not have children.

Nitzi Mariella is known for her fighting spirit and her desire to succeed, which helped her start her own business selling handicrafts. She is gradually becoming well-known among her customers and her business is currently doing very well. Her business is located at the Central Fair where she sells all day.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will purchase merchandise such as earthenware jars, seeds, and ornaments from different cultures. In addition, she will acquire products from the local region such as earrings, bracelets, and necklaces. Another portion of the money will be used to buy clothing and toys for both boys and girls.

Nitzi Mariella is a young woman who is content and at peace with what she has accomplished. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts to add to her inventory

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia is a 35-year-old wife and mother of four children who are currently in school. She is a serious-minded business woman who works hard to support her husband and provide for her family. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, creams for body and hair, skimmed powdered milk, and the like. She deems the loan as an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use it to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc., to increase her stock. She believes your support would enable her grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta D. est une femme mariée, elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle développe une activité d’embouche bovine et ovine depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois de KA FALL en novembre 2006. avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle aide son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Anta D. is a married woman who is 47 years old. She has been building up a bovine and ovine fattening business since joining the KA FALL village bank in November 2006. With the profits she makes she can help her husband in assuming the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her income generating business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Mr. Francisco G., 54 years of age, is married to Fe and resides at Garang, Tangub City.

Francisco owns a motor vehicle for hire and earns a meager income of P4,500 per month. He acknowledges the fact that he has to earn more for his family and so he decided to approach Paglaum MPC to seek his needed capital. He wants to purchase a motorcycle with sidecar.

Preserving his good standing membership with the Cooperative, he applied for a P40,000 loan. The future income from this loan will be used for meeting his family’s daily basic needs and for loan repayments.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle with sidecar

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es:
Leonora es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Leonora es soltera, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Leonora viaja semanalmente a la ciudad de Pisco en donde vende cereales, papa, haba y arveja verde, tiene un deposito alquilado, productos que compra en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Leonora necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, arveja y maíz.
Los sueños de Leonora son ampliar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Leonora is a member of the Nueva Era Communal Bank. Leonora is 39, single, and has three children. Leonora travels weekly to the city of Pisco, where she sells grains, potatoes, beans, and green peas. She has a rented shop. She buys her products in the wholesale market in the city of Ayacucho. Leonora needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy potatoes, peas, and corn. Leonora’s dream is to expand her business and to give her children a good education so that they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes, peas, and corn

loans.name: Evarista

texts.en:
Evarista is 45 years old and has been married for 10 years. She does not have any kids of her own, but she has a 20 year old adopted daughter who has a daughter of her own. They both live with Evarista and her husband. 

Evarista has owned her corner store for 5 years. Previously her mother owned the store. After her death, Evarista decided to continue running it. Despite stiff competition, business is going well due to her good customer service.  Her current project is opening a hardware and toy store next to the corner store.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, rice and drinks

loans.name: Limy

texts.en:
Limy S. is from Ozamiz City outside of Manabay, Philippines. She is a 34-year-old married mother of 4 school-aged children. She runs a general store, selling products like shampoo, snacks, candy, coffee, and tissue, and she has been in business for over 3 years, earning about 15000 PHP a month.

Limy joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Limy has successfully repaid a previous GDMPC loan of 15000 PHP and she is now requesting her third loan, for 20000 PHP, which will be used to invest in the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Limy from GDMPC. She hopes to earn additional revenue so she can improve the living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her general store.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 47-year-old married man with 3 school-age children. He has been working as a car painter for the past 35 years and he opened his own shop 13 years ago. Bassam has taken a first loan from Ameen and he is pleased with his decision. He said that the loan amount was appropriate for his work in the last year. 

And today, Bassam is asking to take another Kiva loan of $1,500 to help expand his business by purchasing an air compressor and be able to meet the requirement of his clients and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: purchasing an air compressor

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun is 56 years old and lives with her two daughters in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent.  Currently, Oyun operates a consumer good trading business in her town. She purchases a variety of consumer goods in Ereen, a Chinese border town, and resells them in her rented space for a profit. She has been operating her business since 2006; she has steadily expanded it and has built a stable operation. 

Oyun worked as a pharmacist in a private pharmacy in 2006 and 2007. She is an open-minded and  hardworking person. She says, “I would like to grow my business and improve my family's quality of life.” She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~375 USD) loan to increase the working capital of her business.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Theng

texts.en: Theng Y., 63, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She sells cosmetic products for an income of about $4 per day. Y. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more cosmetic products to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Saturday Children Group

texts.en:
Saturday T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Saturday Children. He is 35 years old, married, and has three children aged from 6 to 18 years old. Saturday did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty.

For the last three years, Saturday has had a money changing business.  Liberia's currency is the Liberian
dollar, which trades at about 70 LRD to the U.S. dollar, but the U.S. dollar is also legal tender in the country and is widely accepted.  Firestone, the country's largest private employer, pays its employees in U.S. dollars, so Saturday's services are in high demand when it's payday for Firestone workers. Saturday also sells mobile phone chargers at the Harbel market in Margibi county, Liberia.

He started selling at the Cotton Tree community in Harbel City with 20,000 LRD as working capital. He has a good manner of approach towards his customers, which keeps them returning. Saturday plans to use his 4,000 LRD portion of this 20,000 LRD group loan to purchase more mobile phone chargers and to use in his foreign currency exchange business. His goal and dream is to own his own booth from which to operate and become financially strong in the near future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Saturday is holding the sign. Sarah is inset at lower right because she was absent during interview.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phone chargers and to use in his foreign currency exchange business

loans.name: Believe Usef Group

texts.en: Zainab K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Zainab was born in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone, about 25 years ago. She is married to a gardener and the couple has two children between the ages of three and nine. For over five years now, Zainab has been selling rice, gari (quick-cooking food made out of cassava roots), sugar, etc. With the help of this loan, Zainab and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Zainab K. will specifically use her share of the loan (SLL 700,000) to expand her business: she will buy rice, gari and sugar wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy rice, gari and sugar wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Make It Up Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Make It Up” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Haja K. (pictured in the middle of the back row) is the leader of this group. The 28-year-old is married to a school teacher and they have 3 children. Haja has been a businesswoman for 5 years now, she sells rice, palm oil, vegetable oil, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), gari (quick cooking food made out of cassava roots), etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, vegetable oil, Maggi cubes, gari (cassava couscous), etc.

loans.name: Diana Marisol

texts.es:
La Sra. Diana L. es socia del banco comunal  El Paraíso, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe conocida por su gente que es muy calida y amable a pesar de que su clima es frió su gente se dedica a la agricultura  y ganadería, muchos de su población joven han viajado a distintas partes del mundo para mejorar le economía de sus hogares.

La Señora Diana tiene 25 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 6 años que estudia en una escuelita de la comunidad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres la misma que es propia.

Nuestras socia se dedica a la cría de animales como: vacas, pollos, cuyes los mismos que los vende en su comunidad. Es nuestra socia hace 3 años y fue gracias a una ex compañera del bankito quien la invito a que ingrese; su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Su meta es de viajar a España.
texts.en:
Diana L. is a member of the Paraíso (Paradise) Communal bank. She lives in the Cumbe parrish. It is known for its very warm and friendly people in spite of the cold climate. The people work in agriculture and livestock. Much of the younger population has traveled to places that are far away in order to improve their household economies. Diana, age 25, is the single mother of a six year old. He goes to the community school. She does not have her own house. She lives in her parents’ house, which is their own. Our member raises animals like cows, chickens, and guinea pigs. She sells them in her community. She has been a member for three years. This is thanks to a former bank colleague who invited her to join. She will use the new loan to buy chickens in order to continue growing in her business. Her goal is to travel to Spain.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem N., 56, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorian temples. He operates his motorbike as a motor-taxi driver for an income of USD 3.30 per day. His wife raises animals at home, earning an income of USD 1.20 per day. N. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a tuk-tuk to expand his transportation business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profits to repair his house. This is his second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a tuk-tuk to expand the transportation business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan B. is a 35-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a furniture business. She lives in Brgy. Tapon, Dalaguete, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her furniture  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000. Susan is now borrowing PHP 28,000 to provide additional working capital for her furniture business. This will be her 11th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 27,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Susan aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. In the photo Susan is with her husband.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to provide additional working capital

loans.name: Aracely Guadalupe

texts.es:
Aracely tiene 53 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Jucuapa, departamento D. Usulután, es casada, tiene dos hijos mayores los cuales son independientes, vive son el esposo, ella se tiene venD. carne D. res y cerdo.
Ella aprendió del negocio D. la edad D. 14 años gracias a la madre quien le enseño el oficio, ella posee su propio negocio el cual está ubicado en el mercado D. municipal D. Jucuapa, el cual lo atienD. en un horario D. 6:00 am-4:00 pm, actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para compra D. compra D. cerdos para vender las carne, chorizos, hueso, costilla, grasa D. cerdo, frito, esto le permitirá crecer el negocio, para generar ganancias y mejorar las condiciones D. vida, riesgo D. préstamo es que la  persona se enferme. 
Los sueños son ser una gran empresaria, con muchos clientes, que le permitan mejorar las condicione D. vida D. la familia.
texts.en:
Aracely is 53 years old and lives in Jucuapa in the department of Usulután. She is married and has three adult children. She lives with her husband, and she sells beef and pork. She learned this traD. when she was 14, thanks to her mother, who taught her. She has her own business in Jucuapa's municipal market. She works from 6 am to 4pm. She is asking for a loan to buy pork so she can sell meat, sausages, marrow, suet, and fried pork. This will enable her to increase her business so as to generate more money and improve her quality of life. The only risk for the loan is that someone could get sick. She dreams of being a big businesswoman, with many clients, so she could improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork

loans.name: Sobbeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SOBBEYA est créé  il y a de cela plus de 9 ans. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du banc villageois de KADIOR.

Madame Aminata S.,debout tout à fait à gauche de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. 

Elle développe un petit commerce de bois de chauffe et d'huile de palme. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages pour venir revendre dans la ville de Ziguinchor. Elle a une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir mener depuis plus de 5 ans.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandise (bois de chauffe et huile de palme) afin de réaliser des bénéfices plus importants.

Son objectif est d'augmenter ses revenus financiers afin de mieux prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Solidarity group SOBBEYA was set up over 9 years ago. The group is made up of 11 women who all come from the same neighborhood. They have come together as friends and neighbors. The solidarity group is a part of the Kadior "banc villageois." Mrs. Aminata S., standing on the left of the photo, is the group's leader. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She has begun a small business selling firewood and palm oil. She gets her supplies in the villages and re-sells them in the town of Ziguinchor. She is quite experienced in this activity, which she has carried out for more than 5 years. With the new loan, she can increase her stock of merchandise (firewood and palm oil) so as to make more profit. Her goal is to increase her revenue so that she can better meet her family's daily needs.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and palm oil

loans.name: Aurella

texts.en:
Aurella B. is 54 years old, married and has six children. She is from the village of Bago within the Sindangan municipality, a part of Zamboanga del Norte province on the Mindanao islands. Aurella makes and sells leather products to local businesses and community members. She has been in business for over 26 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Aurella joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to to purchase materials to make additional leather products. Aurella is requesting a new loan, her sixth from PMPC, of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials to expand her product line. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials to expand her leather product offerings

loans.name: Maeluna

texts.en:
Maeluna C. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 30 years old and married. To make a living, she operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from gathering and selling seaweed at the market. She hopes to improve the living conditions of her family. 

Maeluna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including nets

loans.name: Nos

texts.en: Sewing clothes is 27-year-old Nos M.’s main daily duty in the garment industry of Phnom Penh. Nos M. started her job in 2008 and has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband (pictured) who works in the construction field. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their one kid, now attending school. Nos M. is concerned about her fence, which is broken in a few parts. Currently, she says, it is not comfortable for her family to live there.
