To deal with the problem, Nos M. has requested a loan in the amount of $350 to mend the parts of her fence that are broken.

loans.use: To mend the parts of her fence which are broken

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Norma del Carmen S. H. es trabajadora Activa del colegio público “CERMA” desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene diecinueve  años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cuatro   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Norma del Carmen S. H. works as an elementary school teacher at CERMA school.  She has been working for the school for nineteen years.  She is married and has two school-age children.  She has had four loans from CEPRODEL and each one has been used to buy building material to extend and improve her house.  CEPRODEL's loans have benefited her greatly since they have enabled her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Sand, cement, stone, blocks and paint

loans.name: Esther Nyambura

texts.en:
Esther Nyambura is a 50-year-old divorcee and has one child. She runs a green grocery shop where she has been for the past 10 years, with an income of Kshs. 4,000 a month.

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd and she intends to use it to buy more stock of tomatoes and cabbages for her green grocery business. She has never borrowed from another MFI and she hopes to buy a plot of land and build her permanent house and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tomatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Arturo Abelardo

texts.es:
Arturo D. 50 años, es pescador y venD. pescados en el puerto donD. todos los pescadores venden. Vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno D. los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión D. mariscos.  

Cuando él era joven el papa le enseño como pescar y obtener su propia comida. Pescando con redes aprovecho lo que el papa le enseño y lo convirtió en su negocio para tener dinero para mantenerse. Compro un bote y un motor para salir a pescar desD. las 04h00 D. L. madrugada en su bote con ayuda D. un oficial a su cargo llegan a las 14h00 para vender los pescados. En L. actualidad sale en L. madrugada a pescar y regresa en L. mañana para vender L. libra D. pescado a $ 3.50, el langostino a $ 1.50. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar redes, alises para su bote y así tener más facilidad al pescar. En el futuro quiere tener una embarcación completa y así ayudarles a sus hermanos económicamente.
texts.en:
Arturo is 50 years old, is a fisherman and sells fish at the port where all other fishermen sell.  He lives in an area called Playas, a tourist area in Ecuador that has a very varied supply of seafood.

His father taught him how to fish and get his own food when he was young.  He took advantage of what his father taught him by fishing with nets and turning it into a business to be able to support himself.  He bought a boat and a motor.  He and his worker leave at 4 in the morning in the boat and return at 2PM to sell their fish.  Currently he goes to fish at dawn and returns in the morning to sell fish at $3.50 per pound and prawns for $1.50.

With the loan he wants to purchase nets, and parts for his boat to be able to fish more easily.  In the future he would like to have a fishing vessel and to be able to financially help his brothers.

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Nseenya Zinnunula Omunaku Group-Lugazi

texts.en: A decade ago is when 35 year old M. Robert ventured into his current farming business in Nseenya-Lugazi. He like many other Ugandans subsists and shoulders most of his family's responsibilities with profits from this business. Robert principally plants and sells tomatoes. He also keeps and sells poultry. Robert says farming has been a long term business undertaking. The happily married father of seven says his future plan is to give his children a worthwhile education. He reckons with improving business conditions, this will, at length, be probable. With this loan, he says he is going to expand his business operations. Buying some more acres of land is high on his priority list after he gets this loan.

loans.use: The purchase more acres of land.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan T. is thirty-seven years old, married and they have two children aged seven years old and five years old. His business is located at a busy area called Bandarini in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches.

He operates a small restaurant in which he serves food and drinks to his customers. He has been in this business for the last one and half years and has one employee. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy utensils and expand his working area to grow his business and serve more people. He hopes to open a hotel and eventually a catering school. He describes himself as ambitious.

loans.use: To buy utensils and expand premises.

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en: Tobias is a businessman and a member of the Jitihada group in Faulu Kenya.  He sells ladies' clothes in the Kibera slums.  He has been in the business for four years.  He has managed to educate his four children with the income from his business and the funding from Faulu Kenya.  He dreams of opening a wholesale business in the future.  He has requested 40,000 KES to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
Tito  es una persona muy conocido en el lugar donde vive por lo dedicado a su hijo y a su trabajo, el vive solo con sus hijo  en la  comunidad de Buena Vista provincia Mizque del departamento  de Cochabamba, Tito  con  47 años de edad, sus padres no pudieron ayudarlo por los escasos recursos que viven y   desde muy joven conoció a la madre de su hijo y ella por la situación de los bajo recursos tomo la decisión de salir al exterior y ya son mas de 8 años que no tienen noticias mas de ella, Tito empezó a trabajar en una carpintería y ahí fue aprendiendo y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo.

Con el  crédito que está solicitando el desea comprar madera para trabajar con su propio material y asi  aumentar sus ingresos y   mejorar su  calidad de vida de su hijo y de el.
texts.en:
Tito is an individual who is well-known in his community for being dedicated to his child and to his work. He lives alone with his son in the community of Buena Vista, Mizque Province, Department of Cochabamba. Tito is 47 years old. His parents could not help him because they live in a low-income neighborhood. As a young man, he met the mother of his child. Eight years ago, she decided to leave the country because they were poor and has not been heard from since. Tito began working at a carpentry shop where he learned the trade and how to put in his best effort.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy wood. By working with his own materials, Tito will be able to increase his income and improve the quality of life for himself and his son.

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Maribel Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” UNION FUERZA Y AMISTAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel; ella tiene 51 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de venta de anticuchos ella vende en su local anticuchos de carne , corazón  entre otros mas todo esto a base de carbón a la parrilla , la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su familia(papa y hermana) en sociedad, siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento y de esta forma ella saca a su familia adelante la socia se siente feliz con esta actividad ya que puede estar más tiempo con sus hijos y es esto un motivo importante para que ella siga adelante con el negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio de anticucheria como aceite, carnes, carbón entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maribel, 51, is a member of the “UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD” (Unity, Strength & Friendship) communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has two children. She has an anticuchos sales business.  She sells meat and heart anticuchos, among others.  All are roasted on a charcoal grill.  She works alongside her family (father and sister) as partners.  This is the only activity she’s in at present and this is how she supports her family.  She is happy with this activity because she is able to spend more time with her children and this is an important reason for her to want to get ahead with the business.

She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for her anticuchos like: meat, oil and charcoal, among others.  She is happy with the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her anticucho (skewered, roasted meat) sales business.

loans.name: Ahror

texts.en:
T. Ahror is a 46-year-old married man who owns a small farm. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example. Ahror has been running a business raising and selling cattle. He has five years' experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Ahror has become a very successful businessman. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning and feeding them. Now Ahror wants to expand his business and buy more cattle so he has applied for a loan of $3000 USD. Ahror thanks all lenders for their support.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, including the heyday of the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, as well as epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's history:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand a business and improve family living conditions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase kitchen appliances, pots and pans and wooden tables

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan B. lives in the Ntinda neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also cares for her two brothers. Susan has a business selling secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for three years and works six days a week. She also rents rooms and sells tap water as additional sources of income. Susan has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to purchase more secondhand women's and children's clothing.

The main business challenge for Susan is fluctuating rent for her business premises. Her goal is to own her own boutique. She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent for her business premises and food.

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, a 40-year-old married mother of seven children, all attending school, has a business selling bread and biscuits. She is requesting a loan to stock more bread and biscuits to sell. Rebecca hopes to pay for her children's education and build a concrete house with additional future business profits.

loans.use: to stock more bread and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela G. is from Maquilao Tangub City. She is 62 years old. Rafaela is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Rafaela raises fish for sale. Rafaela has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rafaela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rafaela has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. 

Rafaela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to repair fishing equipment. This will be the second loan taken out by Rafaela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair fishing equipment.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “SUMAC TIKA-VALLE SAGRADO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Qotohuycho, perteneciente a la Provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Gladis, la socia tiene 34 años de edad;  la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 16, 14, 2 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la elaboración de jora, ella nos comenta que entierras el maíz amarillo remojado con paja y después de un día la socia ya procesa la jora mediante un proceso de fermentación natural, la socia suele comprar maíz amarillo para la realización de la jora que después es vendida, la socia requiere el crédito para comprar al por mayor maíz amarillo. La socia solicita el préstamo el cual le servirá para comprar al por mayor el maíz amarillo para elaborar la jora para la venta.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos y elaborar sus platillos para la venta.
texts.en:
The communal bank is named "Sumac Tika-Valle Sagrado". It is located in the community of Qotohuycho, belonging to the Province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

Here we meet Gladis. She is 34 years old and she is married common-law. She has 3 children, aged 16, 14, and 2 years old. She alternates her daily household activities with her jora drinks business. She says that she buries the yellow corn and potatoes in water and after one day she processes the jora through natural fermentation.  She plans on purchasing yellow corn to make jora for later sale. She requires this loan to purchase yellow corn in wholesale.

She requests a loan to purchase ingredients to prepare recipes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase yellow corn in wholesale.

loans.name: Janneth Catalina

texts.es:
La Señorita. Janneth  es socia del banco comunal Santa Ana, vive en la comunidad de Los Laures que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia es de clima frió, tiene una hermosa vista de la ciudad de Cuenca y de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo varias actividades.

Nuestra socia tiene 19 años, es soltera y tiene una hija de 2 años de edad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres, su papá es de profesión chofer y su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos.

La Señorita Janneth se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a la cría y venta de animales, tiene pollos y cerdos.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cerdos para crecer en esta actividad.

Su meta es viajar a España.
texts.en:
Janneth is a member of the communal bank Santa Ana. She lives in the community of Los Laures, belonging to the district of Santa Ana. It is a cold climate district and it has a beautiful view of the city of Cuenca and the natural surroundings. The population is made up of livestock farmers and agriculturists. Many work in the city in various business activities.

She is 19 years old, single, and she has a 2 year-old daughter. She doesn't have a house of her own so she lives with her parents. Her father is a driver by trade and her mother takes care of the household obligations.

Janneth takes care of the household obligations and she raises and sells livestock. She has poultry and pigs.

Her goal is to travel to Spain.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and pigs.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Veuve de 47 ans, Afi est mère d’un enfant. Elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois, et de céréales à Lomé depuis 1995.elle s’approvisionne à Agou une localité située dans la région des plateaux a 100 km de la capitale. Malgré la fatigue de cette activité elle travaille sans relâche pour subvenir aux besoins de son enfant à qui seule la charge lui revient.
texts.en: A widow, Afi is 47 years old and the mother of one child. She has been a retailer of charcoal and grains in Lomé, the capital of Togo, since 1995. She gets her supplies in Agou, a town located in the Plateaux Region and 100 km from the capital. Despite how exhausting this business is, she works tirelessly to meet the needs of her child, whom she supports entirely by herself.

loans.use: to buy corn and some grains

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en: Leonilo is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. Leonilo has a vegetable garden and sells a variety of vegetables. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy fertilizers for his vegetable garden. Leonilo is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Leonilo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for a vegetable garden.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME II sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Fala, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KARATOU, assise au milieu, compte acheter les intrants et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000FCFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the group DJIGUISSEME II are married women who average 35 years of age and three children living in polygamous families in Fala, a village in the Commune of Massigui, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their businesses better at the start of the off-season. The crops grown include rice and peanuts. The group members are on their fifth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, KARATOU, who is seated in the middle (in the photo), intends to buy farm inputs and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts.

After the harvests, the produce is sold in the city of Massigui to a customer base composed of women and men. KARATOU plans on making an average profit of about 25,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, and manure

loans.name: Zaidi

texts.en:
Zaidi is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, Zaidi has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is seasonality. He hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future.

Zaidi plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to repair a freezer and to purchase a compressor. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To repair a freezer and purchase a compressor.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 48 years old. She is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Married as she is, Florencia is struggling hard to provide for her four dependents' needs – personal, school, everything. She tries to meet these demands by operating a retail store, which she started ten years ago. Luckily, she earns a monthly income of 4,000 PHP from it. 
In 2008, Florencia joined Kiva partner, GDMPC. This time, she has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP from the cooperative, which is her third time of borrowing. The money is intended to buy daily use commodities to sell in her retail store. Florencia hopes for a consistent business operation and the opportunity to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy daily use commodities to sell in her retail store.

loans.name: Marcela Yolanda

texts.es:
Marcela Yolanda tiene 32 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con el hijo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra ubicada recinto JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl.

Marcela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Roca en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl, para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, urea, abonos orgánicos y semillas de maíz fréjol y arroz para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente  a toda la familia para poder suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es salir adelante economicamente y comprar terrenospara seguir sembrando.

En su tiempo libre le gusta escuchar musica y bailar.
texts.en:
Marcela Yolanda is 32 years old, married, and live with her husband and son in the Ventanas Canton of Los Rios Province. 

The members of the Nueva Esperanza ("New Hope") Communal Bank are located in the Jesús del Gran Poder District of Ventanas Canton. This communal bank supports short growth cycle agriculture, planting corn, rice, and pigeon peas. Marcela works in agriculture, planting corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Comercial Roca in Ventanas and sells her produce at the Ventanas wholesale market.

She is requesting this loan to plant more corn, rice, and pigeon peas and to purchase compost, organic and chemical fertilizers, herbicides, urea, and corn, bean, and rice seeds for production. The support of this loan would help the whole family economically in allowing them to meet their needs. She confronts setbacks like pests and crop diseases. Her dream is to get ahead economically and buy some land in order to keep on planting. 

In her free time she likes to listen to music and dance.

loans.use: to purchase compost, organic and chemical fertilizers, herbicides, urea, and corn, bean, and rice seeds for production.

loans.name: Gloria Group

texts.en:
Gloria is married with 8 children. She is 60 years old and lives in Cogon, Osamiz City.
To earn a living, Gloria is a massage therapist. She has had this job for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase lumber for her house renovation.  Gloria has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.
In the future, Gloria wants to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase lumber for her house renovation.

loans.name: Kenjekan's Group

texts.en:
Kenjekan is the leader of this group. She is 71 years old, and unfortunately she is a widow.  She has raised two sons and three daughters, all of whom are married. 

In order to earn money for their livelihood, the family cultivates agricultural products. They grow potatoes, wheat and barley. Their monthly profits depend on the quality of the harvest, but usually Kenjekan earns about 10,000 Kyrgyzstani soms per month.  

With the money received from the loan, Kenjekan wants to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest.  In the future she would like to provide her grandchildren with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest.

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en:
Batbold is 24 years old and lives with his mother in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. 

He works as a security guard at the local legal office. Since his work has three shifts, he plans to drive a taxi during his free time and weekends to increase his income level. For this reason, he is planning to purchase a car although he has no taxi-driving experience. 

He is an open-minded and diligent man who says, "I want to have a good life. During the weekends, I prefer to drive a taxi and earn money rather than staying at home." 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a car.

loans.use: To purchase a car.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 

Judith has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Judith has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
La Sra. M.  de 43 años de edad casada, tiene 1 hijo menor de edad  de 13 años  en etapa escolar, mujer luchadora  por salir adelante  frente a los obstáculos  que se les presenta, socia de la alcancía comunal “San Roque”.
Se dedica en la actualidad a la Preparación de Platos Típicos de la Región  como la Pachamanca este plato típico está  preparada a base de papas doradas, carnes asadas,etc. 
El prestamo solicito para la compra de platos,cubiertos y otros. En el futuro desea exportar  la Pachamanca enlatado,  así  incrementar más sus ingresos y poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia.
La clienta está ubicada la cuarta lado derecha vestida de casaca blanca polo color celeste.
texts.en:
M. is 43 years old. She is married and has one child who is 13 years old and is in school. She is a woman who works hard to get ahead in spite of the obstacles that present themselves. She is a member of the “San Roque” community bank.

She currently works at making typical foods of the region, such as Pachamaca. This dish is prepared with roasted potatoes as a base, grilled meats, etc. She is asking for the loan to purchase plates, silverware, and other products. In the  future she would like to export canned Pachamanca and thereby increase her income and be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

She is the one who is fourth from the right, dressed in a white jacket with a blue polo shirt.

loans.use: to purchase plates and silverware

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr:
Enyonam est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée à  un délégué médical. Elle est mère d’un enfant de 04ans qui fréquente dans une école du quartier. 
Enyonam travaille comme revendeuse des boissons de la BB depuis 11ans. Elle sert tous les clients dans sa boutique. Elle travaille avec 01 employé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence. 
Enyonam a requis son deuxième cycle de prêt  à WAGES afin d’acheter des casiers de boisson. Elle veut réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Enyonam voudrait agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle  veut avoir une  famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Enyonam is a 38-year-old woman. She is married to a medical representative. She is the mother of a four-year-old child attending a local school.

For the past 11 years Enyonam has been retailing BB beverages. With one employee, she serves all her customers at her bar.

Enyonam requested a second credit loan from WAGES to buy crates of beverages. She wants to reinvest extra profits into her business activity. In coming years, Enyonam wants to expand her business. 

She said that with the profits, she wants to have a happy family.

loans.use: Buy beverages for the bar

loans.name: Beun

texts.en:
Beun (in the photo) is a weaver and her husband, Chamroeun, is a security guard. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2006 and have one young son. 

Beun hopes to continue her weaving business because it a traditional profession. Hence she is asking for another loan of $200 to purchase weaving materials.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is married and blessed with two children who are in school. 

He has been using his lorry as part of his transport business.  He has four years of experience.  Benjamin has improved his business because he has learned business management skills, by Faulu Kenya. 

He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to service the lorry.

loans.use: to service the lorry.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is a 33-year-old farmer from the village of Rekha, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his big family: wife Nanuli, 3 children (13, 7 and 1 years old) and parents. The elder children go to school. All adult members of the family are involved in agriculture, which is the main source of income for the family. 

The family owns 2.5 hectares of land where 100 apple and 100 peach trees are grown. Also, part of the land is used for tomato and cabbage growing. Along with the above-mentioned, the family has a milk cow. They produce cheese and sell it on the local market. 

Giorgi requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. The family will increase cheese production and sales by 100%. It will increase the income of the family. Giorgi plans to reinvest the increased income in further development of the family farm, in order to expand it and make more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine keeps a greenhouse. She lives with her husband and two children who help Armine with her agriculture business. Armine has applied for a loan to develop her business. With the help of this loan, Armine will pay for the construction of a new greenhouse. She hopes to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for construction of a new greenhouse.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad always ensures that her family will not have financial shortages and takes care of their needs. She is 55 years old and married with five children.  Felicidad has been engaged in her rice-farming business for over 35 years. Her only desire is to uplift their living standard and grow her farm business. Due to the high cost of seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides that will be used in farming, Felicidad decided to borrow a loan of 30,000 pesos to buy seeds to grow, fertilizers, and herbicides for plant care. Felicidad hopes that she will be able to avail of the loan. It was a big help for her to maintain her business and continue generating income. In the future, Felicidad will be successful in her business and as a borrower as well.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow, fertilizers, and herbicides for plant care

loans.name: Viviane Christiane

texts.fr: Viviane Christiane est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un certain Herver. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Viviane Christiane et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Viviane Christiane a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Viviane Christiane mène comme activité la vente de piments et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques de façon secondaire. Viviane Christiane achète ses produits dans une région du Bénin. Ce quatrième crédit permettra certainement à Viviane Christiane de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Viviane Christiane is 29 and is married to a man named Herver. They have one dependent child, who goes to school. Viviane Christiane and her husband both take care of the family financially. Viviane Christiane quit school at the secondary level. To meet the financial needs of her family, she has been selling hot peppers and refill cards for prepaid phones. Viviane Christiane buys those items in a region of Benin. This fourth loan will most certainly help Viviane Christiane enhance her business so she can better meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy baskets of hot peppers and refill cards for prepaid phones.

loans.name: Papy Kelard

texts.fr:
Ce client est âgé de 32 ans, il a deux enfants. Après ses études de lycée, il s’inscrit dans une école de styliste, à la fin cette formation, il ouvre son centre de couture  où il forme des filles mère à la couture.

Afin d’agrandir son  activité et d’améliorer ses structures, il sollicite un deuxième crédit.
Avec ce deuxième  crédit, il va renforcer son activité en achetant : 2 machines à coudre, 10 rouleaux de métrage, de tissus, 5 bobines de fil à coudre, des boites à canette
Avec le crédit de Hope, le client fait maintenant face à tous les besoins de sa famille y compris le financement des études de son enfant
texts.en: This borrower is 32 years old and has two children.  At the end of high school he enrolled in a fashion design school.  After graduation, he opened his own sewing center where he trains unwed mothers and teaches them how to sew.  In order to expand his business and to improve its structures, he is now requesting a second loan.  With this new loan, he is planning to strengthen his business by purchasing two sewing machines, ten rolls of fabrics, five reels of thread and some spools.  Thanks to his previous loan from Hope, this borrower is now able to take care of all his family needs, and can pay for his child's school tuition.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines, fabrics and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Wangninagbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAGBE est composé de quatre personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la trois fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Y. Célestine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et a très peu fréquentée l’école. Y. Célestine ne vit plus avec son mari. Y. Célestine est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Y. Célestine vend de la nourriture dans sa région. Y. Célestine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Y. Célestine ensemble avec les membres du groupe WANGNINAGBE sollicite un troisième crédit. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, d'huile végétale, des fagots de bois, du haricot et du riz.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Purchase a deep Freezer for his dairy shop.

loans.name: Amriah

texts.en:
Amriah has been doing her rags-sewing business even before she secured a loan from MBK, but in the past she had to purchase the raw materials on credit. After obtaining working capital from MBK in the amount of $50, she was able to purchase more raw materials by cash and to produce more selling goods. Amriah has requested her second loan of $90. Some portion of the loan will be used for her sewing business while other portion will be used for her other business of collecting and selling scraps. Amriah is very happy because she will now be able to buy a motorcycle on credit.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows and cattle feed

loans.name: Isabel Jose

texts.pt:
Client: Isabel Jose M. Area of business: Retail Loan Amount: 15.000,00 MT (US$600.00) Purpose of the Loan: Purchase and sale of clothes Loan Beginning date: 07/11/07 Last Payment due date: 07/31/08

Isabel Jose M. was born on June 23rd, 1957 in the city of Matola, province of Maputo. She was raised by her parents and went to school until the seventh grade. She was forced to stop going o school to look after her mother, who had fallen ill. She got married when she was 18 years old and had four children. Her husband subsequently passed away. In 1981, when she turned 26, she got married to her second husband and had three more children. She tried to work as a house-keeper but it did not work out - that is when she decided to start a business selling clothes that were purchased during trips to South Africa. Her business' income has helped her husband cover their children's expenses- his income comes from a pension plan. In 2006, she was tipped off by a friend about Hluvuku. She was granted a loan in the amount of 8.500,00mt. A year after that she applied for another loan in the amount of 15.000,00mt. Both amounts were used to buy additional clothes that gave the business a more solid structure. In the future, she wishes to build a bigger house where she can live with her family with dignity, for their current home is too small and it is not in good condition. She also wants to settle in a small store where she could sell clothes and a vehicle to transport merchandise, which is now needed thanks to high demands.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente: Isabel José M. Actividade:Comércio Valor do Empréstimo:15.000,00MT (600.00US$) Aplicação do Empréstimo:compra e venda de Roupa Início:11/07/2007 Fim:31/07/2008 Isabel José M. nascido em 23de Junho de 1957 em Matola na província de Maputo ,cresceu junto dos seus pais tendo estudado até 7ªclasse . A sua mãe fica doente facto que lhe fez deixar de estudar para cuidar dela. Aos 18 anos junta-se com o seu primeiro marrido tendo tido quatro filhos tempo depois , veio este a falecer. Aos 26 anos já em 1981 junta-se com outro homem com qual tem 3 filhos.Tentou trabalhar como empregada doméstica e não deu certo é quando decide iniciar o negócio de venda de roupa tendo passado a viajar á Africa do sul para adquirir a mercadoria. Atravêz deste negócio ,consegue ajudar o marrido no sustento dos filhos sendo este pensionista. Em 2006 atravês de amigas ficou a saber da existência da Hluvuku , tendo solicitado um financiamento no valor de 8.500,00mt . No corrente ano voltou a solicitar outro financiamento de 15.000,00mt ,ambos valores foram aplicados na compra de roupas o que veio a reforçar o seu negócio. Futuramente almeja construir uma casa grande onde possa viver condignamente com sua família porque a casa na qual reside actualmente é pequena e não está em boas condições. Tambem pretende adiquirir uma pequena loja onde possa colocar o seu negócio e viatura para lhe facilitar no transporte de mercadoria vista o aumento do volume do seu negócio.

loans.use: To increase stocks of clothes in her business

loans.name: Aiva

texts.en:
Aiva A.’s business is elei printing; she’s not only talented in printing but also interested in gardening. She’s a mother of 7 children, four boys and three girls. Both she and husband are unemployed but work very hard at home with their small businesses to financially support their children. Her husband works in their vegetable garden and taro plantation, and Aiva works on her elei printing and doing her garden.

Aiva is a new member of the program. When she joined SPBD, she had already had an existing business that needed financial support to improve. She lives far away from where their community assembles and never misses a day or a weekly payment. Aiva would like to continue with SPBD, which she believes is offering opportunities to the poor ladies who can not access credit.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase materials, brushess and fabric paints.

loans.name: Abdoul Rahman

texts.fr:
Mr. Abdoul Rahman D. was born in 1974 in Sokodé and lives in Lomé. His wife is a bicycle/motorbike mechanic. They have two children and are also raising his big sister's three children. After his secondary schooling, he began an apprenticeship and now he is a master mechanic. He is completely at ease in his chosen trade and charges appropriately for his services, which has allowed him to expand his clientele with ease. To boost his business and permit him to acquire modern tools, Mr. D. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur D. Abdoul Rahman est né en 1974 à Sokodé, résident à Lomé, il est marié à une femme mécanicienne à 2 roues et père de (02) enfants et trois (03) autres enfants de sa grande sœur sont à sa charge. Après les études secondaires , il entre en apprentissage. Aujourd’hui il est maître mécanicien. Il a une parfaite maîtrise de ses activités et ses prestations sont sans reproche, ce qui ne fait qu’augmenter sa clientèle. Pour renforcer son activité et acquérir d'autres outils moderne, Monsieur D. solliciter un crédit de 1000$.

loans.use:
repairing his workshop facility and purchasing modern tools

Aménagement de son atelier et achat des outils moderne

loans.name: Seni

texts.en: Seni is 42 years old and a mother of a child aged 12. Together with her husband, Z., she sells  vegetables at their house. They usually earn US $25 per week. Previously, she sold food, but the income in that business was decreasing, so now she would like to concentrate on vegetable sales. She requests a loan to expand her business by planting and selling various vegetables. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To plant and sell more and varied vegetables

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Doña Ninfa is a lady with a strife for self improvement, daily she is very successful selling cosmetics, perfumes, creams, lotions, etc. for ladies and gentlemen. She has three young children who need attention and care from their beloved mother and for many years her job has allowed her to meet the needs of her family without problems. Nevertheless, her interest in raising the standard of living of her family makes her request a loan to set up a business selling juice at home. Let us make her dream come true so that her little ones may have more security and peace.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Ninfa, es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación, día a día se desenvuelve con mucho éxito en la venta de cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, lociones, etc; para damas y caballeros.Tiene tres hijos aún pequeños que necesitan de toda la atención y cuidado de su querida madre; la actividad que desempeña en compañía de sus pequeños durante muchos años la ha ayudado a satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar sin ningún problema; sin embargo la inquietud de realizar otra actividad en casa para elevar el nivel de vida de casa, la conducen a solicitar un préstamo con el objetivo de instalar una pequeña juguería en ella.Posibilitemos su petición para que pronto los pequeños de Ninfa tengan mayor seguridad y tranquilidad.

loans.use: Setting up a business selling juice at home.

loans.name: Kyaliwajala D1C Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Florence S..  She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 15,00,000 to increase her stock.  Florence is 27 years old and is married with a husband who is a civil servant for work.  She has one child aged nine who goes to school.  Each week, Florence makes approximately UGX 50,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her child.  Florence has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600,000 and the loan was paid back on time.  Florence is joined in her small group by Florence M., Harriet N., Janet N., and Christine O..  Florence M. is currently in the business of making and selling snacks and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to start frying chips for sale.  Harriet N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to buy aother fridge.  Janet N. is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to start a charcoal business.  Christine O. is currently in the business of local brewselling and is requesting a loan of UGX 50,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To increase stock in a retail shop

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama K. sells African cotton materials in the market town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Adama said, with her previous loans, her business volume increased by 50%.  Her business is the main source of income for the family.  Her husband also does some business to support the family, but at a very small scale.  Adama is requesting for a loan of $700 to expand her business.  Adama is 33 years old and married with 3 children.

loans.use: Adama would like to expand her business of selling African print cotton fabric and needs a loan from Kiva to be able to achieve her goals.

loans.name: "costeñitas Ii" Group

texts.es:
The Villa Adela zone is the primary focus area of Pro Mujer, to which the group “Costeñitas II” belongs. It is comprised of a lovely collection of women who, along with Ruth Gutierrez their credit assistant, work hard to make their businesses a success. They are pleased because they have an opportunity to qualify for investments as well as loan funds that are offered through this entity. A majority of the members are married and have an average of five children. Some, like Mrs. Malena, cannot count on any help from a partner/spouse. She was abandoned by her husband, leaving her as sole provider for their four minor children who do their best to help their mother while she works as a street vendor selling fruit. There is a variety of activities within the group. We were able to observe that commerce/sales is the primary enterprise and the members sell clothes, in-season fruits, food, tableware, school supplies and other items. Some offer their products at retail from fixed locations, and others work as street vendors. It is certain that with additional capital they would be able to buy their merchandise at wholesale. This would allow them to obtain greater profits which would, in turn, help their small businesses to prosper and provide a higher standard of living for their families.

Note: There are some camera-shy members within the organization, which is why they are not very visible in the photograph.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

EN LA ZONA DE VILLA ADELA FUNCIONA EL CENTRO FOCAL DEL MISMO DE NOMBRE DE PRO-MUJER, A ESTE PRETENECE LA ASOCIACION "COSTEÑITAS II" UN LINDO GRUPO DE SEÑORAS QUE CON LA AYUDA DE SU ASISTENTE DE CREDITOS RUTH GUTIERREZ TRABAJAN INTENSAMENTE PARA QUE SUS NEGOCIOS PROSPEREN. ADEMAS ELLAS ESTAN MUY CONTENTAS PORQUE TIENEN LA OPORTUNIDAD DE CAPACITARSE SOBRE INVERSIONES ADEMAS DE OBTENER LOS CREDITOS QUE LA ENTIDAD OFRECE. EN EL GRUPO LA MAYORIA SON CASADAS CON UN PROMEDIO DE 5 HIJOS, ALGUNAS DE ELLAS NO CUENTAN CON LA AYUDA DE SU PAREJA, POR EJEMPLO A DOÑA MALENA SU ESPOSO LA ABANDONO, TENIENDO ELLA QUE HACERSE CARGO DE SUS CUATRO HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES INTENTAN AYUDAR A SU MAMA EN LA VENTA DE FRUTAS DE MANERA AMBULANTE. EXISTEN DISTINTOS TIPOS DE ACTIVIDADES DENTRO DEL GRUPO,PUDIMOS OBSERVAR QUE EL COMERCIO ES LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL, ELLAS OFRECEN LA VENTA DE ROPA, FRUTAS DE LA TEMPORADA, COMIDA, VAJILLAS, MATERIAL ESCOLAR Y OTROS ENCERES. PRODUCTOS QUE LOS OFRECEN AL POR MENOR ALGUNAS EN PUESTOS FIJOS COMO TAMBIEN DE FORMA AMBULANTE. TIENEN LA CERTEZA QUE CON UN MAYOR CAPITAL PODRIAN COMPRAR ESTOS PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR PARA ASI OBTENER UNA MAYOR GANANCIA Y DE ESTA FORMA PROSPEREN SUS PEQUEÑOS NEGOCIOS PARA BRINDAR A SUS FAMILIAS UNA MEJOR FORMA DE VIDA. NOTA -->:DENTRO LA ASOCIACION EXISTEN ALGUNAS PERSONAS UN POCO TIMIDAS A LAS CAMARAS. MOTIVO POR EL CUAL NO ESTAN MUY VISIBLES.

loans.use: With additional capital, they would be able to buy their merchandise at wholesale and obtain greater profits.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Mambo from kyela mbeya, Tanzania! This is 32 year-old Getrude M..  She is married and has 1 child aged 9. She has 5 dependents who live with her because they are are orphans.  In 2006, Getrude established her stationery business. She is now requires a loan in order to buy more stationary stocks in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  

The foresight and insight of people who have never received any training in business management never ceases to amaze me. Stationery sales is a business where such wisdom is demonstrated, with most sellers strategically placing their shops, stalls, tables or bodies strategically near to post offices, banks, schools and universities.

loans.use: To buy more stationery stocks in bulk.

loans.name: Ahabu

texts.en: Ahabu N. is a farmer and a fisherman in Katosi. On the farm, he employs people to help ease and quicken his work, because mostly his food is for sale. He grows ginger, cassava, sweet potatoes and matooke (green bananas). For fishing he has a boat and would like to buy fishing nets as well as more fish to sell. At times when he does not have a good catch, he buys from others so as to keep his customers. Through his Kewerimidde group, he is asking for a loan to hire workers on the farm and buy fishing nets and fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and hire workers on his farm

loans.name: Babalola

texts.en:
K. Babalola lives at Igando, Lagos State, Nigeria, where she sells bags of rice. She learned this business for 3 years and opened her own shop 2 years ago. She is 32 years old and married with 2 children.

Babalola has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. She needs a loan of US$1,200 to increase the size of her inventory of bags of rice so that she can increase her sales and profit. She expresses her thanks to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Munyandekwe

texts.en:
Greetings from Nyamata in Rwanda! F. is 28 years old and single with one adopted
orphan from the 1994 genocide. 


In 2003, MUNYANDEKWE, F. started his business after getting a loan of $100 from Vision Finance Company. He sells beans, sorghum, and cassava flour in his small shop. He earns about $80 every month.  He employs two people to help him run the business. He is requesting a loan of 20,4655 Frws to expand his business.

loans.use: Expand his business.

loans.name: Gorette

texts.en:
Greetings from Gorette in her beauty salon business in Kigali, Rwanda. Gorette is 39 years old and a single mother of two children and four adopted orphans of the 1994 genocide in Rwanda.

Gorette, who has been in the credit association since 2004, also works in the African Library. In addition to that, her salon business in Kigali attracts many working-class clients. She employs two people in her salon. She earns about $150 per month from her business. One of the challenges in her business is not having enough equipment in the hair salon, especially for women clients. 

She is looking for a loan worth 500,000 Frws to buy two hair-drying helmets for her salon.

loans.use: To buy two hair-drying helmets for her salon

loans.name: Amira

texts.en: Amira P. was born in 1965 and she lives in Visoko, in the central part of Bosnia Herzegovina. She is married and has twins who are 14 years old. Her husband works in a communal company. Besides that, he is really good at reselling  secondary raw materials. He does that after work time and on the weekends. Amira helps him by collecting and sorting the materials. Sometimes they get an offer to buy a bigger quantity of these materials but they are not able to buy it because they have no reserve money. So Amira decide to take a loan in WWI in the amount of 1500 KM. She will use this loan to buy secondary raw materials. This will provide Amira and her family better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy secondary raw materials

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa G. est mariée et mère de 02 enfants avec 2 autres à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Pire Gourèye depuis 3 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des tissus teintés et tissus simples et des chaussures. Elle veut renforcer son commerce.  Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Awa G. is married and the mother of two children plus two others in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Pire Gourèye for three and a half years. Her work consists of buying and selling dyed fabrics, plain cloth, and shoes. She wants to bolster her business. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in cloth and shoes

loans.name: Yazdonkul

texts.en: Yazdonkul Z. is 47 years old and married with three children.  He has been breeding sheep since he was a young boy and enjoys working with animals on a daily basis.  Yazdonkul recently realized that demand for his products has increased enough to justify the acquisition of several more livestock.  In order to accommodate these sheep, his family's facilities and barn will have to be expanded and improved.  Therefore, Yazdonkul is requesting a loan of $750, which will be used to purchase more sheep and materials for rebuilding his barn.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep and expand farm facilities.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Three borrowers are requesting this loan. They all live in Ratanak Commune in Battambang Province.

First borrower: Mrs. Yan P. is 40, married, and has five children. Two sons are construction workers, and one is married and lives far from home. Her husband, Soun Pouv, is a house builder that specializes in wood buildings. Mrs. P. makes and sells nets, which are the main source of income for the familly. She earns approximately $2 per day. Mrs. P. has applied for a loan to purchase raw materials to make additional nets for sale.

Second borrower: Chan S. is 33 and buys recyclables from stores and then resells them for a profit. She has requested a loan to expand her business.

Third borrower: Ly M. is 54 and sells ice. She has requested a loan to buy more ice to resell.

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make nets for sale

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Suni.
Felicitas es soltera, tiene 42 años y vive con su madre, Felicitas se dedica a la siembra de verduras en sus terrenos de la comunidad de Chacco, y también compra verduras de los productores de su zona, para luego transportarlos a la ciudad de Ayacucho y comercializarlos en el mercado de abastos.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras, semilla y abono.
Los sueños de Felicitas son mejorar su negocio, producir mas verduras.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Suni Community Bank (Suni means 'high' in Quechua, and is one of the eight Natural Regions of Peru). She is single, 42 years old, and lives with her mother. Felicitas works growing vegetables in her fields in the community of Chacco, and also buys vegetables from local farmers to take to the city of Ayacucho and sell in the wholesale food market. Felicitas needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy vegetables, seeds and fertilizer. She hopes to improve her business and produce more vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena T., is a pig raiser. Every day, she takes good care of her pigs because she thinks this is the most profitable thing to do. She is already 49 years old and has 6 children, who are all studying. Her husband is a rice grower. He tills the land for the family. Together, they cultivate the 1-hectare of land that her husband inherited from his parents. Hard work is what keeps their family going.

Hog raising is the most common business in their town. But because there is a high demand for meat in the market, there is healthy competition. Elena has a friend who retails meat. She sells all her pigs to her friend. The profit that she gets from selling pigs has helped a lot to send her children to school.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for the pigs. In this way, she will be able to take good care of her pigs and sell all of them at high prices.

CEVI is helping Elena flourish in her business. Through CEVI, Elena has access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret J. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Margret is 35 years old and is married to a husband that is a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build a permanent house

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua F. is a 40-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and has five kids. Four of her children attend school and the last-born is still breastfeeding. She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku, abetie and other local dishes in the community where she lives.

Akua has been in this business for the past 15 years. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup.

She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance.

Her picture was taken when she visited. Akua belongs to a village bank called "Naomi." She hope to receive GH¢700 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Alicia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sembrando Vida II”, vive en el Jr. 1ero. de Abril  s/n D.  Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos que dependen de ella.

Se inicio con S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia y con el apoyo de su esposo emprendió su negocio. En la actualidad se dedica a la confección de vestidos, que los ofrece a sus clientes y amigos conocidos, también trabaja con pedidos de su clientela.

Con el préstamo de S/1,200.00 que cancelara en 04 meses, desea invertir comprando telas de algodón y de licra en metros; también hilos en diferentes colores, blondas, elásticos insumos necesarios  para confeccionar ropas interiores en tallas y modelos para damas,  caballeros y niños.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, en lo personal, nos cuenta que también desea implementar su negocio con un taller más grande y establecido.

Maria Alicia, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Maria Alicia belongs to the community bank "Sowing life II" and lives in Jr. 1 de Abril s/n of the Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martin state. She is married, 38 years old, and a mother of 3 children, all of whom she supports. She started her business with S/ 300 of her own money and the support of her husband. Currently, she makes dresses that she offers to her customers and friends. She also accomodates the custom orders of her clientele. With a loan of S/ 1,200, to be paid in 4 monthly payments, she would like to invest in the purchase of cotton and spandex material, as well as threads of different colors, silk, and elastics to make undergarments in different sizes and styles for women, men, and children. Maria makes her own business decisions and her personal goal is to expand her business to be much larger and established. Maria Alicia expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and threads at wholesale

loans.name: Yenny Maria

texts.en:
Yenny is a member of the Virgen Asunta Village Bank in the town of Urco, just outside the larger town of Calca and about an hour from the city of Cusco. Yenny is 29 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two young children. Yenny buys dried corn from local farmers, which she then sells to intermediaries for export. She has been in this business for the past five years, and has been a client of Asociacion Arariwa for about the same time. She started out with a loan of just 300 soles (US $95) and has been able to expand her business significantly since then.

Yenny is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to buy 1000 kilos of dried corn. She has a vision to start a new business in the future. She wants to open a small pharmacy and Internet cafe in Calca. The town currently lacks these services. Yenny has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time.

loans.use: Buy 1000 kilos of dried corn from farmers to export.

loans.name: Ramzana M.waryam Group

texts.en:
Ramzana baji is the wife of M. W. who lives in Vehari, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the last 14 years. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community where people come to buy groceries for their houses. He has four years of experience in this business. Ramzana baji also runs an animal food selling business. She saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount. Ramzana baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a grocery store.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Hajran baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen baji wants a loan to buy another sewing machine for her tailoring center. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Loisi

texts.es:
LOISI R. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS” con domicilio en el Jr. Adolfo morey N° 667 del distrito de Callería, tiene 36 años, 04 hijos, y su esposo tiene trabajo como chofer de obras en la municipalidad.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y productos de belleza y la primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 5 años, con él compro algunas prendas para venderlos en los pueblos rurales por el río.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir y también productos de belleza que posteriormente irá a vender a las afueras de la ciudad

En el tiempo que trabaja con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante, ayudar a su esposo e hijos, y sobre todo en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
LOISI R. V. belongs to the Banco Comunal "Carmen Carbrejos." Her domicile is at 667 Adolfo Morey Street, Callería district. She is thirty-six years old and has four children. Her husband works as a driver for construction projects in the city. She has a business selling clothes and beauty products. The first time she obtained a loan of $100 was five years ago, and she used the money to purchase garments, which she sold in rural towns along the river. She will invest this loan of $675 in a variety of garments and beauty products, which she will sell in areas outside of the city. In the time that she has worked with Manuela Ramos, she is happy about the aid given to women to raise their standard of living and, above all, to help with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and beauty products

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina es una mujer de 28 años muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en un cuarto alquilado y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su puesto está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa, la cual trae desde las ciudades de Tacna (sur del Perú) y Desaguadero (frontera con Bolivia). Marina es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de llevarse algo a casa y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre qué prenda les queda mejor. Lleva 5 años en esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder ir a ningún lado, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que realizarlo, espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca y pueda tener una tienda de ropa más grande. Este el primer préstamo de Marina con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa y así podrá incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Marina is a 28 year old woman, who is very simple and hard-working. She lives in a rented room and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life. Her stand is located in the market of San Jose (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She sells clothes, which she brings to the cities of Tacna (south of Peru) and Desaguadero (on the border with Bolivia). Marina is a very persuasive seller and always convinces her clients to buy something. What she likes most about her work is talking with her clients and advising them about what clothing is best for them. She has spent 5 years in this activity and what she likes least is having to spend all day at her stand without being able to go anywhere, even though she knows that this is her work and she has to do it. She hopes that in the future her business grows and that she can have a bigger clothing store. This is her first loan with MFP and she is ready to pay all of the installments on time, since she wants to take out other loans later. In her community bank, she is a very responsible and is an active member. With the 1000 new soles she has requested, she will buy more clothing and, in this way, she will be able to increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells at her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y es madre de 09 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

Emprendió su negocio de Venta de verduras, se inicio con un capital de           S/. 150.00. Nos cuenta que no le fue fácil implementar su negocio, esta ubicada en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad, un puesto que ocupó con mucho esfuerzo, ya que no le fue fácil obtenerlo, hoy en día esta muy contenta por lo logrado.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, donde sus principales clientes son moradores de la comunidad y amigos que ya conocen el trabajo que realiza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará racimos de plátano, sacos de yucas  y camote.

Santos, aprendido a tomar sus propias decisiones,  tanto en lo personal como en su negocio. Nos manifiesta su agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos belongs to "Banco Comunal "Mujeres Emprendedoras", District of Moyobamba, Province Moyobamba, Departmetn of San Martín. She is married, 56 years old, a mother of 9 who are all independent.

She started a business selling vegetables with a capital of S/.150.00. She tells us that it was not easy to get her business started, it is located on the central market, "Mercado Central" of the town, she got the stall with much effort as it is not easy to obtain one, and today she is very happy because of her success. Presently she has the same business and most of her clients are inhabitants of the community and friends who are all aware of her work.

With this loan of S/.2,500.00 she will buy bunches of banana, sacks of yucca and sweet potato. Mrs. Santos has learned to make her own decisions, personally as well as businesswise. She expresses her gratefulness to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of vegetables.

loans.name: Tidjani Shaibu

texts.en: Tidjani Shaibu A. sells electrical appliances at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast. Tidjani Shaibu has received technical institutional training.  He is married and has 10 dependents. His wife is a trader. Tidjani Shaibu has been selling electrical appliances since 1993. He is responsible for paying school fees. His loan will be used to buy electrical appliances to sell. He hopes to reinvest his new profits in his business.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy electrical appliances to sell

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Primavera” trabaja junto a  Pro-Mujer hace cinco años,  a la fecha  cuenta con doce socias activas, cada dos semanas se reúnen en el centro focal Villa Exaltación, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la venta plásticos, víveres, abarrotes, shampoo,  también se dedican a la elaboración de almuerzos, los cuales los venden en pensiones. Necesitan capital para poder comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería  o productos, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer bienestar a sus familias
texts.en:
The group called "Primavera" (Spring) has worked with Pro Mujer for five years. To date they have twelve active members who meet every two weeks at the Villa Exaltación center, which is located in the city of El Alto. They have different businesses such as selling plastic, supplies, groceries, and shampoo. Some of them also make food, which they sell at boarding houses. They need capital to be able to buy a larger quantity of merchandise or products. In this way they will generate more income that will let them offer their families well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and/or products

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Amivi est une vendeuse ambulante de sachets en plastique. Ce commerce lui permet de se prendre en charge. Elle n’est pas mariée et elle n’a pas non plus d’enfant à sa charge. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2004 dans le quartier Avénou à Lomé. Elle vend le plus souvent ses sachets à des vendeuses de tapioca, de farine, de maïs et bien d’autres produits alimentaires. Actuellement il ne lui reste que très peu de sachets ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter 60 pièces de pros sachets noirs, 65 pièces de petits sachets noirs, 65 pièces de petits sachets blancs transparents, 60 pièces de sachets « bafana » pour les objets pesants.
texts.en:
Amivi sells plastic bags as she walks around town. Her business permits her to take of herself. She is not married and does not have any children to care for. She started her business in 2004 in the neighborhood of Avénou in Lomé. She mostly sells her bags to tapioca, flour, corn and other food salespeople.

Right now she does not have many bags left; this is why she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance group WAGES, in order to purchase 60 large black bags, 65 small black bags, 65 small transparent-white bags and 60 "bafana" bags for heavy objects.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of plastic bags

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny es un joven trabajador de 28 años, vive con su esposa, Doris, y sus hijos; Alexander de 13 y Válerie de 12, en su casa propia. Desde muy joven aprendió a conducir auto, desde entonces, esta actividad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de sustento económico, con la cual solventa los gastos de toda su familia. Generalmente sale muy temprano por la mañana a “taxear”, como él lo llama, y termina a las 6 o 7 de la noche, llegando muy cansado a su hogar. Jhonny trabaja con muchas ganas y energía, y esa alegría les transmite a sus pasajeros, de los que ya tiene varios clientes fieles. 
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se compromete pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita será utilizado en la reparación de algunas fallas mecánicas de su auto para que pueda brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Jhonny is a hard working, 28 year old young man. He lives with his wife, Doris, and their children. Alexander is 13 and Válerie is 12. They live in their own house. He learned to drive a car when he was very young. Since then he converted this activity into his primary source of income, which he uses to pay all of the family’s expenses. He generally leaves very early in the morning to “taxear” (taxi around), as he calls it. He finishes at six or seven at night; he arrives home very tired. Jhonny works with great passion and energy. This happiness is transmitted to his passengers. He already has many loyal customers. This is his second loan with MFP. He promises to make his payments punctually. He will use the money he is now asking for to repair some mechanical problems with his car. He will do this to be able to offer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his auto

loans.name: Fiona

texts.en:
Fiona M. is 24 years old and is married with two children. The first is two years old and the second is eight months of age.  Fiona lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Fiona owns a small shop which has sold different kinds of products since 2008. She employs one person in her business which she operates every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. Before starting this business she was a housewife and was not able to provide all her family’s needs.

With this loan, Fiona plans to expand her business which, through the increased profits, will help her to change the life of her family.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael is 58 years old and married with 7 children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to pull her business and family above poverty. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor M. is from the village of Barina-ut, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Eleonor is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Eleonor operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling shrimp and other varieties of fish in the local community. Eleonor has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eleonor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleonor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Eleonor is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.
