Ha tenido  dos   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sayda Carol S. S. works at the Los Espinoza public school as a primary school teacher.  She has worked there for fourteen years.  She is married and has two school aged children.

She has had two loans from CEPRODEL, which she has used to purchase construction materials to expand and improve her home.  The loans have benefited her very much because she has been able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase sand, cement, stones, stone blocks, flooring, and doors

loans.name: Bancy

texts.en:
Bancy, age 37, has operated a tailoring business for 12 years. She makes and sells new clothes and does mending on older clothes. She also makes and sells bags. 

She is requesting a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy stocks of fabric.

A single mother of one, Bancy describes herself as hard-working, and she hopes to open more outlets in future. Since joining Faulu Kenya, Bancy's life has changed and her business has grown.

loans.use: To buy stocks of fabric

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabet  tiene 24 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 4 años decidió generar ingresos económicos para su familia, desde entonces trabaja de manera independiente, además que posee un talento para la cocina y es así que prepara tamales (plato típico peruano), por otro lado vende también algunos platillos en las afueras de un centro educativo. Se siente muy contenta de desarrollar esta actividad, pues le  permite ser independiente y obtener ganancias para el bienestar de su familia. En adelante desea implementar su negocio y captar más clientes. Es crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para preparar tamales.
texts.en:
Elizabet is 24 years old.  She lives with her husband and 3 children in her own home.  More than 4 years ago she decided to make income for her family.  Since then she has been working independently.  She has a talent for cooking and she prepares tamales (a typical Peruvian dish).  She also sells some dishes outside a school.  She feels very happy to be in this business since it allows her to be independent and earn money for the well-being of her family.  In the future, she would like to keep her business going and attract more customers.

This is Elizabet's second loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has this financial support and she also likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to those people who will fund her loan since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will use her loan to invest in buying ingredients with which to make tamales.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make tamales with

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irma; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de zapallo y venta de maíz, el zapallo lo vende en el distrito de Calca y el maíz lo vende en la ciudad de Juliaca, la socia tiene pequeños terrenos de cultivo donde siembra maíz y zapallo, la socia quiere tener una tienda para poder vender las verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes para el terreno de cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Irma belongs to the 'Virgen Natividad' community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Irma is 24 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling squash and corn.  She sells the squash in Calca district and the corn in the city of Juliaca.  Irma has some small plots of land where she grows corn and squash.  She would like to have a store where she can sell her vegetables.  She is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers for her crops.

Irma is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita tiene 64 años, es una madre de familia, amable y emprendedora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. El trabajo a la que se dedica Felicita, es el bordado y chompas de algodón para niños y niñas, prendas que tienen mucha demanda y más en temporada de verano. Por otro lado es apreciado en el extranjero, por ello debe aumentar la producción de esta mercadería, procura siempre en crear nuevos diseños, eso garantiza el aumento de sus ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede realizarlo desde la comodidad de su casa, sin descuidar a su familia. Por ahora su prioridad es dejar de trabajar como intermediario y ella misma vender su mercadería a las propias empresas extranjera. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual, por que tranquilamente acceda a posteriores préstamos. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará diversidad de hilos y demás accesorios para continuar realizando su trabajo.
texts.en: Felicita is 64 years old, a mother, kind and enterprising, she lives in her own home, with her husband and their 2 children. The work that Felicita does, is embroidery and making cotton sweaters for boys and girls, garments that are in demand and more so in summer. On the other hand it is valued abroad, and for this reason she must increase production of this merchandise, she always tries to create new designs, this guarantees an increase in profits. What she likes most about her work is that she can do it from the comfort of her home, without neglecting her family. For now her priority is to stop working as an intermediary and sell her merchandise herself to the foreign companies. It is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make all her payments on time, because she wants to have access to future loans. With this loan, she will buy a variety of threads and other accessories to keep doing her work.

loans.use: To buy thread and other accessories to make garments.

loans.name: Kanykei's Group

texts.en:
In contemporary Kyrgyzstan, grocery stores, supermarkets and bazaars are mostly accessible in main cities and towns. In small villages and other centers of population, one can get consumer goods only from small shops, which every village has. 

Kanykei M., 26, is a member of this group. A year ago she spent her savings on building a small shop for consumer goods by her house in a small town of Toktogul. Every week she buys goods wholesale and sells them to the local population. The starting capital of 20,000 KGS was taken from the salary of her husband, who is a cab driver. Now Kanykei makes 5,000 KGS monthly, but because of the constantly rising costs of groceries, transportation and taxes, Kanykei is not succeeding in covering her costs. 

She is applying for a loan in order to cover all her expenses and broaden the assortment in her shop. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her shop

loans.name: Francia

texts.es:
Francia de 51 años, es una mujer trabajadora que ha trabajado para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus cinco hijos.  Como una microempresaria inicio con su negocio en un puesto de venta de comida rápida como venta de alitas asadas, plátanos y maíz asado. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 15h00pm vendiendo su comida a sus clientes hasta las 19h00pm. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere continuar con él y seguir en el ambiente de la comida a persona del sector. Quiere comprar con el préstamo carnes para dar más especialidades a sus clientes.  En el futuro quiere asegurar la vida económica de sus hijos con un capital beneficioso.
texts.en:
Francia is 51 years old and works hard to help her husband with the expenses of their five children. As a microentrepreneur, she started a business at a fast food stand where she sells grilled chicken wings, plantains, and roasted corn.

She currently works from 3pm selling food to her customers until 7pm. Francia has many aspirations for her business, so she wants to continue forward as an expert in the food trade. She wants to use this loan to buy meat in order to prepare her specialties for her customers. In the future, she wants to secure her children’s financial future with useful capital.

loans.use: Purchase meat

loans.name: Yao  Amétépe

texts.fr: Monsieur  Yawo  est âgé de 25 ans.  Il fait la photocopie. Il a commencé en 1996 l’activité et  s’approvisionne à la librairie Bon Pasteur. Ensuite, il satisfait les clients dans son établissement  CHATO & FILS à côté de la douane du port Autonome de Lomé. Il demande un prêt  pour acheter une photocopieuse.
texts.en: Mr. Yawo is 25 years old. He makes photocopies.  He started his business in 1996 and stocks up at the Bon Pasteur (Good Shepard) bookstore.  Then he serves his customers at his establishment CHATO & SONS next to the customs office of the Autonomous Port of Lomé.  He is asking for a loan to buy a photocopier.

loans.use: Purchase of a photocopier

loans.name: 'friendship' Group

texts.en:
Mercy G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of two borrowers, called 'Friendship'. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children who are between the ages of 14 and 5 years. She was only able to attend school through 7th grade due to financial constraints. She cares for one sibling. 

For 3 years, she has been selling used clothes in Via Town Market, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 15,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars business loan to buy more used clothes to resell. Her dreams are to expand her business, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Rosa Teresa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 54 años de edad y vive junto a dos de sus hijos en una de las zonas marginales de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial y con mucho movimiento de transporte. Es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace más de once años a la venta de raspadillas y comida en un puesto ambulante situado en una de las principales calles de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Ella vende raspadillas durante la temporada de verano y comida en la época de invierno, esta actividad constituye una de las principales fuentes de ingreso para la economía de su familia y por ello trata de mantenerse en el negocio de la mejor manera posible.

Rosa desea arreglar la carreta en la trabaja ya que está demasiado deteriorada, asimismo desea adquirir un nuevo toldo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.  Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and she lives together with two of her children in a suburban region of the city of Chiclayo. It is a highly commercial region involved in a great deal of transportation. It is the capital city the region of Lambayeque. 

For more than eleven years she has been selling flavored ice and prepared foods from a cart traveling one of the principal streets of the city of Chiclayo. She sells flavored ice in the summer season and prepared foods during the winter season. This business has been a primary source of income for her family and it is the reason why she tries to keep it in the best shape possible. 

Rosa wishes to repair the cart with which she works because it is in poor shape. She also wants to purchase a new awning. For this reason she has approached Edpyme Alternativa for a first time loan in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. She is a calm and responsible person. Those people that know her appreciate her very much.

loans.use: to repair the cart with which she works.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 35years old, married to a driver and has 4 children. Beatrice has a shop where she sells beans, and she also has a furnace for making bricks. A furnace is used to dry bricks so that they can be used to construct firm houses. And, the better you equip the furnace, the better quality bricks it makes! Beatrice has had these businesses for 6 years.

Beatrice is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her businesses,she will buy beans and equip her furnace. With the profits, Beatrice plans to buy a plot of land on which to grow some crops.

loans.use: To buy beans and equip her furnace.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos V. tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el barrio el Centro de Marcovia Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y calzado usado, Carlos es honrado y muy dedicado a su negocio, el cual tiene 4 años de tenerlo, tiene varios clientes de marcovia y de lugares como santa cruz y monjaras tambien distribuye su producto en las meloneras y en las diferentes azucareras de la localidad.
Carlos se levanta todos los dias a las cinco de la mañana para salir a vender su producto y dos dias de la semana los deja para cobrar ya que vende su producto al credito. 
Su esposa se dedica a la elaboracion de refrescos naturales para vender.
juntos trabajan duro para salir adelante con sus hijos.
su meta es crecer poco a poco con su negocio y que le genere ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos V., 39, lives in the El Centro de Marcovia neighborhood in Choluteca.  He sells used clothes and shoes.  He is honest and very dedicated to his business which he’s been doing for 4 years.  He has several customers in Marcovia and in places like Santa Cruz and Monjaras too.  He also sells his product at the local melon packing firms and sugar mills.

Carlos rises daily at 5am to go out to sell and he dedicated two days a week for payment collection since he sells on credit.  

His wife makes natural beverages to sell.  Together they work hard to get ahead with their children.  His goal is to gradually grow with his business so that it will generate profits leading to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes and used shoes.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen S., 26, is married and lives with her husband and two young children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband have been garment factory workers since 2007, and are able to make US$3 each per day. They also farm in the rainy season. To earn more money, Pen S. is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase a plot of land and fertilizer. S. appears in the photograph with her family.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland and fertilizer

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia lives with her common-law husband with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cornelia is 54 years old.

Cornelia has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

Cornelia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene siete hijos.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un ciclo, su primer préstamo solicitado fue  por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de huevos y animales domésticos.
En la actualidad  solicitará  un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará en la compra de tres unidades de ovejas para luego venderlos, en el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo e hijos.
Su sueño es tener más ganados.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del prestamo.
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the “Hermanas de Choquetanca II” Community Bank located in Ilave district, El Collao province, in the department of Puno. She is 39-years old, married, and has seven children. She did not attend school.

Agustina has had one previous loan with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos. She borrowed S/.500 soles to invest in her business buying and selling eggs and domestic animals. She is now seeking a new loan of S/.1000 soles to buy three sheep which she will later sell. 

Her husband and children help with the business. Augustina’s dream is to have more livestock. What she most likes about the Community Bank is the ease of obtaining a loan.

loans.use: to buy three sheep

loans.name: Joselina

texts.en:
Joselina is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Joselina has a retail shop that sells rice & cheese cakes. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like sugar, flour & eggs.

Joselina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Joselina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like sugar, flour & eggs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 28-year-old, married mother of four children. She runs her cashew nut business in Kiwandani, Kilifi. The business has been in operation for the past four years. 

Josephine has been a KADET client, and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase more stock of cashew nuts for her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and start up another business.

Her dream is to become successful.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a divorced woman with five children, four of whom attend school while the other is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water but no electricity.
Chinyavu operates a grocery business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of purchasing vegetables for her business hence making lower profits. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business to earn more profits in the future.
With her loan of 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, cabbages and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables, cabbages and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Saturnina has a shop where she sells hypo or cleansing solutions by the liter. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy raw materials needed for making the hypo or cleansing solutions.

Saturnina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Saturnina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making hypo or cleansing solutions.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Talentosas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 27 años y es madre de 02 niñas; la mayor tiene 10 años estudiante de primaria y la menor tiene 05 años estudiante de inicial.
Ella inició su negocio con S/.300.00 nuevos soles, se dedica a la venta de refrescos, viéndose en la necesidad de cubrir sus gastos familiares y gracias al Banco Comunal de Manuela Ramos y muy motivada por su familia, decide incrementar su negocio con gaseosas, esto en asociación con su hermana, ambas se ayudan mutuamente, poco a poco fue ganando clientela de los diferentes talleres cercanos y transeúntes a quienes atiende con la amabilidad que le caracteriza.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará baldes plásticos grandes, vasos de vidrio, mesas, sillas, paquetes de gaseosas de las diferentes  marcas, tamaños y sabores, sacos de azúcar y diversidad de frutas de la región para surtir su negocio.
Elizabeth sueña con tener un local propio para su negocio, de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y birndar a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan. Está muy agradecida por los préstamos del Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Mujeres Talentosas” (The Talented Women) which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 27 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two daughters. The older child is a ten-year-old student in elementary school and the younger one is a five-year-old kindergarten student.

Elizabeth started her business with 300 PEN. She sells soft drinks because she needs to cover her family expenses. Thanks to her Communal Bank and Manuela Ramos, she is very motivated to work on behalf of her family. She decided to increase her business by adding sodas. Elizabeth works with her sister and they both help one another. Gradually over time, she has gained customers who include workers from nearby factories and pedestrians off the street. She attends to them in a friendly manner.

With this new loan of 2000 PEN, Elizabeth will buy large plastic buckets, glasses, tables, chairs, packets of sodas (of various brands, sizes, and flavors), sacks of sugar, and different regional fruits so that she can restock her business. She dreams of having her own location for her business so that she can improve her income and provide her children everything they need. Elizabeth is very grateful for the loans from Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: to buy buy large plastic buckets, glasses, tables, chairs, packets of sodas, sacks of sugar, and different regional fruits.

loans.name: Cherif Sidy

texts.fr: Cherif sidy est un client depuis le 08/06/2011 ,jeune homme de 24ans, celibatair ,il habite avec sa famille dans une grande ville au sud du senegal. Chauffeur depuis 3ans avec son taxi qui est tombe en panne depuis deux mois.Apres il a decidé de fair une demande de crédit au niveau de uimcec pour réparer son taxi et reprendre ses activités de transports.Avec son bénéfice il veut épargner pour éventuellement acheter un autre taxi.
texts.en: Cherif Sidy has been a client since June 8, 2011. He is a young man, 24 years old, and unmarried living in a large city in southern Senegal. He has been a driver for three years with his taxi, which has been out of service for two months. Since then, he decided to take out a loan with the micro-finance institution UIMCEC to repair his taxi and return to his work in transport. With his profits, he wants to save money perhaps to buy another taxi.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his taxi

loans.name: Petero

texts.en: Petero wants a loan to buy alcohol to resell. He is 50 years old and hails from Kyenjojo District in Uganda. He is a father of nine children. He lives with his children and their mother in a semi-permanent house. He sold off two of his cows to start up his current business and he has been selling alcohol for 15 years. With the money generated, he has been able to educate his children and complete building his house. His major challenge is limited funds to meet the high demands and his dream is to be able to supply at least 10 districts.

loans.use: to buy alcohol to resell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, age 59, is engaged in preparing and selling macaroni soup as well as mikki and pancit, which are popular local stir-fried noodle dishes. She cooks these dishes fresh every day and has a place in the school where she sells her prepared foods. She is highly skilled in her occupation after 30 years of experience, and she is able to send her three children to school with her earnings of of PhP 500 per day.
  
She now wants to grow her business, which is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 to buy vegetables, meat, macaroni, and the ingredients for mikki and pancit. She also wants to add soft drinks to her offerings, since there is high demand among her customers for beverages to consume after a meal. She is confident that this will allow her to increase her target market and generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, macaroni, and the ingredients for mikki and pancit, as well as adding soft drinks to her offerings

loans.name: Praxides

texts.en:
Praxides is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Praxides has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Praxides has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Praxides hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en:
Zeynab is from Imishli. She is 38 years old and lives with her family: her husband, two daughters, and 78-year-old mother. She operates a variety store adjacent to her house. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 1000 AZN to buy additional groceries for her grocery store, such as candies, canned goods and biscuits. She has a good loan history and this is her fifth loan from AqroInvest. 

Zeynab hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for her store.

loans.name: Elsa Argentina

texts.es: Elsa solcitó el credito para pagar los módulos de titulación de su carrera de Administración de Empresas. Esto le permitirá crecer como persona y profesionalmente. Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que la única forma de salir adelante es estudiando. El costo de la carrera ha sido un desafío para ella, el cual ha ido superando poco a poco, y para la finalización espera conseguir el crédito.
texts.en: She requested the loan to pay the costs associated with her getting her degree in Business Administration.  This will allow her to grow as a person and professionally.  She very much wants to get ahead and thinks that the only way to do so is by studying.  The cost of her career has been a challenge for her that she’s gradually overcome and now to finish it all up she hopes to get the loan.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation costs.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is from the village of Sta.Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Ella is married and has eight adult-aged children.

To make a living, Ella owns and operates a business in a food sector particularly in selling "suman"  in the local community. Ella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,100 PHP a month for these activities.

Ella is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients and other raw materials in making "suman". Suman is a Filipino rice cake steamed in banana leaves.

In 2011, Ella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to engage into  business.She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business and improve her business and living situation.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and other raw materials in making "suman"

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 20 years old and lives in Trinidad, Bohol. Analiza manages a rice farm given to her by her parents. She hires a few local farmers to help till her land and grow rice crops. 

Analiza is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor. Analiza is saving for her and her baby's future. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds fertilizers and  to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for sell.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 52 and lives with her husband, mother-in-law and son in the village of Getahovit in the Tavush region. She also has four married daughters who no longer live in the family home. Anahit’s husband works in construction, her mother-in-law is a pensioner and her son is a student.

Previously Anahit worked at a bakery as a confectioner. Since 2000, however, she has been running her own stall in her house’s yard where she sells food, household goods and clothes. As she has a very large choice of goods, her stall is widely popular, and she has many regular customers. Her business has allowed her to solve her family’s needs, such as paying for her daughters’ education and weddings.

Before the New Year holidays arrive, Anahit wants to increase her shop’s assortment of goods, so she is requesting a 500,000 AMD loan to buy beverages, canned food, candy and various household goods for her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned food, candy and various household goods for her business.

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en: Pisey, 42, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, and her son is a construction worker. Because the motorbike is too old and breaks down too often, Pisey is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as motor taxi. By doing so, her husband can earn more money from his transportation service because his motorbike is new and comfortable. In the future, she plans to run a food store next to the factory, build a new house, and send her youngest son to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as motor taxi.

loans.name: C 7988 Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Assoumpta is 33 years old and has three children between the ages of 3 and 7 years old. She owns an agriculture business selling beans, potatoes, rice, etc. Her business is open from 7 am until 6 pm every day except for the weekend. She is the leader of this group, which is called 7988 DUFATANYE in the local language, and she is raising up her hand. 

Assoumpta has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her agriculture business by buying fertilizer to grow her products, such as beans, potatoes, rice, etc., to sell. She will save any profit for her future and she will be able to buy another field to cultivate.

loans.use: to expand her agriculture business by purchasing fertilizer to grow her products to sell.

loans.name: Sabali Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Sabali IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à KAZANGASSO, un des villages du cercle de Bla  , 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 2eme  prêt avec l’institution, le prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec SALI SENI,  1ere débout avec un bébé sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,50 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de Bla et Dougouwolo, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 55.000 FCFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
NB SATOU  était t absente pour raison de famille.

loans.use: Frais de labour,  achat d’intrants et de semence

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 43 year old man married with four children. He has studied Accounting  and attained CPA 2.He runs a Microfinance organization.

Upon receiving the loan, Moses intends to buy and stock EcoZoom energy saving stoves and solar lights. This is to aid him to reach out to more of his clients who need the products and cannot afford to pay on time.

“This business is not so easy. My clients are people with little or even at times no income. Given my background in accounts, I worked out a system where I’m paid in installments. 

He has been in business for the last 6 years and has fostered a good relationship with EcoZoom for four months now. He enjoys working with EcoZoom because it has helped transform lives of many people. People enjoy cooking on the stoves because they are energy saving and fast and constant lighting through the solar lights. Many children can easily read from home at night using the solar lights.

His main challenge is inadequate funds to keep his business afloat. Some of his clients take longer to repay back their installments and as a result further strains his finances. He runs out of stock and cannot replenish if he is still in debt 

His future goal is to be a big distributor in his home area.

loans.use: To purchase energy saving stoves and solar lights at wholesale price

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Этого мужчину зовут Анвар. Анвар отец троих детей и мастер спорта. Анвар с женой переживают нелегкие времена. Их младшая двухлетняя дочка болеет. Много средств и денег они потратили на ее здоровье. Вся их семья борются за маленькую жизнь. Анвар сейчас обращается за помощью. Ее дочке нужна оплатить лечение. Медикаменты и обследования у врачей стоят дорого. У Анвара вся надежда остается только на кредит. Поддержите его в трудную минуту.
texts.en:
This man is Anvar. Anvar has three children, and is a master of sports. Anvar and his wife do not lead an easy life. Their youngest daughter, who is two years old, is ill. They have spent a lot of funds and money on her health. Their whole family is struggling for her life. 

Anvar is now appealing for help. He needs to pay for his daughter's treatment. Medication and the doctor's checkup costs a lot of money. Anvar's only hope is to rely on a loan. Support him in his time of difficulty!

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's treatment.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Akouvi was born about 35 years ago, she is married with one (01) daughter and is in charge of four (04) other children. She lives in the village of Ahonkpè. Her husband is a polygamous farmer lives with another woman and does not care for Akouvi. Akouvi therefore struggles to feed the children and paradoxically to take care of her husband in order to win his favour and protection. Mrs. A. Akouvi’s main activity his catering services to students during brake time. As she has limited financial resources, she is not able to build up a security stock and has to buy input on a daily basis. This increases her costs and reduces her profit margin. But thanks to the quality of her food and the hygienic conditions in which she serves, her kiosk receives the visit of very numerous students and even teachers. Though she is illiterate, she has always shown a sense of good management et good morality. She applied for a new credit of $800 to build up stocks of rice, oil, pasta in order to reduce supply costs. She will therefore be able to make good business to increase her revenues for and provide a better care to her family.

Madame A. Akouvi, née il y a environ 35 ans, est mariée et mère d’une (01) fille et a quatre (04) autres personnes à sa charge. Elle vit dans le village de Ahonkpé. Le mari paysan et polygame vit chez la femme de son choix et ne s’occupe pas d’elle. La femme se débrouille seule, non seulement pour nourrir ses enfants, mais paradoxalement pour entretenir l’homme pour attirer sa faveur et sa protection. Madame A. Akouvi a pour activité principale, la restauration des élèves pendant leurs récréations. Limitée par les moyens financiers, elle n’arrive pas faire un stock de sécurité de vivres et s’approvisionne quotidiennement. Ce qui augmente ses coûts et réduit ses marges bénéficiaires. Or de par la qualité de ses repas et l’hygiène qui l’entoure, son kiosque est beaucoup plus fréquenté par la plupart des élèves voire des enseignants. Bien qu’elle soit analphabète, elle a toujours fait preuve d’une bonne gestion et d’une bonne moralité. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle aujourd’hui, un crédit de $800 pour faire des stocks de riz, d’huile, de pâte alimentaires afin d’amoindrir ses coûts d’approvisionnement. Elle pourra faire alors de bonnes affaires pour augmenter ses revenus pour un meilleur entretien de sa famille.

loans.use: to build up stocks of rice, oil, pasta

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta Julieta Joao M., 25 years of age and a native of Maputo, is a single mother of 3 children. She grew up under the care of her single mother, and due to an early pregnancy she could not continue her studies beyond the 7th grade. Since her youth she has assumed the full administration of a business, which helps her support her children and 6 siblings who have never lived with their parents. Since 2006, through the suggestion of a friend, she has come to know Hluvuku-Adsema (Field Partner), who she approached and requested information for 2007. She owns a small commercial establishment within the local market whose principal business is the sale of everyday products. With the business’ revenue she supports familial responsibilities and her first child’s educational expenses; her other children are not yet of age to attend school. Her youngest child has suffered from hydrocephalus for over a year and necessitates special medical attention; hence, family medical expenses are extremely high. With the loan of 1,000 dollars she intends to increase the volume of merchandise at both her stands so that customers can avoid daily excursions to the city to purchase essential goods. The loan will also allow her to diversify the products so as to attract more customers to her stands and actively respond to their demands. Marta’s business’ impact on the community is great because she serves as a young role model, someone who is self-employed alongside her husband.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Marta julieta João M., de 25 anos de idade, mãe de três filhos, solteira, natural de Maputo. Cresceu sob responsabilidade de uma mãe solteira e devido a gravidez precoce não pode estudar para alem da 7ª classe. Desde a adolescência assume na integra um negocio como, forma de sustentar os seus filhos e ajudar os seus 6 irmãos, atendendo que nunca viveram com os seus pais. Desde o ano de 2006 por indicação da amiga soube da existência da HLUVUKU, tendo aproximado para pedido de informações já em 2007. dispõe de um pequeno estabelecimento comercial dentro do mercado local, cujo principal negócio é venda de produtos de primeira necessidade. Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares, as despesas escolares do seu 1º filho, pois os outros dois ainda não atingiram a idade escolar. O filho mais novo padece hidrocefalia a mais de 1 ano e, este precisa de atenção médica especial, dai que as despesas de saúde na família são extremamente altas. Com o empréstimo de 25.000.00mt, pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria nas suas duas bancas, de forma a evitar viagens diárias a cidade para efectuar compras e vai permitir diversificar os produtos assim como atrair mais clientes para as suas bancas, respondendo positivamente as exigências dos mesmos. A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade porque ela é um exemplo de jovens que conseguem criar o seu auto – emprego e trabalha junto com o actual marido.

loans.use: To increase the stock of food in her shop

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia runs a convenience store in the Villa Ingenio zone of El Alto. Her husband is a police officer, and they have three kids, ages 10, 7 and 3. They live in their own house in the same area as the store. The income Patricia and her husband make helps them take care of their family.

The loan will be used to increase supplies in the store, which will allow her to satisfy the growing demand for her products. This will allow her to be able to improve the quality of life for her family.

This is her second loan, and her credit history makes her a good candidate to receive another loan to help strengthen her business and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Patricia es comerciante de Abarrotes en la Zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto, el esposo presta servicio en la Policía, tiene 3 hijos de 10, 7 y 3 años, vive en casa propia ubicada en la misma zona del negocio. Los ingresos que generan Patricia y esposo le permite la manutención de su familia. El destino del crédito es para incrementar mercadería, lo que le permitirá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que existe en su negocio e incrementar sus ventas para poder ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida para su familia. Es el segundo crédito, su buen antecedente le permite acceder a otro crédito para poder fortalecer su actividad comercial e incrementar sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Buy more products for convenience store.

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
Maria Amparo is 48 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. She has a grocery store in her home. She belongs to the loan group Flor de Caña 2. The other members of this group are Maria Angelina Jimenez Lopez, who crafts homemade mats from palm leaves, Karina Guadalupe Gordillo, who has a grocery store, and Guadalupe Jimenez Perez, who sells panela, pieces of compacted sugar she prepares herself. They will invest their loan in supporting their businesses by buying what they need to increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA AMPARO , TIENE 48 AÑOS , CASADA 3 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO ES AGRICULTOR . ELLA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA .PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DE CAÑA 2 .CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA PARA ABASTECER SU NEGOCIO Y OBTENER MAS GANANCIAS.PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DE CAÑA 2 LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON : MARIA ANGELINA JIMENEZ LOPEZ ( COMPRA DE PALMAS CON LAS CUALES HACEN TEJIDOS DE TAPETES ARTESANALES) KARINA GUADALUPE GORDILLO ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) Y GUADALUPE JIMENEZ PEREZ ( VENDE PANELA , TROZOS DE AZUCAR COMPACTADA QUE ELLA PREPARA ) INVERTIRAN SU PRESTAMO EN APOYAR A SUS PROPIOS NEGOCIOS COMPRANDO LO NECESARIO PARA AUMENTAR LAS VENTAS .

loans.use: Sales of homemade food products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Rosa T. is 41 years old. She is married and she has 3 children. Her residency is located in Albasine - a town located in Maputo city. She sells meat from her home. She joined the program on May 10th, 2007 with a loan of 3.000 MT and now she is going to start the second cycle of the loan. She will request the amount of 5.000 MT to be paid off in 5 months. She plans to invest the loan amount in business.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa T. tem 41 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 3 filhos.Tem a sua residência no bairro Albasine, arredores da cidade de Maputo. Vende carne por encomenda e parte vende em casa. Entrou para o programa em 10 de Maio de 2007, com um empréstimo inicial de 3.000 MT e agora vai para o 2º ciclo de empréstimo e pretende tomar 5.000 MT para pagar em 5 meses, os quais pretende aplicar no negócio.

loans.use: Aumento do Stock

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander owns a business distributing a very popular food product in Ukraine – sausages and a meat product called kielbasa. A hard-working man with an entrepreneurial bent, he started his business two years ago and has been very successful. He has competitors that watch him and are interested to learn how he conducts his business and does so well. With the booming economy in Ukraine, demand for services like Alexander’s is very strong and will likely increase as time goes on. Alexander is well positioned to benefit from increased business. He has requested a loan from Nadiya Ukraine to increase his available working capital. This will not only give him money to use for operations, but will also help as he pursues his goal of purchasing a new vehicle for his work. We are glad for this opportunity to help Alexander continue building a successful enterprise.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia is very happy to have taken an important role in her family's economy. At the moment she is married with two children. She puts in as much effort as she can so that she can stabilize the economy of her household. She decided to open her own store five years ago because her husband, who is a taxi driver, had earnings that sometimes weren’t very sufficient to cover common needs. Her store is now one of the best around the city she resides in; her good service and friendliness earns the loyalty of her neighbors and friends. She is motivated to progress with the objective of satisfying the needs of her household. She needs a loan to increase the variety of products she sells. Your helping hand can make Alicia achieve a better economical situation for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe and Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Alicia, está muy contenta por haberse convertido en parte importante de la economía de su hogar. Actualmente casada y con dos hijos, que son su razón de vivir, se esfuerza para ofrecerles un hogar cálido y apacible.Para estabilizar la economía de su hogar decidió abrir su tienda hace cinco años porque su esposo que es taxista tenía ingresos que muchas veces eran insuficientes para cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de su hogar y en la actualidad, a pesar de que existen varias tiendas colindantes su pequeño centro de trabajo se ha convertido es una de las mejores, el buen trato y amabilidad que ella ofrece permite el ingreso diario de sus vecinos y amigos.Ella es motivada por el ingreso que percibe a diario y por las constantes visitas de sus clientes para seguir esforzándose con el objetivo de satisfacer plenamente las necesidades de su hogar. Solicita un préstamo para aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece. Sólo tu mano solidaria podrá hacer que Alicia logre mejorar aún más la economía de su hogar.

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity and variety of everyday items.

loans.name: Ni Luh Nandi

texts.id:
Besides farming, Ni Luh Nandi also rear cows. Ni Luh Nandi rears 3 mother cows since they were 6 months old. At this moment, Ni Luh Nandi, requires additional funding of Rp. 5,000,000,- (about USD530) which will be used to purchase another mother cow. Because currently with 3 cows it has not generate maximum returns. 2 cows are currently pregnant. In order to minimize the cost of feed, sufficient greens like grass, leaves of the jackfruit, and other tyoes of greens thus requiring lots of effort from Ni Luh Nandi to cut grass everyday. Annually, net income from the off-springs is Rp. 2.500.000,- (USD260) per off-spring. Thus from the earnings from this effort will be used to pay the family’s expenses and children’s education.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Selain sebagai petani Ni Luh Nandi juga memiliki usaha beternak sapi. Ni Luh Nandi memelihara 3 induk sapi yang sudah dipelihara dari umur 6 bulan. Saat ini Ni Luh Nandi membutuhkan tambahan modal sebesar Rp.5,000,000,- yang nantinya akan dipergunakan untuk membeli 1 induk lagi. Karena saat ini dengan memelihara 3 induk sapi masih dirasa belum menghasilkan hasil yang maksimal. Dua induk sapi yang Luh Dandi pelihara saat ini sedang dalam keadaan hamil. Untuk pengeluaran pakannya tidak seperti sapi penggemukan , cukup dengan hijauan seperti rumput, daun nangka, dan masih banyak lagi hijauan yang lain Tetapi ini membutuhkan tenaga Ni Luh Nandi untuk menyabit rumput tiap hari . Setiap 1 tahun dari hasil anaknya saja Ni Luh Nandi mendapatkan keuntungan bersih Rp.2.500.000,-.per ekor.Jadi dari keuntungan yang diperoleh ini bisa dipergunakan untuk biaya kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga biaya sekolah anak –anaknya.

loans.use: Purchase cows (Membeli sapi)

loans.name: Agustina Josefina

texts.en:
The sale of various products and making and selling clothing are the businesses which Ms. Agustina Josefina C. dedicates her time out of her home in the city of Leon.

The small businesses are run out of her home with the hope of improving their economic condition. The clothing business sets itself apart as being different from others since she designs the clothing she sells and she also works with custom orders, which she has been doing since she was little. She says she was always drawn to dressmaking and decided to begin these businesses to support her home and help her elderly parents.

To improve her business, Ms. Agustina has had other loans with Ceprodel and she feels very happy because they have helped her purchase the various products for her store and the fabric to make the dresses and sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de productos varios (pulpería) y la elaboración y venta de ropa son los negocios a que se dedica la señora Agustina Josefina C. en la ciudad de León en su casa de habitación.

El pequeño negocio de pulpería lo posee en su hogar con la esperanza de mejorar su condición económica de igual manera con el negocio de venta de ropa. el negocio de venta de ropa se caracteriza por ser diferente a los demás debido a que ella elabora los vestidos y los vende, además trabaja por encargo siendo este su negocio desde muy pequeña. Comenta que siempre se sintió atraída por la costura y decide poner estos negocios para mantener su hogar y apoyar a sus padres que ya son mayores de edad.

Para mejorar su negocio, la señora Agustina ha realizado créditos en CEPRODEL y se siente muy contenta porque le han servido de mucho beneficio para la adquisición de los productos de la pulpería y de la tela para elaborar sus vestidos para luego venderlos.

loans.use:
Purchase products for a small general store and purchase fabric
for clothing.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Thank you very much for the first loan that I obtained through you. It was very useful, and by business has grown as a result. I want to remodel my store and improve it for the summer season so that the merchandise will be in a better condition, and my clients will be feeling more comfortable when they come to buy. I am requesting a loan of $1200 to remodel and improve my business.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Gracias por el primer préstamo que obtuve con ustedes fue de gran ayuda para mi negocio a crecido mucho. Quiero remodelar el negocio y acondicionarlo para esta temporada de calor y así la mercancía estará en mejor estada y mis clientes estarán más cómodos cuando venga a comprar su mercancía. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para remodelar y acondicionar el negocio.

loans.use: To remodel and improve her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 45-year-old woman who works and lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs. She has 3 children. Mariam sells women's clothing. This is the second time she's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. She needs to buy more merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is married and has two children, ages 4 and 8 years old. Latifa owns a small food store, which she started in 2005. Everyday she works from 6am to 7pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

She is requesting a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: to buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine I. sells in the Shibiri community in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business since 1988 and she acquired her skills over three months of training. She is 30 years old and married with three children.

She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. Catherine needs for a loan of $850.00 to buy more kerosene in her shop. She is grateful to all who make the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a forty-eight-year-old widow with six children. She lost her husband eight years ago in a car accident. As a single parent, the total responsibility of the children rests upon her shoulders. Through hard work, she has been able to support three children to finish school. 

For the past twenty years, Comfort has been trading in palm oil, vegetable oil and salt. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk gallons of vegetable oil, palm oil and salt to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to pay her children’s educational fees. She belongs to the community group called El-shadai Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan. Comfort is in the photograph taken at her business site.

loans.use: To buy bulk gallons of vegetable oil, palm oil and salt.

loans.name: Shani

texts.en:
Shani is 25 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 6 and 1. She has owned a small food vending store since 2004. She works from 8am to 6pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Shani now hopes for a loan to buy more food items such as rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables, and bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Greetings from Bernadette in Kacyiru, Rwanda! She is 30 years old and married with 4 children. Bernadette owns her shop in Kacyiru town, which she opened up in 2000. She sells various items such as biscuits, sugar, cassava flour, small fish, drinks, etc. She employs two people in her business.

Bernadette is looking for a loan worth 521,075 Frws to buy more items to increase her stock. Her loan will be repaid monthly for 8 months.

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Inició su negocio vendiendo comida en los cuadros de beisbol en alianza con su hija, ha fortalecido su negocio con los créditos que le viene otorgando ADIM desde hace dos años. Ahora tiene en su casa un local donde atienden a los clientes y viajeros, ofreciendo variedad de comidas y gaseosas, entre otros productos menores como pan, fósforos, etc. 

Tiene otros hijos que viven en Costa Rica, en el negocio trabaja solamente con su hija, ella siente que ha mejorado en su negocio y como persona, es reconocida en la comunidad por su actividad, piensa seguir tomando créditos con ADIM para mejorar el local y ofrecer más productos, crecer más en sus ventas y salir adelante.
texts.en:
In partnership with her daughter, she started her business selling food at the baseball fields; she has strengthened her business with the loans that ADIM has been granting her over the last two years. Now she has premises in her home where she attends to clients and travelers by selling a variety of foods and drinks among other minor products such as bread, matches, etc.

She has other children that live in Costa Rica; only her daughter works with her in the business. She feels that she has improved both in her business and as a person, and that she is recognized in the community for her work. She thinks she will continue to take loans with ADIM in order to improve her premises and offer more products, in this way growing her sales more and getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Basic Goods

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana María inició el negocio por la necesidad de apoyar a su marido con el gasto, además porque sus hijos están chiquitos y no puede dejarlos solos por eso con la venta de cosméticos por catalogo le vende a sus vecinas y familiares y no tiene que trasladarse tanto.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $625 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder invertir en este mes para diciembre. Con tu apoyo ella seguira progresando.
texts.en:
Juana Maria started her business to help her husband with household expenses. Her children are still young and she can't leave them alone, so she began selling cosmetics from a catalog. She sells to her family and neighbors, so she doesn't have to travel far. Juana needs a loan of $625, which she'll repay in six months. She'll use the money to buy merchandise for the month of December. With your help Juana can keep progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Rostislav

texts.en:
For the last year, Rostislav has been investing his time and finances into developing his small business in Ivano-Frankivsk. He offers purified water supply and delivery services. Gained experience has equipped him to be a very successful entrepreneur. His business has grown to the point where he has been able to invest about 10,000 Grivnas in turnover capital.

Rostislav is known as a goal oriented business owner who is optimistic about the future. He is dreaming about developing a second business selling computers and offering related technical maintenance services. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to cover maintenance costs for his van which he uses to deliver water bottles to different locations in his home town. We believe financial assistance will help Rostislav continually meet the needs of his customers while providing for his own financial responsibilities.

loans.use: To cover van maintenance costs

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
There are three borrowers requesting this loan. They all live in Chomkasomroang Commune in Battambang Province.

The leader, Mrs. Sim S., 49, is widowed. She is a teacher, as well as a tailor, who works for an orphanage. She receives a salary of a $120 per month. Sometimes she earns additional income by sewing clothes for her neighbors in her house. She lives with two of her children, both of whom are single. Her first daughter works in a hotel; the other daughter is a student. S. has applied for a loan to purchase sewing materials and cloth for her tailoring business.

The two other borrowers are Mrs. Chan S. who is 58 and a widow, and Mrs. Yeam S. who is 31 and divorced. Mrs. Chan S. sells groceries and is requesting a loan to buy additional groceries for resale. Mrs. Yeam S. sells brooms for income and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials and cloth

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
El negocio de papelería de la señora Veronica Sanchez le esta haciendo falta mas mercancía de artículos escolares, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio y así tener mas variedad de productos.
Doña Veronica Sanchez es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a dos hijos de edad escolar y así su mama que le ayuda atender el negocio cundo ella no esta. Esta solicitando este crédito para poder tener más ingresos en su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Veronica Sanchez has an office supply store and she needs more school supplies, so she is asking for a loan to invest in her business and thereby have a greater variety of products. Veronica Sanchez is a single mother and is responsible for two school-aged children. Her mother helps her with the store when Veronica is unable to be there. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to have greater income in her business as it is the source of her family’s income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Нишонова Махбуба проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 31 год. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Торгует поэлитиленом. Продает клиенку для сельских жителей , которые используют ее для установки Парниковых сооружений. Сейчас она планирует увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита.Это даст возможность увеличить ассортимент товара. Это приведет  к развитию бизнеса. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahbuba N., 31, lives in Tursun-Zade, married, and has 2 children. Mahbuba sells plastic film, which is used by the villagers to cover greenhouses. This loan Mahbuba will use to increase the assortment of her products to expand her business. She plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Tam

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Tâm  38 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2000. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị Tâm là từ  kinh doanh hàng nước giải khát và dịch vụ Internet . Với sự hỗ trợ của chồng công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị đang ngày càng phát triển hơn đem lại cho gia đình chị Tâm thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm nước lọc bán  và  mua thêm máy tính để phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh Internet của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Tam is 38 yrs old, and joined TYM fund in 2000. Currently, her main source of income is her refreshment shop and Internet Cafe. With the help of her husband, her business is expanding every day bringing average monthly income of 345 USD. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 1150 USD to purchase bottled waters to sell and to purchase additional computers for her Internet Cafe.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia de 27 años, es una madre soltera muy dedicada a sus hijos; Ana de 10 y Aníbal de 6, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es darles una buena educación a sus queridos niños. Eligió ejercer la actividad de su familia, que es la crianza de truchas, desde muy temprano en la mañana rema a través del lago Titicaca, para llegar hasta sus jaulas, donde se encuentran las truchas en espera de ser alimentadas. A Sonia le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede disfrutar de los hermosos paisajes que se forman en el lago, espera poder incrementar el número de jaulas que tiene, ya que actualmente no le son suficientes para cubrir la demanda de trucha que le llega. Lleva 12 años en este negocio y lo que menos le gusta es que hay días, en que el clima es muy frío para ir a alimentar a sus truchas, pero igual tiene que hacerlo, porque sabe que la economía familiar depende de la buena producción de truchas que tengan. Este el primer préstamo de Sonia con MFP y planea pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy participativa y querida. Con la cantidad que solicita ampliará sus criaderos de truchas para que pueda tener una mayor cantidad y con el resto de dinero comprará más comida para sus peces.
texts.en:
Sonia is 27 years old, and is a single mother who is very dedicated to her children, Ana (10), and Aníbal (6). She lives with them in her own home and what she wants more than anything is to give them a good education.

She chose to perform her work, which is to raise trout, in the early morning, when she travels to the cages she has in Lake Titicaca where the trout are waiting to be fed. Sonia likes her work very much, as she enjoys the beautiful scenery formed by the lake. She hopes she can increase the number of cages she has, as currently they are not enough to keep up with the demand that she has encountered. She has been in this business for 12 years, and what she likes least about it is that there are days when it is very cold when she goes out to feed the trout, but she knows she still must do it, because her family's income depends on the production of her trout.

This is Sonia's first loan with MFP (a Kiva Partner), and she plans to pay back all of her installments on time, as she does not want to jeopardize the members of her communal bank, with which she is very involved and invested. With the loan she seeks, she will increase the number of fisheries she has so she can have a larger number of trout, and with the rest of the money from the loan, she will buy more food for her fish.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of trout cages

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es:
El señor José Armando labora para un empresa desde hace 8 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, son una familia responsable que le están enseñando a sus hijos a ser personas de gran valor moral. 
Están solicitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en su casita para mayor seguridad de la familia.
texts.en:
José Armando has been working for a business for 8 years, and lives with his wife and sons. They are a responsible family that is teaching their children to be very ethical, principled people. They are requesting a loan to build a fence by their house to improve their family's safety.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a fence to make the family safer.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina G. is married and has 6 dependents. She has received an education through Primary School. Georgina sells foodstuffs at Frami near Abura, which she has done for 10 years. While Georgina works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a carpenter.

Georgina uses her income to pay for household expenses and to help her husband when there is any other need. She will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more foodstuffs for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Georgina plans to reinvest for the further expansion of her trade.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to buy more foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Najma Kosar Banyameen Group

texts.en:
Najma kosar baji is the wife of B. who has been residing in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past fifteen years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband belongs to the timber-selling business and has six years of experience. He has a good number of customers because gas is not available and so people use wood for cooking food.

Najma baji is a very hardworking lady and shares the financial burden of her husband by sewing clothes. She is applying for a loan to buy timber for her husband’s business.

Najma baji is the group leader of five other women from her locality:

Jamila baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

Razia sultana baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell.

Shahnaz kosar baji, Kaniz Fatima baji and Bilquis baji each want a loan to buy donkey carts for their loading business.

loans.use: To buy timber for her husband to sell

loans.name: Lineth

texts.es: Lineth está solicitando  su primer credito para invertirlo en  mejora de su vivienda como es pintar y acondicionar el dormitorio,  esta cliente labora como secretaria administrativa de la corte suprema de Justicia de  Nueva Guinea desde  hace 2 años y 8 meses, actualmente esta estudiando un postgrado en Universidad URACCAN recinto Nueva Guinea,  Lineth es responsable, honesta y con muncho deseos de superación personal y profesional, vive en la zona # 1 de Nueva Guinea, en el barrio  Linda Vista, tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad que estudia su 5to grado de educacion primaria, a pesar que ella no recibe ayuda del padre de su hijo ha luchado para que no le falte nada,  Lineth es una mujer trabajadora, por las tardes cuando sale  de su trabajo  se dedica a ayudar a su hijo con las tareas  y a salir  a vender cosmeticos para asi obtener mejores ingresos y tener mejor comodidad, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, tener  una vivienda bonita y que su hijo estudie para que sea personas de bien.
texts.en:
Lineth is requesting her first loan to invest in home improvements such as painting and installing air conditioning in a room. Lineth has worked as an administrative secretary in the Supreme Court of New Guinea for the past 2 years and 8 months, and currently is carrying out her postgraduate studies at URACCAN University in the New Guinea precinct. Lineth is responsible, honest, and has great hopes of getting ahead in her personal and professional life. She lives in Zone #1 in New Guinea in the Linda Vista neighborhood, and has a 10-year-old son who is in 5th grade in primary school. Even though she does not receive any help for her son’s father, she has fought so that her son lacks nothing. Lineth is a hardworking woman, and in the evenings when she leaves work she dedicates herself to helping her son with his homework and also goes out to sell cosmetics to earn more and live more comfortably. Her dreams are to have job stability, a nice household, and that her son study to become a good person.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To paint and install air conditioning in a room.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es socio del Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui que significa Ojos Negros en quechua.
Marcelino es conviviente, tiene 66 años y 10 hijos de los cuales solo 2 viven con el, Marcelino junto a su esposa e hijos se dedican a confeccionar chompas, bufandas, para lo cual tienen maquinas tejedoras, además Marcelino viaja a Puno de donde compra chompas hechas, sus ventas los realiza en las ferias y también en la ciudad de manera ambulatoria.
Marcelino necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas.
Los sueños de Marcelino son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marcelino is an associate of the Communal Bank Yana Ñahui which means Dark Eyes in quechua. Marcelino lives with his partner, is 66 years old, and has 10 children, of whom only 2 live with him. Marcelino, together with his wife and children, make jumpers and scarves, for which they have sewing machines. Marcelino also travels to Puno where he buys ready-made jumpers which he sells at fairs and also in the city door to door. Marcelino needs a loan of 2500 soles, money which will be invested in buying jumpers. Marcelino's dream is to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jumpers

loans.name: Edmar

texts.en:
Edmar E. is from the village of Acad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 35 years old. Edmar is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Edmar owns & operates a buy and sell business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconut in the local community. Edmar has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edmar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edmar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional coconut to sell. Edmar is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Edmar from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and to pay tuition for his children. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ulises  Francisco

texts.es: El señor Ulises M. de 36 años de edad, reside en la comarca los cedros de la comunidad de Villa del Carmen, casado, su esposa es maestra tiene cuatros hijos de 10, 7,4 y 6 meses. Los planes a corto plazo es mejora la infraestructura de su vivienda y a largo plazo que sus hijos tenga los mejores estudios. Trabaja en la alcaldía de Villa del Carmen con el cargo de Director de Registro Civil desde hace seis meses, anteriormente trabajaba en la intendencia de la propiedad como analista castratal. Tiene terrenos en dónde quiere cultivar pero por dificultades de efectivo que no le prestan las cantidades necesaria para la inversión en las tierras el aumento en su trabajo ha sido poco.  Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra sembrar en las arias que no había abarcado con la compras de semillas y abonos. Son dos manzanas de tierra de ella solo una manzana esta cultivada  de maíz. Con el préstamo lograra cultivar  trigo. Obteniendo mayores utilidades y ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Ulises M. is 36, married, and he lives in the Los Cedros region of the Villa del Carmen community. His wife is a teacher. They have four children; ages 10, 7, 4, and 6 months. The short-term plan is to improve the infrastructure of his house. The long-term plan is for his children to have the best education. He works in the mayor’s office in Villa del Carmen. He has been the Director of Civilian Records for six months. He previously worked in property management as an analyst. He has land that he would like to cultivate, but he has money problems. They do not lend him the amount he needs to invest in his land. His work has increased very little. Thanks to a loan from Afodenic, he will be able to plant in the areas that he had not covered with the purchase of seeds and manure. He has two plots of land, and only one of them is planted with corn. With the loan, he will be able to plant wheat. He will then get greater use and earnings for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure to start planting

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Amistad" están representado por la señora Nelly Lourdes y conformada por 14 miembros los cuales se encuentran cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, unidad, responsabilidad y sobre todo ganas D. salir adelante. Las socias D. este banco tienen diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. comida, frutas, abarrotes, ropa, F. y a la atención D. puntos viva, otras tienen tienda en sus barrios donD. venden artículos para el hogar. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre la competencia  es un factor que influye en las ventas diarias es por esta razón que las socias requieren del préstamo para poder hacer frente a la competencia con productos nuevos y D. alta demanda en el mercado. Los socios son integrantes unidos y con muchas granas D. sacar sus negocios a flote para darles a sus familias una mejor vida.
texts.en:
The partners of the community bank Amistad (Friendship) are represented by Mrs. Nelly Lourdes and incluD. 14 members who find themselves in the second loan cycle demonstrating responsibility, unity, and above all the desire to move ahead.The members of this group have different commercial activities such as the sale of food, fruit, groceries, clothing, flowers, and phone calling services. Others have stores in their neighborhoods where they sell household articles. As in all commercial activity there is competition which is a factor that influences the daily sales. For this reason the members require the loan to be able to face the competition with new products and to meet the high demand in the market. The members are integrated and united with a strong desire to keep their businesses afloat in order to proviD. a better life to their families.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.es:
La señora Nicanora tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos que aún viven con ella. Posee una despensa en su domicilio ubicado en un conocido barrio de la ciudad de Itá donde provee a sus clientes antiguos y a ocasionales de yerba, bebidas en general, carne, panificados, lácteos y otras mercaderías hace más de 10 años. 
La misma se inició en el ámbito financiero gracias del pequeño préstamo que recibió por parte de la Fundación Paraguaya en cuyos cumplimientos demostró buena moral de pago, lo cual la ayudó con el tiempo a acceder a mayores préstamos y de forma a ir acrecentando mas clientes y por ende mayores ventas en su negocio, pudiendo así mejorar de nivel de vida y  la de fu familia.
texts.en:
Nicanora is 50, married, and has two children who still live with her. She has a small store in her home, which is located in a well known neighborhood in the city of Itá. She has provided her old and her occasional customers with herbs, general drinks, meat, bread, dairy products, and other merchandise for over ten years. She started the business thanks to a small loan she received from the Fundación Paraguaya. She demonstrated good ethics in making her payments. In time, that helped her to access greater loans, which in turn gave her more customers and greater sales. Then she was able to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, drinks, flour, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Las Puntuales Group

texts.es: El grupo " Las Puntuales" esta representados por la señora Celina y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se encuentran comprendidos entre los 20 a 55 años son personas dinámicas y activas como lo han ido demostrando en sus anteriores ciclos. Una mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. distintos productos abarrotes, comida, cosméticos, pan y la presidenta se dedica a la costura D. prendas D. vestir. En cuanto a la competencia las socias saben como controlarla gracias a su experiencia y a su clientela Leal. El destino del crédito es para hacer crecer sus negocios, aumentar su capital, adquirir material para agrandar sus negocios y generar mas ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mayor oportunidad en al vida. Dentro D. la Institución van cursando su tercer ciclo sin ninguna dificultar demostrando tener ganas para sacar adelante sus negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familia que es su razón para seguir trabajando.
