texts.en:
The “Las Puntuales” (“The Punctual Ones”) group is represented by Celina and is comprised of 12 members from 20 to 55 years of age. In their previous loan cycles they have proven themselves dynamic and active. The majority of the members are engaged in selling various products, including groceries, food, cosmetics, and bread. The president of the group sews clothing. The members' experience and loyal customers enable them to keep pace with their competition.

This loan will be used to develop their businesses, increase their capital, acquire materials to expand their businesses, and generate more income to give their families greater opportunities in life. This is their third loan with this lending institution and they have not had any difficulties with the previous two. They have proven their desire to get ahead in their businesses to better support their families, which is their reason to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
En el mercado El bisne de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Juana María F. posee su propio negocio de venta de discos compactos de música cristiana y videos cristianos teniendo este negocio desde hace ocho años habiendo invertido en este mucho esfuerzo ya que está en la responsabilidad de llevar el sustento a su hogar.

La razón por lo que la señora Juana solicita el crédito es para invertirlo directamente en la compra de los discos compactos para llenar sus estantes y de esta manera ofertarlos ya que son muchos los clientes que le visitan y por tanto debe de tener el producto necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes.

loans.use: Compra de discos compactos

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr: Ramata BÂ, 37 ans, mariée, 2 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de NIAFOR depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle a été 7 fois bénéficiaire de prêt et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Avec son crédit elle envisage de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises pour de croitre ses revenus afin de pouvoir faire face aux besoins familiaux
texts.en:
Ramata BÂ, aged 37, is married and has two children to support. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de NIAFOR for three and a half years. She has been a loan recipient seven times and has never had a repayment problem. With her loan, she envisions bolstering her store with merchandise to grow her revenues in order to cope with family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her shop

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred R. is from the village of Colonia, Valencia  City. She is 39 years old. Mildred is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mildred owns and runs a "sari-sari" (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products to the community. Mildred has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month.

In 2009, Mildred joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mildred is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mildred from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. it

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional products to sell

loans.name: Takhminakhon

texts.en:
T. Takhminakhon is 42 years old. She is a very active and passionate woman who started her business in 1999 and has become very experienced and skilled in breeding sheep. She has applied for a loan of $1,100 to expand her flock. Takhminakhon believes this will help her generate greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she plans to buy additional sheep and increase her income further. We hope that you will play an important role in Takhminakhon's family life, because she deeply appreciates the trust and support lenders give her.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy additional sheep to expand a small business.

loans.name: Yanjmaa

texts.en:
Yanjmaa S. is 57 years old and single. All her children have already grown up and live with their own families. She had worked for the local police office as a cook for more than twenty years and retired in 2005. As soon as her retirement started, she launched her small business and opened up her own fast food place. She runs her food place every season except for winter. During the winter when her other business is closed she sells cooking oil to locals. She mostly purchases cooking oil from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. This is her third winter selling cooking oil and she has already got some loyal customers who like to do business with her. She says that she would like to carry on her business with help of her children. She requests a loan to purchase more cooking oil for her business. 


About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is married and has three children. She has received a high school education.  Mary sells porridge at teterem near Elmina, which she has been doing since 2009. Her husband is a trader.  Mary uses her income to help pay school fees and utility bills. Mary will use the loan to purchase more milo, milk and also buy millet for the making of the porridge to sell to her costumers who prefer to take their breakfast at her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to educate her children.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more milo, milk and also buy millet for the making of the porridge to sell

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby C. is from the village of Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Ruby is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Ruby makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Ruby is just starting this business. In 2005, Ruby joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruby has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Ruby from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Thoang

texts.en:
Thoang C. L., age 52, is a widow who lives with her sister in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. L. buys and sells rice and is also employed in the village. She is able to earn an income of USD $4 per day. The family is also assisted by her sister who buys rice to sell and earns an income of USD $2 per day. 

L. and her family members try to work hard and help each others to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses and reduce their daily expenses. Therefore, L. is requesting for a loan of US $400 from CREDIT, a Kiva field partner. She wants to use the loan to buy more rice when the price is good enough to make a profit. This is her sixth loan from CREDIT. 

L. is pictured here in a sky-blue shirt.

loans.use: To buy rice to sell

loans.name: Jesus Obrero Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL JESUS OBRERO

Lorenza es secretaria D. la Alcancía Comunal JESUS OBRERO, ella es madre soltera D. tres hijos, D. los cuales la mayor ya es una joven independiente, trata D. sacar adelante a sus menores hijos en base a su esfuerzo y dedicación.

Lorenza es una mujer trabajadora y optimista, desD. muy joven trabajó como empleada D. un hogar, pero con la llegada D. su menor hijo se vio obligada a renunciar, porque ya no tenia el tiempo suficiente para criar bien a sus hijos, entonces gracias a la idea y ayuda D. su hermana, empezó su negocio D. vender caldo, trabajo con el que ya tiene 2 años y le da ganancias.

Los planes D. Lorenza son D. alquilar un local más granD. para su negocio, pero su más granD. sueño es comprar un local y ser una gran empresaria en lo que se dedica.
texts.en:
JESUS OBRERO COMMUNAL ALLIANCE Lorenza is the secretary of the Jesus Obrero Communal Alliance. She is the single mother of three children. Her oldest daughter is a young woman who lives on her own. She tries to help her young children get ahead in life through her strength and dedication. Lorenza is a hard working, optimistic woman. As a young woman she worked as a maid, but she had to resign when her first child was born, because she did not have enough time to raise her children well. Thanks to her sister’s idea and help, she started her own business selling soup. She has been doing this for two years and has been making good money. She plans to rent a larger location for her business, but her big dream is to someday buy her own location and become a great entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a larger workspace

loans.name: Marufu

texts.en:
Marufu is a fashion designer who creates lovely Nigerian designs for his customers, who are mainly friends, residents and neighbors. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. Marufu, who hopes to be a world class designer in the future, is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials. He has a good relationship with LAPO.

Marufu, 43 and married to a petty trader, is the father of four children, all of whom he hopes to provide with a quality education. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Donna Joy

texts.en: Thirty-two-year-old Donna Joy has been in the tailoring and dress-making business for a long time now. However, she never achieved the desired growth of her business because she lacks financial capital. Being poor and earning a small and sporadic income, supporting the growing needs of her business as well as supporting the demands of her costumers from the neighborhood is very hard. Therefore, Donna Joy recently joined ASHI and made a request for a loan. Her husband supported her decision because he knew that his wife’s intention was to augment his small income and to give their three children (who range from age five to eight) a better kind of life and that someday, once her business has grown, the profits will support the children's financial needs to graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and other materials for her tailoring/dress-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase handbags to sell

loans.name: Sreypov's Group

texts.en: Srey Pov T. is from Preak Raing village in Kandal province. Srey Pov T. is a 28-year-old married woman and is the leader of this 4-member group loan. Each member of this village loan will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses. Srey Pov T. is a grocery seller and wants to buy more groceries to expnad her business, and also buy an ice box to support her business. Her husband, Mr. Sovannarith Tea, is a soldier and receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has a child who is 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy groceries for selling and an ice box.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos Ortiz tiene una familia muy agradable a la que el desea dar lo mejor de sí.
El es padre de una niña pequeña por quien sale adelante para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida. Hace tiempo el adquirió su vivienda de interés social, pero por falta de capital no ha podido hacer mejoras, es por ello que recurre a esta institución para que se le apoye en su proyecto como pintar las paredes de su vivienda por dentro y por fuera para darle un mejor aspecto.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos Ortiz has a very nice family, and he wants to give them the best of himself. He is the father of a little girl. He wants to get ahead in order to give her a better quality of life. Some time ago he acquired a house through social services. But, he has not been able to make improvements due to lack of money. That is why he comes to this institution so that they will help him with his project of painting the walls on the inside of his house. He will also paint outside to give it a better appearance.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paint his house

loans.name: Giovanna Jazelli

texts.es:
Giovanna Jazelli M. F. es una buena hija y hermana, que tiene 19 años de edad  y un gran corazón, pues siempre busca ayudar a sus mamá y a su hermano menor;  en el barrio Tintal de Bogotá todos conocen  su dedicación a un negocio de su propiedad, que atiende con su madre, donde vende de todo un poco: comercializa artículos de papelería y miscelánea, tanto  como cuadernos, lapiceros, productos de belleza como gel y esmaltes y así mismo aprovecha este punto para vender minutos a teléfonos  fijos  y a celulares, que le representan otro ingreso y que es lo que atrae la venta de las mercancias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un crédito por valor de $500.000 COP, pues quiere comprar  tinturas y gel  para el cabello que tienen una buena rotación en su negocio y también articulos de papelería como cuadernos, bloques de hojas para imprimir, pues tiene una clientela de estudiantes que le compran usualmente.

Esta gran emprendedora, inició su negocio hace algo más de 2 años con recursos propios,  su primer mercado doméstico fue en el conjunto residencial donde vivía, ahora conocen su miscelánea en los  alrededores del sector.Giovanna tiene la gran aspiración de seguir ampliando su negocio, pues sabe que en la medida en que aumente el volumen de ventas, sus ingresos también y tendría la capacidad de acceder a la universidad porque sueña con estudiar medicina y es su gran desafio.
texts.en:
Giovanna is a good daughter and sister. She is 19 years old and has a big heart, as she is always looking for ways to help her mother and younger brother. Everyone in the Tintal neighborhood of Bogotá knows of her dedication to her business and property where she cares for her mother. She sells a little of everything, such as paper goods, notebooks, writing instruments, beauty products, and other miscellaneous items. She also sells phone cards for landlines and cell phones, which provide another source of income and also helps attract more customers. She is asking for a loan of 500,000 COP ($275) in order to buy hair coloring and gel, which sells well. She will also buy more paper goods such as notebooks and printer paper. She has regular customers who are students. This entrepreneur started her business, with her own resources, more than two years ago. She began selling out of her home. Now she is known around the community. Giovanna wants to continue to grow her business because she knows that increasing her sales will also increase her income. This will also give her the opportunity to attend university because her biggest goal is to become a doctor.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es: Eliza tiene 60 años, es viuda y vive con una D. sus hijas y sus 2 nietos en su casa propia. Casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a la siembra y cosecha D. papa y maíz; actividad que le genera ganancias, ya que una vez cosechados sus productos, los lleva a vender a la ciudad mas cercana a su zona. Paralelamente a este trabajo, cría pollos en su granja, dedicándole todos los días, solo los fines D. semana los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos o clientes, quienes saben D. la dedicación con que cría y alimenta a estos animales. Eliza desea seguir dedicándose a las tareas agrícolas  hasta donD. tenga fuerzas. Este es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Comprará 2 sacos D. abono, así como ovejas para aumentar la cantidad D. animales, ya que este negocio más rentable.
texts.en:
Eliza is 60 years old and a widow; she lives with one of her daughters and 2 grandchildren in a house that she owns. Almost all her life she has farmed potatoes and maize to earn a living. After harvest, she brings her crops to sell in the city closest to her home. Along with this work, Eliza raises chickens, which she tends to everyday. On the weekends she sells to her neighbors and other customers, who know how dedicated she is to caring for and feeding her animals. Eliza wishes to continue farming for as long as she has the strength to. This is her second loan with MFP, therefore she promises to be very responsible in her repayment of the loan. Eliza will buy 2 sacks of fertilizer, as well as sheep to expand her farm, since raising sheep is a more profitable business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 sacks of fertilizer and sheep.

loans.name: Nakkazi

texts.en: S. is a single lady with no children. She stays with her parents and she takes care of them. She owns a stall in Kalerwe market selling food stuffs  like banana clusters, sweet potatoes, cassava and Irish potatoes. She doesn’t incur any transport costs because she buys from her place of work. She wants to use this loan to buy more clusters of bananas, one sack of sweet and Irish potatoes, and cassava. She has been in this business for two years and also with MCDT for two years, servicing her third loan. She doesn’t have any other side business. Her customers are nearby families. She works seven days a week. S.’s business challenges includes rainy season because she works in a muddy place, and defaulters. She is aspiring to go directly to farmers. She joined MCDT because she wanted additional capital. The family has access to electricity and no piped water, and her monthly expenses include food and rent for their home.

loans.use: To buy moe banana clusters, one bag of sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Wolale Marakaso Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WOLALE MARAKASO III est constitué de femmes mariées du village de CINZARA dans la préfecture de SAN région (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, au moins 6  enfants et  cultivent  exclusivement du sésame.  
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année d’où leur premier prêt de campagne. 
S. DIARRA compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 13500 à 14500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en:
The Wolale Marakaso III group is made up of women from the village of Cinzana in the San district in the fourth administrative region of Mali. They are all married and live in traditional extended families. They have an average age of 39 and each has at least 6 children. They all exclusively grow sesame.
In the hope of making their agricultural efforts more profitable, the group members decided to participate in Soro Yiriwaso’s credit program on their first farming loan.
S. Diarra intends to use her loan to buy seeds, some small supplies and fertilizers at the big market in San. Once winter is over, she stores her harvested crops for a while to gain market value before selling them at the big market in San and the surrounding markets. She sells retail (often wholesale) for cash, to customers mostly from bigger cities.
After selling their produce, each group member hopes to make a profit of 13,500 to 14,500 XOF to go towards paying the loan’s interest and everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers, seeds and other small materials

loans.name: Santos Demetrio

texts.es:
El señor Santos Demetrio M. H., es un hombre de edad avanzada, que con su esposa habitan en el Barrio Los Amadores, ellos tienen 7 hijos, que están casados, y habitan independientemente y sobreviven bajo sus propios ingresos, apoyando económicamente a sus padres, él es agricultor desde hace ya más de 30 años y fue gracias a su esfuerzo propio que adquirió su finca, la cual ha sido el sustento de toda su familia.

Un problema de plagas amenaza con las buenas cosechas de sus tierras, por esta razón solicitan un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas, e insumos vegetativos que fortifiquen las siembras y permitan una mejor cosecha que a futuro favorezca en el volumen de las ventas y el bienestar de la familia, sobretodo que desea mejrar su patrimonio para heredarsselos a sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en:
Señor Santos Demetrio M. H. is an elderly man who lives with his wife in the Los Amadores neighborhood. They have 7 children who are married, live independently and support themselves, as well as their parents, financially. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years. Thanks to his own hard work he acquired his farm, which has been the means of support for his whole family. The problem of a plague threatens a good harvest of his land, which is why he is requesting a loan. He wants to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and agricultural supplies to fortify his crops and allow for a better harvest that, in the future, will grant a greater volume of sales and help the well being of the family. Above all else, he wants to improve his wealth in order to leave it to his children and grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crop maintenance

loans.name: Enhbold

texts.en:
Enhbold H., age 30, makes wooden products which he and his wife sell in their store. He began his business last year, shortly after resigning from a local furniture manufacturing company. His considerable experience in this kind of work has allowed him to begin this business and to make it successful. His wife works as a saleswoman in the store. 

He is a very busy man, building custom-made items throughout the day according to client orders. He is a creative and hardworking person who wishes to expand his business by hiring more employees in the future. He tells us, "My only wish now is to finish building my two-story house, which will greatly improve my family's quality of life." He and his wife live with their daughter in the central province of Mongolia.

Enhbold is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood, necessary tools, and equipment for his wood manufacturing business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood, necessary tools, and equipment

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: Filomena, D. 65 años, es una madre D. familia muy amorosa, vive en su casa propia, en compañía D. su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Por más D. 20 años trabaja, en la producción y venta D. comida, en un puesto del mercado a 3 cuadras D. su domicilio. En donD. prepara guisos, quinua y mazamorra D. calabaza entre otros platillos peruanos, que son muy solicitados por sus clientes. Al iniciarse en este negocio, lograba darse abasto,  como cocinar, atender y lavar las vajillas, pero actualmente se ve obligada a contratar a otra persona para que le ayuD. en el trabajo, debido que a que sufre constantes dolencias en el cuerpo. Esta contenta con la labor que desempeña, por lo que anhela ver que su hijo termine D. estudiar y luego D. eso se ha propuesto descansar. Este es su 21avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en seguir pagando como hasta ahora lo ha hecho, asimismo agradece a sus compañeras D. su grupo por darles su amistad y apoyo. Filomena tiene planeado invertir el crédito que solicita, en la compra D. arroz, fideos, aceite y azúcar, alimentos perecibles, con las que seguirá preparando sus potajes típicos.
texts.en:
Filomena, 65, is a very loving mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She has worked making typical dishes for over 20 years in a stand in the market located three blocks from her home. She makes typical Peruvian dishes like: various stews, Quinoa, mazamorra D. calabaza (a pumpkin-based dessert), etc. that are highly sought after by her customers. When she first started out she could do everything by herself: cook, tend to customers, wash dishes. Currently, however, she has to hire a helper because she now has constant body aches and pains. She is happy with the work she does because she hopes to see her son finish his schooling. Once he does so, she plans to rest. This is her 21st loan with MFP and she pledges to continue repaying like she’s done to date. She is also grateful to her fellow group members for their friendship and support. Filomena plans to use the requested funds to buy rice, pasta, cooking oil and sugar, perishable foods with which she will continue to prepare her typical stews.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishables for her food preparation.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has a mixed farm that produces tea, maize, tomatoes, onions, beans and bananas, which are all sold at the local market. He has been farming for fifteen years in the town of Kisii in western Kenya and employs one farmhand. He also owns and operates a butcher shop in the same location.

Francis is 47 years old. He is married and has been blessed with four children who are now between the ages of 7 and 22. All of the children attend school.

Francis recently repaid his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 80,000KES to expand his butcher shop. The income from this investment will enable him to take his son to college and improve the livelihood of his family. The major challenges he is facing in farming are unpredictable weather conditions and diseases that affect his production. In future, he would like to do large-scale farming and own a string of butcheries to supply meat to institutions.

loans.use: To expand his butcher shop.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida P. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Florida is single and has four adult children. Florida owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Florida has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2008, Florida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Florida has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating her store. Florida is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Florida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing inventory; working capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is from the village of Talisay, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old, widowed, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling food products like milk in sachets and snack foods in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1998, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Bettycarolina

texts.es: BETTYCAROLINA M. C.,Trabaja como Secretaria Ejecutiva en el Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán . el prestamo solicitado es para la compra  de materiales electricos para su casa de habitacion, es madre de familia de un niño y ete se encuentra en edad escolar.
texts.en: Betty Carolina M. C. works as an executive secretary at the 'Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán' (Nicaraguan Professional Training Center).  The loan will be used for buying electrical materials for her home.  She is mother to one school-age child.

loans.use: To buy electrical materials for her home and to settle some family expenses

loans.name: Denis Edgardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Denis Z. se dedica al comercio y su principal actividad es la venta de verduras, negocio con el cual cuenta con un año de haberlo iniciado.
Don Denis compra las verduras en la ciudad de Danlí los días lunes y jueves y los demás días de la semana los utiliza para salir a vender su producto de manera ambulante en la aldea de Jutiapa, aldeas y comunidades circunvecinas a la misma,  distribuye su producto en un bicicleta de carga que se compro con las ganancias que le a generado su negocio.
Don Denis también vende verduras en su casa de habitación pero su mayor volumen de venta lo tiene de la venta  ambulante,  se a sabido ganar la clientela por el buen producto y por los precios que vende sus verduras.
Don Denis esta casado y junto a su esposa se dedican al negocio ya que cuando él anda vendiendo su esposa atiende a los clientes en su casa.
Del matrimonio han procreado tres hijos los cuales dependen de ellos.
el credito lo utilizara par la compra de mas verduras para tener mayores ventas y con los ingresos que le genere su negocio cubrir con todos los gastos dentro del hogar.
texts.en: Dennis Z. has been selling vegetables from his small cart for the last year.   He buys the vegetables in the city of Danli on Mondays and Thursdays, and on the other days of the week he sells them in the town of Jutiapa and the surrounding communities.  He uses a bicycle cart which he purchased with the money he earned from his business.   Mr. Z. also sells vegetables from his house, but most of his sales are done from the cart.  He knows that he earns his customers with the quality and fair prices of his produce.   Mr. Z. is married and he and his wife both work together.  While he is out selling from the cart, his wife helps the customers who buy from their home.   They have 3 children together who depend on them.   This loan will be used to buy more vegetables to increase his sales, and generate the money they need to cover their household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, green chilies, tomatoes, garlic and yuca.

loans.name: San Agustin De Jonacatepec Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama San Agustín de Jonacatepec, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Jonacatepec, en el estado de Morelos, México, este grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes que se conocen ellos son la señora Isabel C. S. y va a comprar con su préstamo aceite, azúcar, frijol, arroz etc. Para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, la señora Regina Ángeles S. va a comprar lencería para iniciar su negocio, la señora Julia L. N. va a comprar frutas de temporada para vender cacahuate, etc., la señora Cristina R. L. va a comprar tortillas, masa, queso, arroz, frijol, etc. Para la elaboración y venta de su producto antojitos mexicanos, la señora Lidia A. Martínez va a comprar zapatos por mayoreo para vender, la señora Cenobia Lavín R. va a comprar todo tipo de chiles y semillas para vender,  el señor Eduardo L. Gutiérrez va a comprar pollo por mayoreo para vender, la señora Ivalu Ávila Pérez va a comprar verdura, carne, platos etc. Para la elaboración y venta de sus productos, antojitos mexicanos, la señora Vianey R. L. va a comprar cacahuate para tostarlo y venderlo, la señora Luz María García Millán va a comprar tostadas, pollo, leche, queso, etc. Para elaboración y venta de sus productos (antojitos mexicanos). El señor Eduardo L. Gutiérrez es integrante del grupo, el tiene 47 años de edad, es soltero, el estudio la licenciatura es maestro de educación física, el solicito su préstamo para su negocio tiene una pollería en el mercado municipal para invertirlo en la compra de material productos de pollo por mayoreo. El señor Eduardo ofrece a sus clientes pollo por pieza, longaniza, carne enchilada. El inicio su negocio hace 24 años por necesidades porque tenía crianza de pollo y tenía que salir el producto y fue así que inicio la microempresa, le otorgo el lugar que tiene en el mercado la presidencia municipal, su negocio es importante porque de ahí depende su mamá y de ahí tiene ingresos para todos sus gastos y con este negocio puede tener el sustento de su familia, la parte favorita de su negocio es el trato con la gente va conociendo a varias personas, sus clientes son las señoras, las muchachas, los señores y varia la clientela, su negocio es popular por el buen trato a los clientes, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son costos elevados, y la competencia hay mas pollerías cerca de su puesto. Las ganancias del negocio las invierten en comprar más producto, también quiere invertir en una rosticería y lo piensa lograr trabajando y con el buen trato a los clientes. Al señor Eduardo su negocio le ha ayudado a salir adelante con todos los gastos y problemas que se van sucitando, las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda son hacer mas habitaciones y hacer arreglos en general y sus sueños y esperanza son tener mejores ingresos, tener una casa bonita y llevar a pasear a su mamá. El está muy contento con este préstamo que le proporcionan porque va a invertir en pollo para su negocio. Jonacatepec es un pueblo tranquilo, hermoso y la gente es sencilla y amable sus alrededores son hermosos porque es tranquilo y está rodeado de cerros, es de clima templado. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos la oportunidad que nos dan para salir adelante junto con la Fundación y con el trabajo de nosotros mismos y esperando un futuro mejor”
texts.en: This caring group is called Saint of Jonacatepec which is located in the Jonacatepec community in the state of Morelos, Mexico. This group is formed of 10 members who know one another. One of the members is Mrs. Isabel C. S. who is going to use her loan to buy oil, sugar, beans, rice, etc. to supply her grocery store. Mrs. Regina Ángeles S. is going to buy lingerie to start her business. Mrs. Julia L. N. is going to buy seasonal fruits to sell peanuts, etc.  Mrs. Cristina R. L. is going to buy tortillas, dough, cheese, rice, beans, etc. for the production and sale of her Mexican meals. Mrs. Lidia A. Martínez is going to buy wholesale shoes to sell. Mrs. Cenobia Lavín R. is going to buy all types of chillies and seeds to sell.  Mr. Eduardo L. Gutiérrez is going to buy chicken wholesale to sell. Mrs. Ivalu Ávila Pérez is going to buy vegetables, meat, plates, etc. for the production and sale of her products and Mexican meals. Mrs. Luz María García Millán is going to buy fried tortillas, chicken, milk, cheese, etc. for the production and sale of her products and Mexican meals. Mr. Eduardo L. Gutiérrez is a member of the group, is 47 years old, single, and is a licensed physical education teacher. He requested the loan for the poulterer's shop he has in the town market. He wants to buy materials and wholesale poultry. Mr. Eduardo offers his clients chicken in pieces, sausage, and seasoned in spices. He started his business 24 years ago since he had a chicken farm. The municipal president granted him the place he has in his poulterer’s shop. This business is very important since his mother depends on it, he is able to make payments, and he can support  his family. His favorite part of his job is meeting people in his clientele such as women, young women, men, and variations. His business is popular for treating his customers well. The obstacles he faces are high costs and the competition he has since other poulterer shops are located nearby. The profits he will receive from his sales will be used to buy more products, a rotisserie, and he plans on achieving that with hard work and treating clients well. Mr. Eduardo’s business has helped him succeed with all of the costs and problem that life brings. In the future he wishes to add more rooms to his home as well as make some general repairs. His dream is to make the most profits possible, have a nice house, and take his mother out more. He is very happy with the loan he is offered because he will but more puoltry for his business. Jonacatepec is a calm village, beautiful, and filled with simple and friendly people. The surroundings are beautiful because it is calm and enclosed by hills. And it is in a temperate zone. The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Reality Foundation “We are very thankful for the opportunity you give us along with the Foundation and our own work and the hope for a better future.”

loans.use: To buy chicken wholesale to resell.

loans.name: Urla

texts.es: Urla tiene 41 años, es una madre de familia muy responsable y noble, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Después de incursionar en la fabricación de aretes, Urla decidió vender carbón y comida, ya que le resulta más rentable que su anterior negocio. Desde entonces su actividad diaria es muy agitada, comprando los ingredientes necesarios, preparando la comida para 5 personas, a quienes les expende su comida y trabajan en una empresa cercana a su casa. Es por ello, terminada la faena del aliñado, en sus respectivos tapers los transporta, hasta el trabajo de sus comensales. Lleva 6 meses dedicándose a esta labor, por lo que considera que éste trabajo lo realiza dentro de la comodidad de su casa. En adelante, piensa ampliar e instalar un restaurante en su casa, asimismo desea criar cerdos. Es su 13avo crédito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido nuevamente en ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, considerando éste crédito es muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará cerdos para criar, asimismo mesas, sillas para que instale formalmente su negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
Urla, age 41, is a very responsible and honest mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their four children.  After venturing into making earrings, Urla decided to sell coal and food.  This turned out to be more profitable for her than her previous business.

From then on her daily activity has been very hectic.  She buys the necessary ingredients and prepares food for five people who buy the food from her.  They work at a business that is close to her house.  After she finishes the work of preparing the food and putting it in plastic containers, she transports it to where her diners work.

She has been doing this work for six months.  She does this work from the comfort of her own house. In the future she is thinking of expanding and installing a restaurant in her house.  She also wants to raise pigs.

This is her 13th loan with MFP.  Once again, she pledges to be responsible with her payments.  She considers this loan to be very useful to the progress of her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy pigs to raise.  She will also buy tables and chairs to formally set up her business in her house.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs in order to set up a food stand at her house and to buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Basilia Berna

texts.es:
Basilia es socia del Banco Comunal “12 D. Agosto” del distrito Puno,  provincia D. Puno y departamento D. Puno, tiene 55 años, D. estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos, estudio educación secundaria

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace un año, su  préstamo inicial fue D.  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, decidió invertirlo en su negocio D. venta D. prendas D. vestir D. segundo uso, y comprará juguetes para venderlos en navidad.

Solicitara un nuevo crédito D. S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, con el que comprará juguetes para venderlos en navidad, como muñecas, carros, animalitos, etc., a la señora le ayudan sus hijos.

Desea poner una tienda D. prendas nuevas.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Basilia is a member of the "12 D. Agosto" community bank in Puno district, in the province and department of the same name.

Basilia is 55 years old, married and has 2 children.  She has a high school education.

Basilia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles which she invested in her business selling used clothes.  She is requesting a new loan for 800 Peruvian soles with which she will buy toys to sell at Christmas such as dolls, cars, little animals, etc.  Basilia's children help her in her work.

Basilia would like to set up a store selling new clothes.  What she likes about her community bank is the convenience of the loans.

loans.use: To buy toys such as dolls, little cars, little animals, etc. to sell at Christmas

loans.name: Akouyo

texts.fr: Mme Akouya  est âgée de 67 ans et a 4 enfants. Elle est née à Togoville et habite quartier Abobogomé. Elle est revendeuse de poissons fumés au marché local Abobogomé. Elle a démarré ses activités en 1990 et s’approvisionne au marché d’Atikpodji. Elle sollicite un prêt pour l’achat de 6 paniers de poissons fumés adiado, 20 paniers  de poissons fumés tilabia, et 6 paniers de poissons fumés djémékpè.
texts.en: Mrs. Akouya is 67 years old and she has 4 children. She was born in Togoville and she lives in the quarter of Abobogome. She is a smoked fish retailer in local market of Abobogome. She took up her business in 1990 and she makes her purchases in the Atikpodji market. She requests a loan to purchase 6 baskets of adiado, tilabia, and djemekpe smoked fish.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of smoked fish.

loans.name: Leyla Evangelina

texts.es: Leyla Evangelina tiene 59 años, su actividad  es el destace de cerdo y la elaboración de nacatamales. Hace más de 26 años que se dedica a este medio de vida, por lo que siempre está al tanto de lo que sus clientes le solicitan,    ella inicia este negocio por la necesidad de trabajar. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima ya que siempre tiene una gran variedad de ofertas a su favor.
texts.en: Leyla Evangelina is 59 years old and works butchering pigs and making nacatamales.  She has used this as a way of making a living for more than 26 years and this is why she is always up-to-date on what her customers order.  She began this business out of the need to work.  The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of raw material, as she always has a great variety of offers in her favor.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Rebeca

texts.es:
María, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad, se dedica a vender productos de uso domestico, en una tienda que la administra en su casa. 
Este negocio surgió por necesidad, viéndose como responsable de la alimentación de sus hijos, decidió iniciar con el negocio, que hoy día es el que le ayuda a sobrellevar la carga del hogar. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería para el negocio, ya que en unas ocasiones se le agotan y pierde de vender.
Su objetivo es expandir más la tienda, abastecer de mercadería los inventarios, que sus ventas aumenten, y de su trabajo sacar a sus hijos adelante con una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
María resides in Jiquilisco in the Department of Usulután. She is 26 years old and a single mother of two children, ages 2 and 7. María sells household products from a store she manages in her home.

Her business has grown out of necessity since it is the means by which she is able to feed her children. She decided to start this business and now it helps her to support her household. María is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business since she has had opportunities when she ran out of inventory and lost potential sales.

Her goals are to expand her store even more, stock her inventory with more merchandise, increase her sales, and work to achieve a better financial situation so that her children can get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic shoes

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis Enrique tiene 27 años de edad. Vive en casa con su madre y dos hermanos. Desde hace 2 años, se dedica al servicio de mecánica. También, cuenta con una mototaxi en la cual brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su caserío. Es muy conocido en la zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Con estas actividades, gana ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares y personales. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para realizar algunos arreglos en su hogar. Con estas reparaciones, Luis Enrique podrá mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia. Es muy responsable y cuenta con buenas referencias en su trabajo y en su comunidad. Ha tenido otros préstamos y ha cumplido con sus obligaciones en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique, 27, lives at home with his mother and two siblings.  For the last two years he’s been a Mechanic.  He also has a mototaxi that he uses to provide passenger transportation services in his hamlet.  He is very well known in the area and has an established base of regular customers. He earns income with these activities to meet family and personal expenses.

He has requested a 1000 new sol loan to do some home repairs.  With these repairs, Luis Enrique will improve his and his family’s quality of life.  He’s very responsible and has good personal and work references in his community.  He has had other loans and has always met his commitments punctually.

loans.use: to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Yuldoshboy

texts.en:
Yuldoshboy lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. He has three children. He has a truck which he uses to haul sand, rocks and other materials. After 20 years, Yuldoshboy has a stable business which generates sufficient income for him to improve his family's living conditions. Currently Yuldoshboy wants to expand his business, so he hopes to take a loan of 10000 Somoni to purchase another truck. Yuldoshboy thanks everyone who is supporting him and promises to repay the loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase a new truck

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es socia del Banco Comunal Socos, tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. 27, 24, 18 y 11 años. Se dedica a la venta D. cereales. Leonor tiene un molino en el distrito D. Socos, compra cereales, los procesa, lo trae a Ayacucho y lo venD. en el mercado Nery García Zarate, Mercado Chorro, Mercado Playa Grau, entre sus caseras.El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. cereales. 
Le gusta las reuniones del Banco Comunal por el acceso a los créditos, los ahorros y capacitaciones que recibe D. su promotora. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca, que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Leonor is a member of the Communal Bank “Socos”. She is married and has four children (ages 27, 24, 18, and 11). Leonor sells grain and has a mill in the District of Socos. She buys the grain, processes it, and brings it to Ayacucho to sell at the Nery García Zarate Market, the Chorro Market, the Playa Grau Market, and other places. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of grain.

Leonor enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because she has access to loans, savings, and training classes conducted by her loan officer. Her dream is to grow her business so that her children can become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase grain.

loans.name: Dushan

texts.ru: Халилов Душан проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 43 года. Женат. У него четверо детей. Он имеет средне - специальное образование, счетовод. По специальности работает 20 лет. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. При доме у него небольшой участок земли, где он сеет злаковые культуры и выращивает овощи. В этой области он 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Dushan K. lives in the Yavan region. He is 43 years old. He is married and has four children. He has secondary specialized education, he is an accountant. He has worked in his profession for twenty years. He also does agriculture. Dushan has a small plot of land at his home where he sows cereals and grows vegetables. He has been eight years in this business. He is taking out the loan to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and fuel.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 60 years old and married with eight children. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Nenita has been farming rice for three years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farming activity.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en: Tsend-Ayush is 30 years old who lives in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. He operates a transportation service business between Ulaanbaatar city and his center of province. He transports coal, wood, and iron for his customers. He started his business in 2005 with his truck and gained much experience. Since then he has managed to stabilize his business and has built good communication both with his partners and customers. He is an open-minded and polite man who is planning to continue his business in the future. He says, "This is only thing I can do best. So I want to continue my business in the future." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his truck.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts

loans.name: Sehouegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEHOUEGNON est composé de trois personnes qui vivent tous dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Hélène Baï est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Hélène Baï est née le 18 Août 1972 dans une ville du Bénin. Hélène Baï est mariée à un brodeur nommé Franck et a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant à sa charge. Hélène Baï et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Depuis près de douze ans, Hélène Baï vit ensemble avec son mari dans une ville du Bénin. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Hélène Baï exerce depuis huit ans environs comme activité la vente de divers condiments de sauce (tomate, oignons, piments, etc.) et de façon secondaires, la vente de conserves dans son quartier. Hélène Baï achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Hélène Baï sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEHOUEGNON, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
The SEHOUEGNON group is composed of three persons who all live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. This is the fifth time that this group has asked  ALIDé for financial aid to boost their businesses. The representative of the group, Hélène Baï, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. 

Hélène Baï was born on August 18, 1972 in a town in Bénin. She is married to an embroidery specialist named Franck and she has two children, both enrolled in school and living with her. The two parents support their family together. 

For almost 12 years, Hélène Baï has been living with her husband in a town in Bénin. Before she began supporting herself and improving her living conditions, Hélène worked for eight years selling various condiments for sauces (tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.) Secondarily, she sold canned goods in her neighborhood. She buys her products in Bénin. 

Seeking to satisfy her clientele and increase her earnings, Hélène Baï is requesting, together with the other members of her group SEHOUEGNON, another loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments for use in sauces as well as canned goods.

loans.name: Shamma

texts.en:
Shamma is a 54-year-old housewife and a mother of six; five of them are married and one is still single. 

Since Shamma is an illiterate woman she did not have a lot of options in how to support the family, so she helped her husband 3 years ago to open a small grocery store that sells most of the  goods in demand in the area such as canned vegetables  and powdered milk, etc.
 
Now Shamma is applying for a loan for more than one reason: she wants to provide the store with more goods as a preparation to welcome the holy month of Ramadan; to add a refrigerator for cooling goods; and to redecorate the store entrance. 
   
Since Shamma is a conservative person, her son appears in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and goods for the grocery store and to redecorate the store entrance.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 29 years old. She is married and has one child. For more income, she wants to expand her business .

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a hardworking 31-year-old business woman. She is married and blessed with a 9-year-old child who is in school. To meet the needs of her family, for the last three years she has been operating a boutique. In the next five years, she wants to own rental houses whose proceeds will catapult her forward to meeting her dream of owning a flat.

Maureen is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes for sale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now able to keep and maintain her business records.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Lem

texts.en: In order to live with a good standard of living such as others in her village, Lem works hard and struggles. She is a farmer. She stays alone which no children. To support her farming business, Lem wishes to borrow $150 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other related materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other related materials.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
This is 24 year-old Amie, who is married to a trader and has four children aged 6, 8, 10, and 12 years, all attending school. In 2000, Amie established her used clothing business, selling used clothing, bags, shoes and tops after having worked with her mother in the same field before she got married.

Competition is high, but her stock of quality goods attracts many customers, all of whom she serves in the centre and outskirts of Makeni City. Her major business challenges are the rainy season and rising transportation costs. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le Le940,000 every month.

Having already received and repaid two loans, Amie is now requesting a loan of Le Le5,000,000 to buy more ladies' used tops, vests, bags and clothing for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le Le250,000, and in the future plans to open additional outlets by accessing more loans. She also wants to give her children a good education. Amie thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for ladies' tops, vests and bags.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 35 years old and married to Julius. She has been running a green grocer business for the past ten years with a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to support her business and family.

Agnes is applying for her fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. She has been loaned 40,000 KES, which she will use to buy kale, cabbages and green maize to add to her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children up to university level and build premises to run her business.

loans.use: to buy kale, cabbages and green maize to add to her business

loans.name: Naume

texts.en:
Naume, a 21-year-old woman who lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda, has had a business selling soft drinksfor the past three years. To help expand her business, Naume has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more sodas for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, she hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  

Naume is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sodas for resale.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 45 years old, widowed, and has three children, ranging in age from 11 to 30.  When Fatma requested her first loan, she was newly separated from her husband and living in her neighbor’s wooden shed with her six-year-old son.  Neighbors suggested that she should take a loan from Maya to open up new possibilities for her future.  

Fatima's life has changed since meeting with a Maya loan officer.  She was accepted into a group and received a loan for $450.  With a small part of the loan she found a small place to rent and bought some furniture and other household items.  With the remaining money, she went to Istanbul and bought some loose beads and some things for the bohça trade (usually cheaply made pajamas, clothes, table clothes, etc. that are wrapped up a cloth and carried on one’s back to sell around the neighborhoods).  Sometimes Fatima took her bohça on her back to make sales and sometimes she made prayer beads from the loose beads she had bought and sold them at mosques and on street corners.  She repaid her first loan and requested another.  With her second loan she bought more items for the bohça trade.

On the days she was not out selling, Fatima was planting and raising vegetable seedling in an unused garden spot next to her house.  She took the seedlings and started to sell them at the local bazaar.  She saw that she could earn more money raising vegetable seedlings.  She repaid her second loan.  For her third through fifth loans she concentrated on expanding the areas where she could raise seedlings and planted produce to sell in the bazaar.  Her business was going so well that during this time she built a house, bought a vehicle to transport her expanding seedling and produce supplies to the bazaar, and hired a seasonal worker.   

With her sixth loan, Fatima will continue to expand her business using the loan to rent additional fields, buy seeds, fertilizer, watering supplies, and materials for a greenhouse. Fatma’s life has changed a lot.  She is now a free and happy woman.

In the future, Fatima wants to rent other fields and upgrade her vehicle. She also hopes to own her own fields, so she won’t have to rent but can have her own land and production, and travel to holy places.  She wants her son to be successful in school, his work and make investments for their retirement.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Fatma Hanım 45 yaşında ve dul.  Fatma Hanım'ın 3 çocuğu var.  En küçüğü 11,en büyüğü 30 yaşında.
Fatma hanım kredi kullanmaya başladığında çok çaresizdi.  Eşinden yeni ayrılmış ve komşunun tahtadan yaptığı barakada yaşıyordu,altı yaşında bir çocuğu vardı.  Komşuları Maya'yı önermiş borç para al, yaşamının önünü açarsın demişler.  Bu durumda bana kim borç verir,vermezler demiş.  Ancak maya saha sorumlusuyla karşılaşınca hayatı değişmiş,başvurusu kabul edilmiş.  Grup kredisiyle 750 TL borç almış.  Küçük bir kısmıyla ev kiralamış,eski eşya satanlardan çocuğunun ve kendisinin yatabileceği ve oturabileceği iki kanepe alıp yaşayabilecekleri alanı sağladı,kalan parasıyla İstanbul'a gidip,biraz boncuk,birazda bohça malı aldı.  Bazen bohçasını sırtına alıp satış yaptı,bazende boncuklardan ürettiği tesbihleri cami ve yol kenarlarında sattı ve borcunu ödedi.  Bir kredi daha talep etti.  Kredisini alıp bohça malı alıp sattı.  Satışa çıkmadığı günlerde,evinin yanında boş olan bahçede denemek için sebze fidesi ekti.  Fideleri pazara çıkarıp sattı.Gördü ki bu iş daha fazla para kazandırıyor.Maya'ya borcu da bitti.  Bir kredi daha alarak,bahçe kiralayıp fide üreticiliğine başladı.  Fideleri pazara çıkarıp satar,kendince iyi para kazanır.Kendisine ev yapmaya karar verir.Evet şimdi kendi evinde oturmaktadır.Kredi borcu bitmiştir.Tekrar kredi alır ve yine fide eker,yanında mevsimlik işçi çalışmaktadır artık.  Fideleri pazara götürmek için arabaya ihtiyacı vardır ve 2.yıl fide geliriyle kendisini taşıyabilecek düzeyde bir araba alır.  Artık arabası da vardır.Fatma Hanım'ın hayatı çok ama çok değişti.  O artık özgür ve mutlu bir kadın.
Fatma Hanım aldığı bu kredi ile kiraladığı tarlanın bakımı,fide tohumları,gübreleme,sulama malzemesi,sera muşambası gibi üretim için gerekli malzeme almak istiyor.Bu kredi ile bir tarla daha kiralama fırsatı olacak,arabasını yeniliyecek.Belki kendi tarlası olacak,kiralama yerine kendi yerinde üretim yapacak.Bir hayalide umreye gitmek,gezmek.Oğlunu okutuyor ,başarılı olduğunu düşünüyor.İyi okullarda okumasını ve iyi iş sahibi olmasını istiyor. Yaşlılığına yatırım yapıyor.Yeniliğe açık,girişken,mücadeleci.

loans.use: to purchase the materials for planting seedlings and growing produce.

loans.name: Sreyly

texts.en: Sreyly, 29, is a garment factory worker who earns $4 per day. Her husband is also working in the factory and earns $4 per day. They have four children; all of them are studying. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $15 on electricity, $40 on school fees and $12 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy some goods to sell to her co-workers. She saw the others sell goods in the factory and make some income, so she follows and she can get some profit from it. She wants to support her children to at least finish high school.

loans.use: to buy some goods to sell to her co-workers in the factory.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s shoe-making business. He has been operating his business for the past 20 years and has a good number of business contacts. These days he has a big order to fulfill for which he wants to buy raw materials. With the loan, he will buy leather, nails, glue, and shoe polish. 

She herself is a seamstress who sews clothes for her community clients to supplement the income for her family. She is the mother of four children and all of them stay at home.
 
Sajida is very confident that after investing the loan in her husband's business, her husband will be able to finish the order on time and make great profits. 

Note: in the photo, the woman raising her hand is Sajida.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her husband's shoe-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Placida

texts.en:
Placida is married with 3 children. Placida is 53 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Placida has a shop for air conditioning repair. She has had this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns approximately 10,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase equipment used for air conditioning repair for her business. Placida has been a member of PMPC since the beginning of 2011. In the future, Placida hopes to expand her shop.

loans.use: to purchase equipment used for air conditioning repair for her business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр женат. Его супругу зовут Елена. У них есть четырехлетний сын. Александр имеет собственный бизнес.
Свой бизнес Александр начал в возрасте 18 лет. Он покупает овощи, фрукты, грецкие орехи  оптом и продает их в розницу.  Александр предприимчивый и трудолюбивый и поэтому его бизнес идет вверх.  Этот бизнес содержит семью.
Александр просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен для закупки грецкого ореха. На протяжении всей зимы он закупает грецкие орехи, перерабатывает  и тут же перепродает. Александр получит хорошую прибыль и улучшит благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Alexander is married.  His wife's name is Yelena, and they have a four-year-old son.  Alexander has his own business, which he started when he was just 18 years old.  He buys vegetables, fruits and walnuts wholesale and sells them retail.  Alexander is an entrepreneurial and hardworking person, and this is why his business is moving up.  This business supports his family.  Alexander is requesting a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia to buy walnuts.  He buys walnuts during winter, processes and resells them right away.  Alexander wants to make a good profit and improve his family's welfare.

loans.use: to purchase walnuts for retail sale

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is from the village of Gomi in East Georgia. She is 43 years old, married and lives with her family: her husband Vladimer, her daughter in law and 1 year old grandson. Naira works as a milkmaid on a local farm. Along with her main job, Naira is actively involved in operating the family farm. The family has 2 milk cows and 1 calf. They produce cheese and sell it locally. Also the family owns 0.80 hectare land, where maize and beans are grown. Total average monthly income of the family is 950 Laris. 

Naira requested credit to purchase 6-7 calves. He will grow the calves during winter months and sell them in spring for much higher price. It will bring to the family significant additional income, which will be used for improving family living conditions. Also Naira will use 10% of the loaned amount for covering her old loan, taken from Credo.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke rental business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy chairs and for the repair of her videoke unit.  Cheryl has been in this business for two years. Cheryl earns more income from a general store and pig fattening.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy chairs and for the repair of her videoke unit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 20 metres of school uniform material, 12 metres of seat covers and form rubber.

loans.name: Chati

texts.en:
Chati is 34-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in South Sudan for the past four years. 

Chati is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en: Mrs. Hieu is a hardworking woman, 25 years old. She is married and has a baby. Her family’s income is mainly from salary. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 22-year-old man with one child. 

He is single and operates a motorcycle taxi. He has been in the business for four years. This is his first loan with VisionFund. He will use the loan to buy another motorcycle. He will use anticipated profit from the business to save and buy another motorcycle. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a fleet of motorcycle taxis to be a major source of income.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Dress maker by trade, Madam Afi H. was born on 19th April 1968 at Aného. Her husband retired for 2 years, can only benefit from a meagre pension, again irregular and insufficient for the needs of the household while they are five (05) children under their control. So Madam Afi H. was launched since 4 years in the basic essential products and with the profit made, she succeeds as best as possible to contribute to the family needs. She has already benefited from two credits well repaid and deserves to be backed again. Madam Afi H. requests a third credit of $650 to enlarge her shop by the dishable products and to open a new ray of religious articles selling.

Couturière de formation, Madame H. Afi est née le 19 Avril 1968 à Aného. Son mari, retraité depuis 2 ans, ne touche qu’une maigre pension, encore irrégulière et insuffisante pour les besoins du foyer alors qu’ils ont cinq (05) enfants à encore supporter. Alors, Madame H. Afi s’est-elle lancée depuis 4 ans dans le commerce des produits de première nécessité et avec les profits réalisés, elle arrive tant que mal à contribuer aux besoins de la famille. Elle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits bien remboursés et mérite d’être encore soutenue Madame H. sollicite un troisième crédit de $650 pour agrandir sa boutique par des produits de vaisselle et ouvrir un nouveau rayon de vente d’articles religieux.

loans.use: To buy the dishable products and to open a new ray of religious articles selling.

loans.name: Tafale

texts.en: Tafale is a strong and a hard working woman.  Her business is a Retail shop.   Tafale was born on the 28th of July 1968.  She gave birth to seven children, four are in school and three are staying home.  Tafale comes from a family of eleven members.  Tafale has a strong heart for running her business and she has no doubt at all. She’s confident in running her business by herself.  Tafale's kids also help her if she’s not available.  Tafale provides the best service to her customers by ordering good quality products to sell at her shop.  Tafale's aim is to extend her shop into a wholesale business.  Tafale is capable of how to handle customer of what they want.  She uses her loan to buy more products to fill empty shelves and to buy iron roofing,paints to renovate her shop to attract  more customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for the retail shop

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo lives with his wife, Felipa Tambo, and their two children, in a small home that they own on the west side of La Paz. He has worked for a textile business in the city for the past 10 years, and his wife sells juices at a sales post in a local market. Their brick-and-adobe home has four rooms with a small terrace that has been difficult to construct. The loan Domingo is requesting would be used to finish the terrace as well as put on a roof and close off an area on the ground floor to be used as his son's bedroom. This is the first loan Domingo has requested, and his background shows he would be able to fulfill it.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Domingo H. vive en compañía de su esposa, la señora Felipa Tambo y sus dos hijos aun dependientes, en una pequeña casa de su propiedad en la zona 8 de Diciembre, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, Trabaja como empleado en una empresa textil de La Paz desde hace diez años y su esposa se dedica a la venta de jugos en un puesto de venta en un mercado de su zona. La vivienda del señor Domingo H. cuenta con cuatro habitaciones de adobe y ladrillo y con una pequeña terraza cuya construcción se encuentra en obra gruesa. El destino del crédito es para concluir dicha terraza y realizar el techado y cerramiento en planta baja para contar así con un dormitorio para su hijo. El señor Domingo H. será beneficiado por primera vez con un crédito en nuestra institución, y la evaluación socioeconómica muestra que tienen capacidad para cubrir su obligación crediticia.

loans.use: Construction on his home

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria M., a single mother of 5, works selling automobile accessories in the "July 16" market in the city of El Alto. She has been a Pro Mujer partner for approximately a year and a half. The injection of capital was essential in the establishment of Victoria's source of work and sustenance because of the size of her family.

During her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, Victoria applied for a loan of $200, which allowed her to stock her sales stall and collaborate with her eldest son. With the collaboration her son was able to enter the automobile motor and spare parts business. The loan was repaid in a period of 6 months, the maximum period for repayment.
