Her goal is to have well-equipped and comfortable premises, ready to attract the attention and desire to buy of those who approach them.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, perfume and clothes in larger quantities

loans.name: 'united Women Development' Group

texts.en:
Ruth K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'United Women Development'.  She is 41 years old, married, and has four children who are between the ages of 24 and 13 years old. Ruth was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of support.

Ruth has been selling soft drinks in the Coca Cola Factory Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia, for ten years. She plans to use her 9,000 LRD portion of this 45,000 LRD group loan to buy more drinks to resell. She describes herself a kind woman whose dreams are to improve her business and build a store.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Rosa Elva

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa, tiene 66 años de edad, hace varios años tuvo una relación y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, su hija menor vive en su casa con su pequeño nieto de seis años.

Tiene un salón de belleza  pero también se dedica al comercio, vende productos  de belleza por catálogos de Oriflame  cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas, ropa interior de Leoniza y joyas brasileñas de la marca Belesa.   Trabaja todos los días  en su local, vende   al por menor y mayor entregando  las joyas a otras personas para que ellas vendan, sus ventas son a  crédito a 15 días  o a un mes. Lo que es joyas compra en Guayaquil y la otra mercadería la recibe en su local de varios proveedores. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar: perfumes, bisutería, prendas íntimas, joyas brasileras entre  otros productos para abastecer su gabineta y bazar. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio del  mismo  y le gusta por el apoyo que le han brindado. Su sueño es tener una gran joyería.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the large amount of tamarind fruit which once could be found here, the members of the Mujeres Con Esperanza ("Hopeful Women") Communal Bank meet every two weeks.

Here we find Rosa, who is 66 years old. Several years ago she was in a relationship and now has five adult children. Her youngest daughter lives in Rosa's house with Rosa's little six-year-old grandson.

She has a beauty salon where she has a lot of business, but she also makes sales. She sells products by catalog from Oriflame (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for ladies), and lingerie from Leonisa, but what she sells most is Belesa brand Brazilian jewelry. Rosa works everyday, making sales in her shop. She sells both retail and wholesale because she delivers the jewelry to other people so they can sell it. Rosa extends credit to these people on either a two-week or monthly basis. She buys the jewelry in Guayaquil, and the other merchandise is delivered to her shop. The Brazilian jewelry is what she sells most.

Rosa will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, lingerie and Brazilian jewelry among other items. She has been in the communal bank from the beginning, and she likes it because of the support it has offered her. Her dream is to have a large jewelry store.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, costume jewelry, and lingerie for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is single and supports two children between 10 and 12 years old.  Elizabeth joined KADET through existing clients and has never borrowed from any other MFI. 

Elizabeth operates a butchery business and has been in operation for the last two years. She earns an income of KES 15,000 per month.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of KES. 20,000 to buy more stock of meat for sale.  Elizabeth will use the anticipated profits to educate the children she supports.  Elizabeth hopes to expand her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: purchase more meat for sale

loans.name: Cristina Felicidad

texts.es: La Sra.  Cristina se dedica a la Confeccion de ropa de distintos tipos, ya sea para varón o para mujer, como también al arreglo y  reducción de tamaño  en pantalones y camisas, cambio d ecuellos, cambio de cierres,  principalmente su actividad lo realiza en su domicilio para lo cual solicita el crédito para la compra de una maquina collereta la que le permitirá realizar trabajos de mejor calidad, ya tiene bastante clientela y es una persona muy conocida en el barrio por el buen trabajo que realiza , vive en su domicilio con su esposo y su hija  de dos años, es una persona muy trabajadora y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cristina works as a seamstress and makes all kinds of clothing for men and women.  She also does alterations on trousers and shirts, and changes collars and zippers.  She mainly works out of her home and is requesting a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine to improve on work quality.

She has many customers and is very well-known in the neighborhood for the good job she does.  Cristina lives with her husband and two-year-old daughter.  She is a hard worker and grateful to the institution for the support received.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a rice farmer. She tills her own land located in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 10 years. Nelia works hard to earn from the farm because it is the only source of income her family has. Nelia has 5 children, 4 of whom still go to school. She wants them to finish college and have bright futures.

Nelia's loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to start a new business to help augment her family's income.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: As a married parent of eight children, Marivic works hard to support her family. She has a business selling perfumes in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from Kiva's partner, NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family. Marivic is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of perfume to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more perfumes to sell

loans.name: Lai

texts.en: Lai, age 50, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Lai is a housewife while her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The standard of living has improved since Lai has had this business. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase cows to help plow the rice fields. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cows to help plow the rice field.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is married and has one child.  She has been farming for three years in Kitale area of Western Kenya. She employs one farmhand and her farm produces fish, eggs, and poultry birds. Ruth is requesting her second loan for 40,000 KES to purchase more poultry birds. She says the proceeds will help improve her family's living standards and enable her to purchase more land for farming. Ruth says constant price fluctuations are the greatest challenge in the business.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married with 3 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She sells many different products in her general store to earn a living, and has had this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns about $235 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more products for her general store. Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes, sugar, maize flour, salt, cooking fat and sweets.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El señor Raul trabaja como portero de lunes a viernes en una iglesia de la ciudad  y también se dedica a la venta de libros tanto usados como nuevos. El crédito lo requiere para cancelar los impuestos de la casa de sus padres y de esta manera ayudarles. Vive en la casa de sus padres  misma queda ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos anteriores que se le otorgaron, pues así pudo afianzar más su negocio de venta de libros.
texts.en: Raul works from Monday to Friday as a caretaker in a church in the city.  He also sells new and used books.  He needs this loan to pay the taxes on his parents' house and help them in this way.  He lives in his parents' home which is located in the Sopocachi district of the city of La Paz.  Raul is single and doesn't have any children.  He has been very happy with the previous loans that he has received as they helped him to further strengthen his book sales business.

loans.use: to pay annual taxes on his parents' house

loans.name: Nzega Group

texts.en:
Asma, who is in her early 30s is married with two children who go to school.  She's been running a charcoal business for two years now. She works from 7 a.m to 8p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more sacks of charcoal, helped with household expenses and she's paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.  Her dream is to one day be able to buy a land.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Nzega" which is comprised of a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a client who is 30-years-old, married and has three children. His family lives in the village of Maligaya Echague, and they are known as good personal references in their community.

Alex offers a motorcycle service, and at the same time he raises pigs. His motorcycle is a public transportation service in their community and surrounding area, and he has done this for three years. 

He is asking for a loan of P10,000. He will invest in motorcycle maintenance, particularly in changing the wheels and old sprocket of his motorcycle. Some of the proceeds will be also be used to buy feed for his pigs. This loan will help him improve his business, give his children a good education and provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy a wheel and sprocket for his motorcycle and feed for his hog raising business

loans.name: Gayane

texts.ru:
Гаянэ 45 лет, она проживает в городе Ванадзоре вместе с мужем и тремя сыновьями. Муж Гаянэ работает на Ванадзорском Химическом заводе, младший сын учится в школе, средний недавно вернулся из армии, а старший сын окончил институт в этом году и в данный момент занят поиском работы. 
Гаянэ арендует помещение на Ванадзорской ярмарке и торгует женской, мужской и детской одеждой. 2-3 раза в месяц, Гаянэ и ее коллеги по торговле арендуют автомобиль и едут за товаром в Ереван. Гаянэ говорит, что наибольшим спросом пользуется детская и женская одежда, поэтому из мужской одежды она продает только майки и сорочки. 
Гаянэ необходим кредит на сумму 700.000 для покупки одежды в преддверии начала нового учебного года.
texts.en: Gayane is 45 years old.  She lives in the city of Vanadzor with her husband and three sons.  Gayane's husband works at the Vanadzor Chemical plant, the youngest son goes to school, the middle son recently returned from the army, and the oldest graduated from a university this year and is currenly looking for work.  Gayane leases a space at the Vanadzor market and sells women's, men's and children's clothing 2-3 times per month.  Gayane and her work colleagues rent a car and go to Yerevan for merchandise.  She says that children's and women's clothing have the highest demand, and that is why she only sells undergarments out of men's clothing.  Gayane needs a loan in the sum of 700,000 for the purchase of clothing in anticipation of the start of a new school year.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for the new school year

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is married and has 2 children. She has been through junior high school. She sells clothes and panties at Akotokyir, a village in Abura. This is a business that she has had for 11 years. Her husband is a driver. The income she makes from her sales is added to that of her spouse to take care of the children. The loan money, when received, will be used to purchase other kinds of clothes to bring variety into the business.

loans.use: to purchase other kinds of clothes to bring variety into the business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
This is Estrella, 58, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Angelo, her business partner, and is the mother of two children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Estrella operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located near the roadside of their community. She also earns additional income from room rental payments in her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Estrella hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be with her Relatives in Canada. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, 50, lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Editha with her husband  has a  motorcycle transport  business where her husband operates their motorcycle and a food shop that sells chicken and pork barbecue in the afternoon session. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for chicken barbecue and help for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

Editha has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for chicken barbecue.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata est une commerçante qui vie dans une localité proche de la capitale du Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis presque une dizaine d’années. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en cahiers, stylo, livre, crayons, sacs. Avec ce prêt elle compte avoir une bénéfice qui lui permettra de se lancé à la construction de sa cantine qu'elle a commencé en ville ce qui lui permettra d'être plus visible sur le marché. Elle veut au aider son mari dans les dépenses de la maisons.
texts.en: Aminata is a trader who lives in a town near the capital of Senegal.  She has been trading for almost ten years.  She is requesting this loan to strengthen her stock of merchandise (exercise books, pens, books, pencils and bags).  With this loan, she expects to make enough profits to work on building a store that she has started in town.  This will allow her to be more visible in the market.  She would also like to help her husband with their household expenses.

loans.use: to increase her stock (by purchasing merchandise)

loans.name: Cecilia Del Socorro

texts.es: A sus 52 años de edad Cecilia es una mujer y madre emprendedora que siempre se ha preocupado por el bienestar de sus 3 hijos, desde hace algún tiempo Cecilia tiene un negocio donde vende helados y comidas, y aunque es pequeño hoy sueña con verlo crecer y progresar, para ello quiere comprar un vehículo donde transportar estos alimentos y vender sus productos de una manera más formal, más cómoda, y con más espacio que le permita producir en mayor cantidad, sin embargo Cecilia no cuenta con el capital necesario para hacer las adecuaciones que su negocio necesita para el progreso, como: comprar ese vehículo de transporte que es un carro donde llevar y exhibir la comida, comprar insumos para la preparación de alimentos y adecuar espacialmente su negocio; por lo cual hoy solicita un préstamo con el cual pueda ayudarle a su hijo económicamente con sus estudios, ya que el crédito le permitirá incrementar notablemente sus ingresos y su calidad de vida mejorará proporcionalmente.
texts.en: At 52 years old, Cecilia is an enterprising woman and mother who has always been concerned about the well-being of her 3 children. For some time now, Cecilia has been operating a business selling food and ice cream. Although it is small today, she dreams of seeing it grow and make progress. For this reason, she wants to buy a vehicle to transport her food and sell her products in a more formal and convenient manner. More space will also allow her to produce in greater quantity. However, Cecilia does not have the necessary capital to make the necessary improvements to her business in order to make progress, such as: buying this transport vehicle, which is a cart she will use to transport and display the food; buying supplies to prepare food; and making improvements to her business location. Because of this, today she is requesting a loan which will allow her to help her son economically with his studies, since the loan will permit her to increase her income significantly, and her quality of life will improve accordingly.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing food, buy a food cart and make improvements to her business location.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a hardworking businesswoman, age 29 and married. For the last two years, she has been running a retail shop and a grocery business to make a living. Her potential customers are passersby and local residents. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Esther dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and fruits for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour and fruits.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is engaged in farming. Teofila primarily grows rice crops to sell. She requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Teofila hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She hopes to have a stable income to help sustain her children's education.

In the future, Teofila hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ruteete Twimuke Group

texts.en:
Teddy is a 60-year old single parent with six children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children and finish work on her house. 

She owns a boutique that she started ten years ago and faces a challenge of bad debtors. In spite of this, she is determined to transform her business into a big boutique specializing in children and women's wear. Teddy needs the loan to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Floreta

texts.en:
Floreta is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children. 
Floreta makes and peddles snacks like breads, pancakes, and rice cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.
Floreta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Floreta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, aged 32, is married and blessed with one child, aged two. He practices dairy farming which he has been doing for four years. The business earns him a monthly income of Kshs.15,000.

This is his first loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the loan funds to buy cattle feed, hay, and deworming medicine for the cattle. He hopes to be a large scale dairy farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed, deworming medicine, and hay

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma nació en la ciudad del Sicuani de la provincia de Canchis y tiene 29 años edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Irma vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, Perú.    
 
Irma se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera como por ejemplo carpetas, sillas, mesas y otras cosas más,  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Irma requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo madera, cola de carpintero, clavos y otras cosas que se necesitan para la elaboración de muebles.

Irma es nueva integrante del banco comunal “Pillao”. Este  grupo está conformado con 13 socios que viven  en la provincia de Cusco del distrito de San Jerónimo.
texts.en:
Irma was born in the city of Sicuani in the province of Canchis. She is 29 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage, from which she has two children. Currently, Irma lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru.

Irma makes wood furniture such as desks, chairs, tables, and other items. She has already been doing this work for several years, and it's going very well for her. Irma needs the loan to buy materials such as wood, carpenter's glue, nails, and other items needed to make furniture.

Irma is a new member of the "Pillao" communal bank. This group is made up of 13 members who live in the province of Cusco in the district of San Jerónimo.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wood, carpenter's glue, nails, and other items needed to make furniture.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 19-year-old young man who is the youngest of his brothers and sisters. He is majoring in Engineering at Al Albait University. He is planning to get a job in the engineering field after graduating so he can gain experience and then open his own engineering office.
Ahmad has applied for a loan to pay for his semester’s fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester’s fees.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon is an old client to the organization; he carries out cattle fattening which he has done for over 20 years. He is taking a loan of 3.000.000 UGX. He is a 47-year-old man, a widower with 7 children with 5 of the children still attending school. He comes from a village in Buhunga sub-county, Rukungiri district. He took this loan to buy more cows to graze and sell such that he can increase his income. His dream is to expand his business to greater heights and with this loan from Ugafode, Benon is hopeful his business is going to expand.

loans.use: To buy cows to graze and sell.

loans.name: Rebeca's Group

texts.en:
Rebeca lives in a home with mud walls, dirt floor, and an iron roof in Kopudo village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya with her family which includes 6 children. The community of Kopudo village collects their drinking water from the local spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Kopudo’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. In Kopudo, 27 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Rebeca has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water to keep themselves and their families healthy. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Benter, Felix, Walter, and Joseph.

Kopudo village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Rebeca believes that the dispenser will help to reduce water-borne diseases in the community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Rebeca’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Moti

texts.en:
Moti, age 51 a widow resides in the Koraput district of Odisha. She is a housewife and lives with her children in a small village in a small house. In the daytime, she supports her children in the agricultural activities of the family. She also is the part of a group of her village. She decided to take up loans for financially supporting her families. She take up alternate income-generating activities that would help her in contributing to her household income. Moti wanted to support her children by growing additional cash crops like vegetables in addition to the paddy and other crops they rely on. These vegetables are in high demand in the market, and the area is known for its high quality of vegetables. 

She has requested this loan so she can take up such activities to support her families. She will use her loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other necessary things for her farmland.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other necessary things for her farmland

loans.name: Hipolita Del Socorro

texts.es: HIPOLITA DEL SOCORRO: Es una mujer sonriente y emprendedora de 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar. Su esposo trabaja de manera formal en una institución del gobierno central. Ella es originaria de Chinandega, se trasladó la Ciudad de Bilwi desde hace 10 años con el objetivo mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ha establecido una pequeña pulpería, de esta manera cuenta con su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuye con los gastos del hogar, educación de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar más mercadería para su pulpería y así poder incrementar sus ingresos y de esa manera poder también mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su sueño es ser una comerciante exitosa.

loans.use: para comprar más mercadería para su pulpería

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Beth wants to buy 2 dairy goats, fertilizers, seeds and pay the laborers.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa I. is from the village of Fasitoo-uta.  She was born on the 13th August 1971. Her business project is sewing her family's clothes and other people's.  She is very happy of her talents because it helps her to develop her family.  She is a woman of so many talents but she likes sewing the most.  I. said she could sew more than twenty clothes a day plus her own materials to sell.  She believes that her project is very unique.   She has no doubt of doing it.  I. is using her loan to help her buy tools to fix her sewing machine when it becomes damaged.   She believes that she will become a better businesswoman in future.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, threads, and additional tools for sewing

loans.name: Norma Verónica

texts.en:
Veronica is married and has a 2-year-old child. Her husband is a chauffeur in a restaurant and his salary is minimal. To obtain an extra income and be able to construct her house, Veronica started her own business selling floral arrangements. Her own mother-in-law, who owns a similar business, helped her start the business. Veronica learned the trade from her mother-in-law but then decided to be independent to further increase her profits.

At this time, Veronica requests a loan of $200 dollars to invest in the purchase of necessary material for the production of her floral arrangements. She intends to pay back her loan within 4-8 months. Veronica looks forward to the growth of her business and greatly appreciates your sincerity and support in making this possible.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como chofer en un restauran y su salario es muy bajo, para obtener un ingreso extra y poder construir su casa, Vero inició su propio negocio vendiendo arreglos florales, inició ayudándole a su suegra que tiene un negocio similar, ahí Vero aprendió el oficio y decidió independizarse para obtener mejores ganancias.

En estos momentos, Vero requiere de un préstamo por $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra del material necesario para la elaboración de sus arreglos florales, ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Ella quiere hacer crecer su negocio y gracias a ti puede ser posible, Vero agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase consumables

loans.name: Enahon

texts.en: Enahon is 42 years old and has 4 children. She is married, but her husband does not work and does not pay any attention to the family. Enahon carries all of the responsibility for the well-being of her family. Recently, Enahon's youngest daughter was really ill. After diagnosis, it was found out that she has serious heart disease. She had an operation, and now Enahon looks after her at home. In the central market she rented a place where she trades women's and children's clothes. Her elder daughter (in the photo) helps her to trade. In the morning, she displays the goods on a counter and trades until the evening. Enahon has been with Microinvest for 2 years, and during this time her business has increased several times. She plans to use her new loan to increase the assortment of summer clothes.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of summer clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more trousers for resale and fund a new stall location for his second-hand clothing business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Mr. Juan is 59 years old and married. He has a small ceramics factory in his home, where he manufactures tiles and regular and hollow bricks. He has been dedicated to this activity for more than 30 years. He has a fixed client base. The loans that the Fundacion Paraguaya gave him permitted Juan to expand his business to a larger physical area sufficient for a large quantity of production.

One of his short term objectives is to buy a 4 cylinder vehicle to transport his raw materials and his products. This way he will avoid paying the costly freight charges that diminish his potential. In order to do this he will need some income. Therefore he is pursuing one of his other projects by soliciting a loan from Fundacion Paraguaya to realize his goal. He requests a loan for the purchase of raw materials in order to satisfy the demand of his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Juan tiene 59 años es casado y tiene una pequeña fabrica de cerámica en su domicilio, dónde fabrica, tejas, ladrillo común y ladrillo hueco, esta dedicado a la actividad hace mas de 30 años, posee clientela fija que son los principales depósitos de materiales de la zona. Los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya le permitió hacer crecer su negocio ya que el cuenta con buen espacio físico lo suficiente como para almacenar gran cantidad de producción.

Uno de sus objetivos a corto plazo es comprarse un vehiculo de por lo menos 4 toneladas, para transporta sus materias prima y también su producción, con esto evitara pagar los costosos fletes que hace disminuir su utilidad, para el efecto necesitará de un capital y dentro de su proyectos ésta la de solicitar un préstamo a la Fundación Paraguaya para concretar su objetivo. Ahora solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima de modo a satisfacer las demandas de los clientes.

loans.use: To buy firewood and clay

loans.name: Nancy Helida

texts.en:
With a true entrepreneurial spirit and excellent business sense, Nancy is successfully combining her past professional experiences with innovative ideas in the form of a multiservice center. Located in downtown Ayacucho, Peru, Nancy’s small business is has a state-of-the-art photocopy machine, public telephones, cell phone services, and a small grocery store. She opened her independent business eight months ago and already the customers are coming in droves to take advantage of the many services Nancy’s business offers. 

Growing up, Nancy’s father owned a small public telephone business. She spent the majority of her life helping her father with the many daily chores that go into the maintenance of an independent business, learning the ropes. When Nancy got married and had two babies, it became very clear that although her husband worked very hard, his meager income was simply not sufficient to raise a healthy family. She decided it was time to become more economically independent and increase her contribution to the family.  She sold her home, took out a loan, and set to work establishing her new business. Using the experience she gained from years of observing her father as a foundation, Nancy built her business to not only incluD. public telephones, but cell phones, a copy machine, and a grocery store. 

Although Nancy is very pleased with the quick and obvious success of her business, she has bigger dreams she wishes to accomplish. Her space is very small and she is working toward the purchase of a much larger location to house even more services. The economic boosts she receives from her local bank, combined with her hard work and dedication, has given Nancy the ability to realize her greatest dreams.  She is currently requesting a loan of $400. With this money, she will buy more supplies for her grocery store and larger quantities of phone cards.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her grocery store and larger quantities of phone cards

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
Teddy is a 40 year-old woman. She is married with three children.
Her current business is making and selling bricks.  Teddy intends to renovate her rental houses from the profits made out of the business.

loans.use: To buy land where she can make bricks for sale.

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
Mr. Donald F. sells produce. At first, he sold them around the streets of Chinandega. As time went by, he decided to get a loan in order to build his own stand. He's been at this same spot for 15 years.

Donald F. tells us that thanks to CEPRODEL, he's been able to improve his lifestyle and his economic situation.

His local stand is not in the best conditions, there are no walls but he doesn't lose hope of one day being able to improve his situation.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Donald F. se dedica a la actividad de venta de verduras. En un inicio oferta sus productos ambulante en la ciudad de Chinandega. En el transcurso del tiempo decide solicitar financiamiento para instalar su negocio en un local propio en el mercado Bisne el cual le fue otorgado y aquí se encuentra ubicado hasta ahora desde hace 15 años.

Donald F. comenta que el aporte económico que la ha brindado CEPRODEL ha sido decisivo en el desarrollo de su actividad ya que le ha permitido mejorar la calidad de vida y sobre todo ha mejorado la difícil situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado su familia.

Actualmente su local no tiene buenas condiciones el y no hay paredes pero no pierde la esperanza en que algún día mejorara estas condiciones.

loans.use: Purchase of produce and improve her business

loans.name: Mohammad Jan

texts.en: Mohammad Jan lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married. He is a butcher. He has a shop in one of the crowded markets of Kabul. He works very hard to improve his business and he has a good number of customers. He supplies meat for all restaurants in the market, so he has requested an individual loan to complete his inventory and enlarge his shop to make good income and help his family. He is happy with all parts of his family.

loans.use: To complete his inventory

loans.name: Miguela

texts.es:
Miguela A. is 34 years old, and is married to Reinerio Boagrín, who is 42. The couple has two daughters aged 8 and 15. The youngest is in school, while the oldest is in secondary school.

Miguela owns a pantry where she sells all sorts of basic, everyday food products. She started up her business with a small amount of capital, which has grown thanks to loans and savings which Miguela has been acquiring.

In time, Miguela also invested her money and bought a television set and Playstation and now, in addition to the pantry, she also rents video games, charging by the hour. This is quite a popular service for the youngsters and children, who are her main customers.

Miguela hopes to continue developing her business, and her future project is rearing chickens, but she lacks capital and the infrastructure to do this. Now she is requesting a loan to buy stock for her pantry.

Miguela is stepping up her efforts as she wants to provide her daughters with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Miguela A. de 34 años es esposa de Reinerio Bogarín de 42 años, el matrimonio tienen dos hijas de 8 y 15 años, la primera va a la escuela mientras que la otra ya va al colegio.

Doña Miguela es dueña de una despensa donde comercializa todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad y comestibles. Ella comenzó su negocio con un pequeño capital el cual fue aumentando gracias a créditos y ahorros que Miguela fue adquiriendo.

Con el tiempo, Miguela también invirtió su dinero en la compra de un televisor y un play station, y ahora, además de la despensa, también tiene alquiler de video juegos, en donde cobra por hora; este negocio del alquiler de juegos es bastante popular entre los jóvenes y niños que son sus principales clientes.

Miguela desea seguir creciendo, su proyecto en el futuro es también dedicarse a la cría de pollos, pero para ello aun le falta el capital y la infraestructura para hacerlo. Hoy día ella esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de mercaderías para su despensa.

Miguela redobla sus esfuerzos pues desea darle a sus hijas una buena educación.

loans.use: To buy oil, flour, sugar, eggs, milk, noodles, sweets, rice, fizzy drinks, tinned products etc.

loans.name: Ayyub

texts.en: Ayyub Q. is  a 52-year-old farmer living in Imishli, Azerbaijan. He has lived in the same small village his entire life. For the past 12 years, he has earned a living by selling the milk and yogurt he produces from a dairy cow. To expand his business, he has applied for a loan of $1,200 U.S. dollars to purchase three calves to raise.

loans.use: To buy four calves for a small dairy farm

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Lenor and her family have decided to acquire a quarry to extract the clay they need for their brick making business. Brick making is the main source of income and welfare of her family. Her wish is to improve her manufacturing conditions and thus to make more money and increase her supplies in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Leonor y su familia decidieron adquirir una cantera para extraer la arcilla necesaria y dedicarse en conjunto a la fabricación de ladrillos. Ésta actividad es la principal fuente de ingreso y bienestar de su familia y su deseo es mejorar sus condiciones de fabricación para elaborar mayores cantidades y elevar su oferta en el mercado.

loans.use: Purchase of a clay quarry to improve a brick making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, oil, yeast, butter, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, cocoa, dried fruit and raisins

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The sale of farm produce such as cocoa is a profitable trade for Esther E.. Esther is thirty-two years old and married with four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She learned the trade for a year. She has been in business since 2001. She sells the cocoa pods to people in her community.

Esther is a LAPO client. She needs a loan in the amount of US$ 450 to buy more cocoa for sale. She expresses her gratitude to all.

loans.use: To buy  more cocoa for sale

loans.name: Alfoncia

texts.es:
Alfoncia is a member of the Comunal Bank Señor de Luren.

Alfoncia is separated from her husband; she is 67 years old and has 5 children. She lives in the traditional neighborhood of Belén. Alfoncia travels to the Paras fair located 5 hours away from the city of Ayacucho every 15 days to sell groceries. At the fair, she also purchases cheeses, cereals, animals and fish, which she then sells on foot at the Nery García market. She also sells door to door in residential areas or at stores.

Alfoncia needs a loan of $475 USD. She plans to use the money to purchase rice, sugar, pasta, and cereal. Alfoncia's dreams that her last son be a young professional, with a secure job. She also hopes to help her grandchildren so they can study and would like her business to improve.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Alfoncia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren.

Alfoncia es separada, tiene 67 años y 5 hijos, Alfonsia vive en el barrio tradicional de Belén, Alfoncia viaja a la feria de Paras que se ubica a 5 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, a donde viaja cada 15 días en donde vende abarrotes y de la feria compra quesos, cereales, animales, trucha que posteriormente lo vende de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García y si también vende de casa en casa o tiendas.

Alfoncia necesita un préstamo de 1350 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo y cereales. Los sueños de Alfoncia son que su hijo ultimo sea profesional, tenga un trabajo seguro, ayudar a sus nietos para que estudien y su negocio mejore.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, pasta and cereal

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana inició el negocio para tener un ingreso propio, y contar con dinero propio para sus gastos personales sin tener un trabajo con un horario fijo, ya que sus hijos aun están chicos, por eso decidió ponerse a vender cosméticos por catalogo para no descuidarlos, ya que con el ingreso de su esposo, solo alcanza para los gastos familiares. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 8 años, la invito una amiga a vender, y su esposo le financio el monto para iniciarse y poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $1025 que pagara en 6 meses para terminar el local, poner la loza y tener venta más directa, contando con producto para vender, además de que incluirá venta de regalos para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana began her business in order to have her own income and to have the status of her own money for her personal expenses, without a job with a fixed schedule because her children were still little. Because of this she decided to begin selling cosmetics by catalogue in order to not neglect her children, and with the income of her husband, only had to cover the family expenses. She began about 8 years ago, invited by a friend to sell. And her husband financed the sum to begin and little by little she has managed to move ahead. She needs a loan of US $1025 that she would repay in 6 months in order to finish the location, to include china, and to have more direct sales with merchandise to sell, also to include sales of gifts in order to obtain more income.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel her business location

loans.name: Lorena Ramona

texts.es:
Doña Lorena Ramona D., tiene 59 años de edad su estado civil es casada  tiene 4 hijos, ninguno de sus hijos depende ella; su compañero de vida trabaja conduciendo un taxi, ella distribuye mercadería general ropa y calzado  uno de sus propósitos es mantener la actividad en un 100% atendiendo así las necesidades  de sus clientes de esta forma podrá obtener sus ingreso propio que hasta los momentos a sido el que a suministro del  el sustentó de su familia  mas  la pequeña contribución que el esposo aporta.

En cuanto a su actividad económica siendo esta la venta de ropa variada, calzado nacional el cual compra en Managua, y comercializa en mercados locales y clientes fijos tiene aproximadamente 6 años de ejercer, el cual da inicio como una alternativa al desempleo a la fecha ha sido un medio importante dentro de los ingresos para la familia debido a las diferentes situaciones económicas en las que se ha encontrado, El destino del financiamiento  fue para hacer las compras para el capital de trabajo como es La compra de ropa, calzado y cosméticos para poder mejorar su negocio teniendo una variedad de productos. Teniendo la necesidad de incrementar su inventario y quizás mas adelante instalar un negocio fijo, en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Doña Lorena Ramona D. is 59 years old, married and has 4 children, all of whom are independent. Her life companion works as a taxi driver. She is a distributor of clothes and shoes. Doña Lorena’s intention is to maintain 100% of her business activity serving her customers’ needs in such a way that she will make enough money to supplement the small amount that her partner earns.

For about 6 years, Doña Lorena has been engaged in the business of buying a variety of clothes and shoes in Managua and selling them in local markets. She started this work as an alternative to unemployment, and the income it has generated has been important to the family in difficult economic times. She plans to use the working capital to purchase clothes, shoes and cosmetics to increase the variety of products that she sells. She needs to increase her inventory and maybe later she will set up a stationary business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise
